They are the things you get ashamed of, because words diminish them -- words shrink things that seemed limitless when they were in your head to no more than living size when they're brought out. But it's more than that, isn't it? The most important things lie too close to wherever your secret heart is buried, like landmarks to a treasure your enemies would love to steal away. And you may make revelations that cost you dearly only to have people look at you in a funny way, not understanding what you've said at all, or why you thought it was so important that you almost cried while you were saying it. That's the worst, I think. When the secret stays locked within not for want of a teller but for want of an understanding ear.
808.author: Stephen King

809.quote:
Love conquers all," Aphrodite promised. "Look at Helen and Paris. Did they let anything come between them?"
"Didn't they start the Trojan War and get thousands of people killed?"
"Pfft. That's not the point. Follow your heart.
809.author: Rick Riordan,

810.quote:
Simplicity, patience, compassion.
These three are your greatest treasures.
Simple in actions and thoughts, you return to the source of being.
Patient with both friends and enemies,
you accord with the way things are.
Compassionate toward yourself,
you reconcile all beings in the world.
810.author: Lao Tzu,

811.quote: Will looked horrified. "What kind of monster could possibly hate chocolate?
811.author: Cassandra Clare,

812.quote: The road to hell is paved with adverbs.
812.author: Stephen King,

813.quote: What you seek is seeking you.
813.author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

814.quote: Fire is catching! And if we burn, you burn with us!
814.author: Suzanne Collins,

815.quote: People generally see what they look for, and hear what they listen for.
815.author: Harper Lee,

816.quote: The town was paper, but the memories were not.
816.author: John Green,

817.quote: Love is a fire. But whether it is going to warm your hearth or burn down your house, you can never tell.
817.author: Joan Crawford

818.quote: I was never really insane except upon occasions when my heart was touched.
818.author: Edgar Allan Poe

819.quote: Let there be spaces in your togetherness, And let the winds of the heavens dance between you. Love one another but make not a bond of love: Let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls. Fill each other's cup but drink not from one cup. Give one another of your bread but eat not from the same loaf. Sing and dance together and be joyous, but let each one of you be alone, Even as the strings of a lute are alone though they quiver with the same music. Give your hearts, but not into each other's keeping. For only the hand of Life can contain your hearts. And stand together, yet not too near together: For the pillars of the temple stand apart, And the oak tree and the cypress grow not in each other's shadow.
819.author: Khalil Gibran,

820.quote: You haven't got a letter on yours," George observed. "I suppose she thinks you don't forget your name. But we're not stupid-we know we're called Gred and Forge.
820.author: J.K. Rowling,

821.quote: Freedom is not worth having if it does not include the freedom to make mistakes.
821.author: Mahatma Gandhi

822.quote: I am a badass, and I recognize that you, too, are a badass.
822.author: Cassandra Clare

823.quote: I will not say: do not weep; for not all tears are an evil.
823.author: J.R.R. Tolkien,

824.quote: Death must be so beautiful. To lie in the soft brown earth, with the grasses waving above one's head, and listen to silence. To have no yesterday, and no tomorrow. To forget time, to forgive life, to be at peace.
824.author: Oscar Wilde,

825.quote: Fear doesn't shut you down; it wakes you up
825.author: Veronica Roth,

826.quote: Live, travel, adventure, bless, and don't be sorry.
826.author: Jack Kerouac

827.quote: I cannot remember the books I've read any more than the meals I have eaten; even so, they have made me.
827.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

828.quote: Life's under no obligation to give us what we expect.
828.author: Margaret Mitchell

829.quote: Life should not be a journey to the grave with the intention of arriving safely in a pretty and well preserved body, but rather to skid in broadside in a cloud of smoke, thoroughly used up, totally worn out, and loudly proclaiming "Wow! What a Ride!
829.author: Hunter S. Thompson,

831.quote: The worst part of holding the memories is not the pain. It's the loneliness of it. Memories need to be shared.
831.author: Lois Lowry,

832.quote: But I know, somehow, that only when it is dark enough can you see the stars.
832.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

834.quote: If you look for perfection, you'll never be content.
834.author: Leo Tolstoy,

835.quote: Nobody can hurt me without my permission.
835.author: Mahatma Gandhi

836.quote: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
836.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

837.quote: Books are the mirrors of the soul.
837.author: Virginia Woolf,

838.quote: Sometimes people don't want to hear the truth because they don't want their illusions destroyed.
838.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

839.quote: I did then what I knew how to do. Now that I know better, I do better.
839.author: Maya Angelou

840.quote: Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city.
840.author: George Burns

841.quote:
Peter would probably throw a party if I stopped breathing.'

'Well,' he says, 'I would only go if there was cake.
841.author: Veronica Roth,

842.quote: It kills me sometimes, how people die.
842.author: Markus Zusak,

843.quote:
My dear,
Find what you love and let it kill you.
Let it drain you of your all. Let it cling onto your back and weigh you down into eventual nothingness.
Let it kill you and let it devour your remains.
For all things will kill you, both slowly and fastly, but it's much better to be killed by a lover.
~ Falsely yours
843.author: Kinky Friedman

844.quote: Everyone seems to have a clear idea of how other people should lead their lives, but none about his or her own.
844.author: Paulo Coelho,

846.quote: Nobody likes being alone that much. I don't go out of my way to make friends, that's all. It just leads to disappointment.
846.author: Haruki Murakami,

847.quote: It is good to love many things, for therein lies the true strength, and whosoever loves much performs much, and can accomplish much, and what is done in love is well done.
847.author: Vincent Van Gogh

848.quote: You are the answer to every prayer I've offered. You are a song, a dream, a whisper, and I don't know how I could have lived without you for as long as I have.
848.author: Nicholas Sparks,

849.quote: The past is a place of reference, not a place of residence; the past is a place of learning, not a place of living.
849.author: Roy T. Bennett,

850.quote: Be patient toward all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves, like locked rooms and like books that are now written in a very foreign tongue. Do not now seek the answers, which cannot be given you because you would not be able to live them. And the point is, to live everything. Live the questions now. Perhaps you will then gradually, without noticing it, live along some distant day into the answer.
850.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

851.quote: If pain must come, may it come quickly. Because I have a life to live, and I need to live it in the best way possible. If he has to make a choice, may he make it now. Then I will either wait for him or forget him.
851.author: Paulo Coelho,

852.quote: I read so I can live more than one life in more than one place.
852.author: Anne Tyler

853.quote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched. They must be felt with the heart
853.author: Helen Keller

854.quote: There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humor.
854.author: Charles Dickens,

855.quote: I hate to hear you talk about all women as if they were fine ladies instead of rational creatures. None of us want to be in calm waters all our lives.
855.author: Jane Austen,

856.quote: I don't know if you've ever felt like that. That you wanted to sleep for a thousand years. Or just not exist. Or just not be aware that you do exist. Or something like that. I think wanting that is very morbid, but I want it when I get like this. That's why I'm trying not to think. I just want it all to stop spinning.
856.author: Stephen Chbosky,

857.quote: None of us really changes over time. We only become more fully what we are.
857.author: Anne Rice,

858.quote: Be careful of love. It'll twist your brain around and leave you thinking up is down and right is wrong.
858.author: Rick Riordan,

859.quote: Wrinkles should merely indicate where the smiles have been.
859.author: Mark Twain

860.quote: And perhaps it is the greater grief, after all, to be left on earth when another is gone.
860.author: Madeline Miller,

861.quote: Words are, of course, the most powerful drug used by mankind.
861.author: Rudyard Kipling

862.quote: The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it.
862.author: Flannery O'Connor

863.quote: Don't order any of the faerie food," said Jace, looking at her over the top of his menu. "It tends to make humans a little crazy. One minute you're munching a faerie plum, the next minute you're running naked down Madison Avenue with antlers on your head. Not," he added hastily, "that this has ever happened to me.
863.author: Cassandra Clare,

864.quote:
I think... if it is true that 
there are as many minds as there 
are heads, then there are as many 
kinds of love as there are hearts.
864.author: Leo Tolstoy,

865.quote: What I say is, a town isn't a town without a bookstore. It may call itself a town, but unless it's got a bookstore, it knows it's not foolin' a soul.
865.author: Neil Gaiman,

866.quote: People haven't always been there for me but music always has.
866.author: Taylor Swift

867.quote: You probably wouldn't worry about what people think of you if you could know how seldom they do.
867.author: Olin Miller

868.quote: I can feel Peeta press his forehead into my temple and he asks, 'So now that you've got me, what are you going to do with me?' I turn into him. 'Put you somewhere you can't get hurt.
868.author: Suzanne Collins,

869.quote: It's not denial. I'm just selective about the reality I accept.
869.author: Bill Watterson

870.quote: Sometimes crying or laughing are the only options left, and laughing feels better right now.
870.author: Veronica Roth,

871.quote:
I have something I need to tell you," he says. I run my fingers along the tendons in his hands and look back at him. "I might be in love with you." He smiles a little. "I'm waiting until I'm sure to tell you, though."
"That's sensible of you," I say, smiling too. "We should find some paper so you can make a list or a chart or something."
I feel his laughter against my side, his nose sliding along my jaw, his lips pressing my ear.
"Maybe I'm already sure," he says, "and I just don't want to frighten you."
I laugh a little. "Then you should know better."
"Fine," he says. "Then I love you.
871.author: Veronica Roth,

872.quote: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
872.author: Marcus Aurelius,

874.quote: Life becomes easier and more beautiful when we can see the good in other people.
874.author: Roy T. Bennett

875.quote: The world as we have created it is a process of our thinking. It cannot be changed without changing our thinking.
875.author: Albert Einstein

876.quote: Fantasy is escapist, and that is its glory. If a soldier is imprisioned by the enemy, don't we consider it his duty to escape?. . .If we value the freedom of mind and soul, if we're partisans of liberty, then it's our plain duty to escape, and to take as many people with us as we can!
876.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

878.quote: Music was my refuge. I could crawl into the space between the notes and curl my back to loneliness.
878.author: Maya Angelou

879.quote: Let us be grateful to the people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
879.author: Marcel Proust

880.quote: Never say goodbye because goodbye means going away and going away means forgetting.
880.author: J.M. Barrie,

881.quote: It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness.
881.author: Leo Tolstoy,

882.quote: Everything is possible. The impossible just takes longer.
882.author: Dan Brown,

883.quote: Friendship is the hardest thing in the world to explain. It's not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.
883.author: Muhammad Ali

884.quote: Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.
884.author: Alexander Pope

885.quote: Vanity and pride are different things, though the words are often used synonymously. A person may be proud without being vain. Pride relates more to our opinion of ourselves, vanity to what we would have others think of us.
885.author: Jane Austen,

886.quote: Let no man pull you so low as to hate him.
886.author: Martin Luther King Jr.,

887.quote: War is what happens when language fails.
887.author: Margaret Atwood

888.quote: None but ourselves can free our minds.
888.author: Bob Marley

889.quote: Angry, and half in love with her, and tremendously sorry, I turned away.
889.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,

890.quote: Woke up this morning with a terrific urge to lie in bed all day and read.
890.author: Raymond Carver

891.quote: Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast.
891.author: Lewis Carroll,

892.quote: The truth is, unless you let go, unless you forgive yourself, unless you forgive the situation, unless you realize that the situation is over, you cannot move forward.
892.author: Steve Maraboli,

893.quote: Without deviation from the norm, progress is not possible.
893.author: Frank Zappa

894.quote: Sometimes you make choices in life and sometimes choices make you.
894.author: Gayle Forman,

895.quote: He who has a why to live for can bear almost any how.
895.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

896.quote: The most painful thing is losing yourself in the process of loving someone too much, and forgetting that you are special too.
896.author: Ernest Hemingway,

897.quote: Ever had a flying burrito hit you? Well, it's a deadly projectile, right up there with cannonballs and grenades.
897.author: Rick Riordan,

898.quote: You can spend minutes, hours, days, weeks, or even months over-analyzing a situation; trying to put the pieces together, justifying what could've, would've happened... or you can just leave the pieces on the floor and move the fuck on.
898.author: Tupac Shakur

899.quote:
I've got a stele we can use. Who wants to do me?"
"A regrettable choice of words," muttered Magnus.
899.author: Cassandra Clare,

900.quote: Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up.
900.author: James A. Baldwin

901.quote: Do what is right, not what is easy nor what is popular.
901.author: Roy T. Bennett,

902.quote: Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do.
902.author: Benjamin Spock

903.quote: Each friend represents a world in us, a world possibly not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.
903.author: Anais Nin,

904.quote: You pierce my soul. I am half agony, half hope...I have loved none but you.
904.author: Jane Austen,

905.quote: If you want to be happy, do not dwell in the past, do not worry about the future, focus on living fully in the present.
905.author: Roy T. Bennett,

906.quote: It's all right to love someone who doesn't love you back, as long as they're worth you loving them. As long as they deserve it.
906.author: Cassandra Clare,

907.quote: I may die young, but at least I'll die smart.
907.author: John Green,

909.quote:
He must have known I'd want to leave you."
"No, he must have known you would always want to come back.
909.author: J.K. Rowling,

910.quote:
Don't talk to me."
"Why not?"
"Because I want to fix that in my memory for ever. Draco Malfoy, the amazing bouncing ferret...
910.author: J.K. Rowling,

911.quote: Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky.
911.author: Rabindranath Tagore,

912.quote: I don't want to repeat my innocence. I want the pleasure of losing it again.
912.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,

913.quote: It's like everyone tells a story about themselves inside their own head. Always. All the time. That story makes you what you are. We build ourselves out of that story.
913.author: Patrick Rothfuss,

914.quote: You know, Minister, I disagree with Dumbledore on many counts...but you cannot deny he's got style...
914.author: J.K. Rowling,

915.quote: People say nothing is impossible, but I do nothing every day.
915.author: A.A. Milne,

916.quote: When love is not madness it is not love.
916.author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca

917.quote: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
917.author: Roy T. Bennett,

918.quote: Life has no meaning. Each of us has meaning and we bring it to life. It is a waste to be asking the question when you are the answer.
918.author: Joseph Campbell

919.quote: Who said nights were for sleep?
919.author: Marilyn Monroe

920.quote: It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.
920.author: Herman Melville

921.quote: Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home.
921.author: Anna Quindlen,

922.quote: Let us step into the night and pursue that flighty temptress, adventure.
922.author: J.K. Rowling,

923.quote: This moment will just be another story someday.
923.author: Stephen Chbosky,

924.quote: That's the problem with drinking, I thought, as I poured myself a drink. If something bad happens you drink in an attempt to forget; if something good happens you drink in order to celebrate; and if nothing happens you drink to make something happen.
924.author: Charles Bukowski,

925.quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
925.author: Lao Tzu

926.quote: Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.
926.author: Henry David Thoreau,

927.quote: Do not fear to be eccentric in opinion, for every opinion now accepted was once eccentric.
927.author: Bertrand Russell

928.quote: Sometimes our light goes out, but is blown again into instant flame by an encounter with another human being.
928.author: Albert Schweitzer

929.quote: There are wounds that never show on the body that are deeper and more hurtful than anything that bleeds.
929.author: Laurell K. Hamilton,

930.quote: Beauty is terror. Whatever we call beautiful, we quiver before it.
930.author: Donna Tartt,

931.quote: If you go home with somebody, and they don't have books, don't fuck 'em!
931.author: John Waters

932.quote: How many slams in an old screen door? Depends how loud you shut it. How many slices in a bread? Depends how thin you cut it. How much good inside a day? Depends how good you live 'em. How much love inside a friend? Depends how much you give 'em.
932.author: Shel Silverstein

933.quote: Fear of a name increases fear of the thing itself.
933.author: J.K. rowling,

934.quote: Sometimes fate is like a small sandstorm that keeps changing directions. You change direction but the sandstorm chases you. You turn again, but the storm adjusts. Over and over you play this out, like some ominous dance with death just before dawn. Why? Because this storm isn't something that blew in from far away, something that has nothing to do with you. This storm is you. Something inside of you. So all you can do is give in to it, step right inside the storm, closing your eyes and plugging up your ears so the sand doesn't get in, and walk through it, step by step. There's no sun there, no moon, no direction, no sense of time. Just fine white sand swirling up into the sky like pulverized bones. That's the kind of sandstorm you need to imagine. And you really will have to make it through that violent, metaphysical, symbolic storm. No matter how metaphysical or symbolic it might be, make no mistake about it: it will cut through flesh like a thousand razor blades. People will bleed there, and you will bleed too. Hot, red blood. You'll catch that blood in your hands, your own blood and the blood of others. And once the storm is over you won't remember how you made it through, how you managed to survive. You won't even be sure, in fact, whether the storm is really over. But one thing is certain. When you come out of the storm you won't be the same person who walked in. That's what this storm's all about.
934.author: Haruki Murakami,

935.quote:
One of the Silent Brothers is here to see you. Hodge sent me to wake you up. Actually he offered to wake you himself, but since it's 5 a.m., I figured you'd be less cranky if you had something nice to look at."
"Meaning you?"
"What else?
935.author: Cassandra Clare,

936.quote: Once you can accept the universe as matter expanding into nothing that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes easy.
936.author: Albert Einstein

937.quote: When life gives you lemons, squirt someone in the eye.
937.author: Cathy Guiswite

938.quote: The most beautiful experience we can have is the mysterious. It is the fundamental emotion that stands at the cradle of true art and true science.
938.author: Albert Einstein,

939.quote: We are not necessarily doubting that God will do the best for us; we are wondering how painful the best will turn out to be.
939.author: C.S. Lewis

940.quote:
there is a loneliness in this world so great
that you can see it in the slow movement of
the hands of a clock.

people so tired
mutilated
either by love or no love.

people just are not good to each other
one on one.

the rich are not good to the rich
the poor are not good to the poor.

we are afraid.

our educational system tells us
that we can all be
big-ass winners.

it hasn't told us
about the gutters
or the suicides.

or the terror of one person
aching in one place
alone

untouched
unspoken to

watering a plant.
940.author: Charles Bukowski,

941.quote:
You guessed? You must have been pretty sure, considering you could have killed me."
"I was ninety percent sure."
"I see," Clary said. There must have been something in her voice, because he turned to look at her. Her hand cracked across his face, a slap that rocked him back on his heels. He put his hands on his cheek, more in surprise than pain.
"What the hell was that for?"
"The other ten percent.
941.author: Cassandra Clare,

942.quote: It is more fun to talk with someone who doesn't use long, difficult words but rather short, easy words like "What about lunch?
942.author: A. A. Milne,

943.quote: We do not need magic to transform our world. We carry all the power we need inside ourselves already.
943.author: J.K. Rowling

944.quote: People think dreams aren't real just because they aren't made of matter, of particles. Dreams are real. But they are made of viewpoints, of images, of memories and puns and lost hopes.
944.author: Neil Gaiman

945.quote: What you must understand about me is that I'm a deeply unhappy person.
945.author: John Green,

946.quote: Begin at the beginning," the King said, very gravely, "and go on till you come to the end: then stop.
946.author: Lewis Carroll,

947.quote: I loved her against reason, against promise, against peace, against hope, against happiness, against all discouragement that could be.
947.author: Charles Dickens,

948.quote: Pursue what catches your heart, not what catches your eyes.
948.author: Roy T. Bennett,

949.quote: Don't grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form.
949.author: Rumi

950.quote: God will not look you over for medals, degrees or diplomas but for scars.
950.author: Elbert Hubbard

951.quote: It always shocked me when I realized that I wasn't the only person in the world who thought and felt such strange and awful things.
951.author: John Green,

952.quote: The things you do for yourself are gone when you are gone, but the things you do for others remain as your legacy.
952.author: Kalu Ndukwe Kalu

953.quote: What is hell? I maintain that it is the suffering of being unable to love.
953.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky,

954.quote: In heaven, all the interesting people are missing.
954.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

955.quote: Women who seek to be equal with men lack ambition.
955.author: Timothy Leary

956.quote:
Let everything happen to you
Beauty and terror
Just keep going
No feeling is final
956.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

957.quote: Tell the truth, or someone will tell it for you.
957.author: Stephanie Klein,

958.quote:
Keep Going

Your hardest times often lead to the greatest moments of your life. Keep going. Tough situations build strong people in the end.
958.author: Roy T. Bennett,

959.quote: A brave man acknowledges the strength of others.
959.author: Veronica Roth,

960.quote: Nothing is so painful to the human mind as a great and sudden change.
960.author: Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley,

961.quote: If cats looked like frogs we'd realize what nasty, cruel little bastards they are. Style. That's what people remember.
961.author: Terry Pratchett,

962.quote: Art is the lie that enables us to realize the truth.
962.author: Pablo Picasso

963.quote:
Life is for the living.
Death is for the dead.
Let life be like music. 
And death a note unsaid.
963.author: Langston Hughes,

964.quote: Some people have lives; some people have music.
964.author: John Green,

965.quote: No mourners. No funerals. Among them, it passed for 'good luck.
965.author: Leigh Bardugo,

966.quote: I wanted the whole world or nothing.
966.author: Charles Bukowski,

967.quote: Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go.
967.author: Oscar Wilde (attributed to)

968.quote: No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow.
968.author: Alice Walker

969.quote: There may be times when we are powerless to prevent injustice, but there must never be a time when we fail to protest.
969.author: Elie Wiesel

970.quote: Think left and think right and think low and think high. Oh, the thinks you can think up if only you try!
970.author: Dr. Seuss

971.quote: The best way to find out if you can trust somebody is to trust them.
971.author: Ernest Hemingway

972.quote: The scariest moment is always just before you start.
972.author: Stephen King,

973.quote: Well, it seems to me that the best relationships - the ones that last - are frequently the ones that are rooted in friendship. You know, one day you look at the person and you see something more than you did the night before. Like a switch has been flicked somewhere. And the person who was just a friend is... suddenly the only person you can ever imagine yourself with.
973.author: Gillian Anderson

974.quote: There is nothing noble in being superior to your fellow man; true nobility is being superior to your former self.
974.author: Ernest Hemingway

975.quote: Some old wounds never truly heal, and bleed again at the slightest word.
975.author: George R.R. Martin,

976.quote:
Why are they all staring?" demanded Albus as he and Rose craned around to look at the other students.
"Don't let it worry you," said Ron. "It's me. I'm extremely famous.
976.author: J.K. Rowling,

977.quote:
Finnick?" I say, "Maybe some pants?"
He looks down at his legs as if noticing his outfit for the first time. Then he whips off his hospital gown leaving him in just his underwear. "Why? Do you find this" -- he strikes a ridiculously provocative pose -- "distracting?"
I laugh. Boggs looks embarrassed and Finnick looks more like the guy I met at the Quarter Quell
977.author: Suzanne Collins,

978.quote: If you like her, if she makes you happy, and if you feel like you know her---then don't let her go.
978.author: Nicholas Sparks,

979.quote: I suppose I'll have to add the force of gravity to my list of enemies.
979.author: Lemony Snicket,

980.quote: Perhaps when we find ourselves wanting everything, it is because we are dangerously close to wanting nothing.
980.author: sylvia plath

981.quote:
Can I help you with something?"
Clary turned instant traitor against her gender. "Those girls on the other side of the car are staring at you."
Jace assumed an air of mellow gratification. "Of course they are," he said, "I am stunningly attractive.
981.author: Cassandra Clare,

982.quote: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.
982.author: Albert Einstein

984.quote:
The minute I heard my first love story,
I started looking for you, not knowing
how blind that was.
Lovers don't finally meet somewhere.
They're in each other all along.
984.author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi,

985.quote: You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them.
985.author: Maya Angelou,

986.quote: The only way to find true happiness is to risk being completely cut open.
986.author: Chuck Palahniuk,

988.quote: Only a true best friend can protect you from your immortal enemies.
988.author: Richelle Mead,

989.quote: I am coming to terms with the fact that loving someone requires a leap of faith, and that a soft landing is never guaranteed.
989.author: Sarah Dessen,

990.quote: All I ever wanted was to reach out and touch another human being not just with my hands but with my heart.
990.author: Tahereh Mafi,

991.quote: If I were not a physicist, I would probably be a musician. I often think in music. I live my daydreams in music. I see my life in terms of music.
991.author: Albert Einstein

992.quote: We know what we are, but not what we may be.
992.author: William Shakespeare

993.quote: There is no surer foundation for a beautiful friendship than a mutual taste in literature.
993.author: P.G. Wodehouse

994.quote: A painter should begin every canvas with a wash of black, because all things in nature are dark except where exposed by the light.
994.author: Leonardo da Vinci

995.quote: Nowadays people know the price of everything and the value of nothing.
995.author: Oscar Wilde,

996.quote: I will have you without armor, Kaz Brekker. Or I will not have you at all.
996.author: Leigh Bardugo,

997.quote: It has been said, 'time heals all wounds.' I do not agree. The wounds remain. In time, the mind, protecting its sanity, covers them with scar tissue and the pain lessens. But it is never gone.
997.author: Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy

998.quote:
Mom says it's because she has PMS.
Do you even know what that means?
"I'm not a little kid anymore. It means pissed-at- men syndrome
998.author: Nicholas Sparks,

999.author: Lao Tzu,

1000.quote: Some things don't last forever, but some things do. Like a good song, or a good book, or a good memory you can take out and unfold in your darkest times, pressing down on the corners and peering in close, hoping you still recognize the person you see there.
1000.author: Sarah Dessen,

1001.quote: Everybody is identical in their secret unspoken belief that way deep down they are different from everyone else.
1001.author: David Foster Wallace,

1002.quote: The true soldier fights not because he hates what is in front of him, but because he loves what is behind him.
1002.author: G.K. Chesterton

1003.quote: Follow your inner moonlight; don't hide the madness.
1003.author: Allen Ginsberg

1004.quote: I'd said it before and meant it: Alive or undead, the love of my life was a badass.
1004.author: Richelle Mead,

1005.quote: The Guide says there is an art to flying", said Ford, "or rather a knack. The knack lies in learning how to throw yourself at the ground and miss.
1005.author: Douglas Adams,

1006.quote: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.
1006.author: Marcus Aurelius,

1007.quote: True love is rare, and it's the only thing that gives life real meaning.
1007.author: Nicholas Sparks,

1008.quote: If you don't imagine, nothing ever happens at all.
1008.author: John Green,

1009.quote: Weeds are flowers, too, once you get to know them.
1009.author: A.A. Milne

1010.quote: A poem begins as a lump in the throat, a sense of wrong, a homesickness, a lovesickness.
1010.author: Robert Frost

1011.quote: I suspect the truth is that we are waiting, all of us, against insurmountable odds, for something extraordinary to happen to us.
1011.author: Khaled Hosseini,

1012.quote:
Why is it," he said, one time, at the subway entrance, "I feel I've known you so many years?"
"Because I like you," she said, "and I don't want anything from you.
1012.author: Ray Bradbury,

1013.quote: There are no facts, only interpretations.
1013.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

1014.quote: People aren't born good or bad. Maybe they're born with tendencies either way, but its the way you live your life that matters.
1014.author: Cassandra Clare,

1015.quote: Declarations of love amuse me. Especially when unrequited.
1015.author: Cassandra Clare,

1016.quote: I love you more than there are stars in the sky and fish in the sea.
1016.author: Nicholas Sparks

1017.quote: I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived. I did not wish to live what was not life, living is so dear; nor did I wish to practise resignation, unless it was quite necessary. I wanted to live deep and suck out all the marrow of life, to live so sturdily and Spartan-like as to put to rout all that was not life, to cut a broad swath and shave close, to drive life into a corner, and reduce it to its lowest terms...
1017.author: Henry David Thoreau

1018.quote: Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese.
1018.author: G.K. Chesterton,

1019.quote: I have the choice of being constantly active and happy or introspectively passive and sad. Or I can go mad by ricocheting in between.
1019.author: Sylvia Plath,

1020.quote: A woman's heart should be so hidden in God that a man has to seek Him just to find her.
1020.author: Max Lucado

1021.quote: I don't want to be at the mercy of my emotions. I want to use them, to enjoy them, and to dominate them.
1021.author: Oscar Wilde,

1022.quote: Even the darkest night will end and the sun will rise.
1022.author: Victor Hugo,

1023.quote: Break my heart. Break it a thousand times if you like. It was only ever yours to break anyway.
1023.author: Kiera Cass,

1024.quote: Pain is temporary. Quitting lasts forever.
1024.author: Lance Armstrong Sally Jenkins,

1025.quote: Music is a total constant. That's why we have such a strong visceral connection to it, you know? Because a song can take you back instantly to a moment, or a place, or even a person. No matter what else has changed in your or the world, that one song says the same, just like that moment.
1025.author: Sarah Dessen,

1026.quote: Dumbledore says people find it far easier to forgive others for being wrong than being right.
1026.author: J.K. Rowling,

1027.quote: The silence depressed me. It wasn't the silence of silence. It was my own silence.
1027.author: Sylvia Plath,

1028.quote: but for my own part, if a book is well written, I always find it too short.
1028.author: Jane Austen

1029.quote:
There are no happy endings.
Endings are the saddest part, 
So just give me a happy middle
And a very happy start.
1029.author: Shel Silverstein,

1030.quote: It's kind of fun to do the impossible.
1030.author: Walt Disney

1031.quote:
Investigation?" Isabelle laughed. "Now we're detectives? Maybe we should all have code names."
"Good idea," said Jace. "I shall be Baron Hotschaft Von Hugenstein.
1031.author: Cassandra Clare,

1032.quote: Do I not destroy my enemies when I make them my friends?
1032.author: Abraham Lincoln

1033.quote: Don't be afraid of your fears. They're not there to scare you. They're there to let you know that something is worth it.
1033.author: C. JoyBell C.

1034.quote: And the rest is rust and stardust.
1034.author: Vladimir Nabokov,

1035.quote: Worry does not empty tomorrow of its sorrow, it empties today of its strength.
1035.author: Corrie Ten Boom,

1036.quote: A woman has to live her life, or live to repent not having lived it.
1036.author: D.H. Lawrence,

1037.quote:
For me, trees have always been the most penetrating preachers. I revere them when they live in tribes and families, in forests and groves. And even more I revere them when they stand alone. They are like lonely persons. Not like hermits who have stolen away out of some weakness, but like great, solitary men, like Beethoven and Nietzsche. In their highest boughs the world rustles, their roots rest in infinity; but they do not lose themselves there, they struggle with all the force of their lives for one thing only: to fulfil themselves according to their own laws, to build up their own form, to represent themselves. Nothing is holier, nothing is more exemplary than a beautiful, strong tree. When a tree is cut down and reveals its naked death-wound to the sun, one can read its whole history in the luminous, inscribed disk of its trunk: in the rings of its years, its scars, all the struggle, all the suffering, all the sickness, all the happiness and prosperity stand truly written, the narrow years and the luxurious years, the attacks withstood, the storms endured. And every young farmboy knows that the hardest and noblest wood has the narrowest rings, that high on the mountains and in continuing danger the most indestructible, the strongest, the ideal trees grow.

 Trees are sanctuaries. Whoever knows how to speak to them, whoever knows how to listen to them, can learn the truth. They do not preach learning and precepts, they preach, undeterred by particulars, the ancient law of life.

 A tree says: A kernel is hidden in me, a spark, a thought, I am life from eternal life. The attempt and the risk that the eternal mother took with me is unique, unique the form and veins of my skin, unique the smallest play of leaves in my branches and the smallest scar on my bark. I was made to form and reveal the eternal in my smallest special detail.

 A tree says: My strength is trust. I know nothing about my fathers, I know nothing about the thousand children that every year spring out of me. I live out the secret of my seed to the very end, and I care for nothing else. I trust that God is in me. I trust that my labor is holy. Out of this trust I live.

 When we are stricken and cannot bear our lives any longer, then a tree has something to say to us: Be still! Be still! Look at me! Life is not easy, life is not difficult. Those are childish thoughts. Let God speak within you, and your thoughts will grow silent. You are anxious because your path leads away from mother and home. But every step and every day lead you back again to the mother. Home is neither here nor there. Home is within you, or home is nowhere at all.

 A longing to wander tears my heart when I hear trees rustling in the wind at evening. If one listens to them silently for a long time, this longing reveals its kernel, its meaning. It is not so much a matter of escaping from one's suffering, though it may seem to be so. It is a longing for home, for a memory of the mother, for new metaphors for life. It leads home. Every path leads homeward, every step is birth, every step is death, every grave is mother.

 So the tree rustles in the evening, when we stand uneasy before our own childish thoughts: Trees have long thoughts, long-breathing and restful, just as they have longer lives than ours. They are wiser than we are, as long as we do not listen to them. But when we have learned how to listen to trees, then the brevity and the quickness and the childlike hastiness of our thoughts achieve an incomparable joy. Whoever has learned how to listen to trees no longer wants to be a tree. He wants to be nothing except what he is. That is home. That is happiness.
1037.author: Herman Hesse,

1038.quote: When I was a little girl I used to read fairy tales. In fairy tales you meet Prince Charming and he's everything you ever wanted. In fairy tales the bad guy is very easy to spot. The bad guy is always wearing a black cape so you always know who he is. Then you grow up and you realize that Prince Charming is not as easy to find as you thought. You realize the bad guy is not wearing a black cape and he's not easy to spot; he's really funny, and he makes you laugh, and he has perfect hair.
1038.author: Taylor Swift

1039.quote: Live to the point of tears.
1039.author: Albert Camus

1040.quote: Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind.
1040.author: Henry James

1041.quote: The most important kind of freedom is to be what you really are. You trade in your reality for a role. You trade in your sense for an act. You give up your ability to feel, and in exchange, put on a mask. There can't be any large-scale revolution until there's a personal revolution, on an individual level. It's got to happen inside first.
1041.author: Jim MORRISON

1042.quote:
Look again at that dot. That's here. That's home. That's us. On it everyone you love, everyone you know, everyone you ever heard of, every human being who ever was, lived out their lives. The aggregate of our joy and suffering, thousands of confident religions, ideologies, and economic doctrines, every hunter and forager, every hero and coward, every creator and destroyer of civilization, every king and peasant, every young couple in love, every mother and father, hopeful child, inventor and explorer, every teacher of morals, every corrupt politician, every "superstar," every "supreme leader," every saint and sinner in the history of our species lived there-on a mote of dust suspended in a sunbeam.

The Earth is a very small stage in a vast cosmic arena. Think of the endless cruelties visited by the inhabitants of one corner of this pixel on the scarcely distinguishable inhabitants of some other corner, how frequent their misunderstandings, how eager they are to kill one another, how fervent their hatreds. Think of the rivers of blood spilled by all those generals and emperors so that, in glory and triumph, they could become the momentary masters of a fraction of a dot.

Our posturings, our imagined self-importance, the delusion that we have some privileged position in the Universe, are challenged by this point of pale light. Our planet is a lonely speck in the great enveloping cosmic dark. In our obscurity, in all this vastness, there is no hint that help will come from elsewhere to save us from ourselves.

The Earth is the only world known so far to harbor life. There is nowhere else, at least in the near future, to which our species could migrate. Visit, yes. Settle, not yet. Like it or not, for the moment the Earth is where we make our stand.

It has been said that astronomy is a humbling and character-building experience. There is perhaps no better demonstration of the folly of human conceits than this distant image of our tiny world. To me, it underscores our responsibility to deal more kindly with one another, and to preserve and cherish the pale blue dot, the only home we've ever known.
1042.author: Carl Sagan,

1043.quote:
Do you think I'm pretty?
I think you're beautiful
Beautiful?
You are so beautiful, it hurts sometimes.
1043.author: Richelle Mead,

1044.quote: You never fail until you stop trying.
1044.author: Albert Einstein

1045.quote: What are men to rocks and mountains?
1045.author: Jane Austen,

1046.quote: There is a stubbornness about me that never can bear to be frightened at the will of others. My courage always rises at every attempt to intimidate me.
1046.author: Jane Austen,

1047.quote: Beware; for I am fearless, and therefore powerful.
1047.author: Mary Shelley,

1048.quote: It's not the load that breaks you down, it's the way you carry it.
1048.author: Lou Holtz

1049.quote:
What's this?" he demanded, looking from Clary to his companions, as if they might know what she was doing there.
"It's a girl," Jace said,recovering his composure. "Surely you've seen girls before, Alec. Your sister Isabelle is one.
1049.author: Cassandra Clare,

1050.quote: There comes a time when one must take a position that is neither safe, nor politic, nor popular, but he must take it because conscience tells him it is right.
1050.author: Martin Luther King Jr.,

1051.quote:
You know," Gabriel said, "there was a time I thought we could be friends, Will."

"There was a time I thought I was a ferret," Will said, "but that turned out to be the opium haze. Did you know it had that effect? Because I didn't.
1051.author: Cassandra Clare,

1052.quote: The most wasted of all days is one without laughter.
1052.author: Nicolas Chamfort

1053.quote: In the darkness, two shadows, reaching through the hopeless, heavy dusk. Their hands meet, and light spills in a flood like a hundred golden urns pouring out of the sun.
1053.author: Madeline Miller,

1054.quote: Make improvements, not excuses. Seek respect, not attention.
1054.author: Roy T. Bennett,

1055.quote: She'd laughed, and if he could have bottled the sound and gotten drunk on it every night, he would have. It terrified him.
1055.author: Leigh Bardugo,

1056.quote: There's plenty of sense in nonsense sometimes, if you wish to look for it.
1056.author: Cassandra Clare,

1057.quote:
You smell good, too, said Patch

It's called a shower. I was staring straight ahead. When he didn't answer, I turned sideways. Soap. Shampoo. Hot water.

Naked. I know the drill.
1057.author: Becca Fitzpatrick,

1058.quote: I think we dream so we don't have to be apart for so long. If we're in each other's dreams, we can be together all the time.
1058.author: A.A. Milne,

1059.quote: If writers wrote as carelessly as some people talk, then adhasdh asdglaseuyt[bn[ pasdlgkhasdfasdf.
1059.author: Lemony Snicket,

1060.quote: Learn to light a candle in the darkest moments of someone's life. Be the light that helps others see; it is what gives life its deepest significance.
1060.author: Roy T. Bennett,

1061.quote: He is half of my soul, as the poets say.
1061.author: Madeline Miller,

1062.quote: Find what you love and let it kill you.
1062.author: Charles Bukowski

1063.quote: I was smiling yesterday,I am smiling today and I will smile tomorrow.Simply because life is too short to cry for anything.
1063.author: Santosh Kalwar,

1064.quote: I mean, if the relationship can't survive the long term, why on earth would it be worth my time and energy for the short term?
1064.author: Nicholas Sparks,

1065.quote: The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends.
1065.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

1066.quote: Books are for people who wish they were somewhere else.
1066.author: Mark Twain

1067.quote:
You'll stay with me?'
Until the very end,' said James.
1067.author: J. K. Rowling,

1068.quote: All the darkness in the world cannot extinguish the light of a single candle.
1068.author: St. Francis Of Assisi,

1069.quote:
Some say the world will end in fire,
Some say in ice.
From what I've tasted of desire,
I hold with those who favor fire. 
But if it had to perish twice
I think I know enough of hate
To say that for destruction ice
Is also great
And would suffice.
1069.author: Robert Frost

1070.quote: Walk as if you are kissing the Earth with your feet.
1070.author: Thich Nhat Hanh,

1071.quote: My life amounts to no more than one drop in a limitless ocean. Yet what is any ocean, but a multitude of drops?
1071.author: David Mitchell,

1072.quote: There is no real ending. It's just the place where you stop the story.
1072.author: Frank Herbert

1073.quote: Everything tells me that I am about to make a wrong decision, but making mistakes is just part of life. What does the world want of me? Does it want me to take no risks, to go back to where I came from because I didn't have the courage to say "yes" to life?
1073.author: Paulo Coelho,

1074.quote: I love you. Remember. They cannot take it
1074.author: Lauren Oliver,

1075.quote: I read a book one day and my whole life was changed.
1075.author: Orhan Pamuk,

1076.quote: If I can stop one heart from breaking, I shall not live in vain.
1076.author: Emily Dickinson

1077.quote: Success is liking yourself, liking what you do, and liking how you do it.
1077.author: Maya Angelou

1078.quote: She wasn't bitter. She was sad, though. But it was a hopeful kind of sad. The kind of sad that just takes time.
1078.author: Stephen Chbosky,

1079.quote: That's part of what I like about the book in some ways. It portrays death truthfully. You die in the middle of your life, in the middle of a sentence
1079.author: John Green,

1080.quote: I lived in books more than I lived anywhere else.
1080.author: Neil Gaiman,

1081.quote:
The paradox of our time in history is that we have taller buildings but shorter tempers, wider Freeways, but narrower viewpoints. We spend more, but have less, we buy more, but enjoy less. We have bigger houses and smaller families, more conveniences, but less time. We have more degrees but less sense, more knowledge, but less judgment, more experts, yet more problems, more medicine, but less wellness.

We drink too much, smoke too much, spend too recklessly, laugh too little, drive too fast, get too angry, stay up too late, get up too tired, read too little, watch TV too much, and pray too seldom. We have multiplied our possessions, but reduced our values. We talk too much, love too seldom, and hate too often.

We've learned how to make a living, but not a life. We've added years to life not life to years. We've been all the way to the moon and back, but have trouble crossing the street to meet a new neighbor. We conquered outer space but not inner space. We've done larger things, but not better things.

We've cleaned up the air, but polluted the soul. We've conquered the atom, but not our prejudice. We write more, but learn less. We plan more, but accomplish less. We've learned to rush, but not to wait. We build more computers to hold more information, to produce more copies than ever, but we communicate less and less.

These are the times of fast foods and slow digestion, big men and small character, steep profits and shallow relationships.

These are the days of two incomes but more divorce, fancier houses, but broken homes. These are days of quick trips, disposable diapers, throwaway morality, one night stands, overweight bodies, and pills that do everything from cheer, to quiet, to kill. It is a time when there is much in the showroom window and nothing in the stockroom. A time when technology can bring this letter to you, and a time when you can choose either to share this insight, or to just hit delete...

Remember, to spend some time with your loved ones, because they are not going to be around forever. Remember, say a kind word to someone who looks up to you in awe, because that little person soon will grow up and leave your side.

Remember, to give a warm hug to the one next to you, because that is the only treasure you can give with your heart and it doesn't cost a cent.

Remember, to say, "I love you" to your partner and your loved ones, but most of all mean it. A kiss and an embrace will mend hurt when it comes from deep inside of you.

Remember to hold hands and cherish the moment for someday that person might not be there again. Give time to love, give time to speak! And give time to share the precious thoughts in your mind.
1081.author: Bob Moorehead,

1082.quote: Love is an irresistible desire to be irresistibly desired.
1082.author: Robert Frost

1083.quote: Reading one book is like eating one potato chip.
1083.author: Diane Duane,

1084.quote: I have heard there are troubles of more than one kind. Some come from ahead and some come from behind. But I've bought a big bat. I'm all ready you see. Now my troubles are going to have troubles with me!
1084.author: Dr. Seuss

1085.quote: I am not sure that I exist, actually. I am all the writers that I have read, all the people that I have met, all the women that I have loved; all the cities I have visited.
1085.author: Jorge Luis Borges

1086.quote: Start each day with a positive thought and a grateful heart.
1086.author: Roy T. Bennett,

1087.quote:
How did you die?"
"We er....drowned in a bathtub."
"All three of you?"
"It was a big bathtub.
1087.author: Rick Riordan,

1088.quote: If you want to forget something or someone, never hate it, or never hate him/her. Everything and everyone that you hate is engraved upon your heart; if you want to let go of something, if you want to forget, you cannot hate.
1088.author: C. JoyBell C.

1089.quote:
Hope
Smiles from the threshold of the year to come, 
Whispering 'it will be happier'...
1089.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

1090.quote: I fell in love with her courage, her sincerity, and her flaming self respect. And it's these things I'd believe in, even if the whole world indulged in wild suspicions that she wasn't all she should be. I love her and it is the beginning of everything.
1090.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

1091.quote: Writing is a socially acceptable form of schizophrenia.
1091.author: E.L. Doctorow

1092.quote: Start writing, no matter what. The water does not flow until the faucet is turned on.
1092.author: Louis L'Amour

1093.quote: Remember that wherever your heart is, there you will find your treasure.
1093.author: Paulo Coelho,

1094.quote: A classic is a book that has never finished saying what it has to say.
1094.author: Italo Calvino,

1095.quote:
To see a World in a Grain of Sand 
And a Heaven in a Wild Flower, 
Hold Infinity in the palm of your hand 
And Eternity in an hour.
1095.author: William Blake,

1097.quote: No thief, however skillful, can rob one of knowledge, and that is why knowledge is the best and safest treasure to acquire.
1097.author: L. Frank Baum,

1098.quote: What would men be without women? Scarce, sir...mighty scarce.
1098.author: Mark Twain

1099.quote: Of all forms of caution, caution in love is perhaps the most fatal to true happiness.
1099.author: Bertrand Russell,

1100.quote: Cinderella? Snow White? What's that? An illness?
1100.author: J.K. Rowling,

1101.quote: And that's the thing about people who mean everything they say. They think everyone else does too.
1101.author: Khaled Hosseini,

1102.quote: You know, one of the tragedies of real life is that there is no background music.
1102.author: Annie Proulx

1103.quote: All endings are also beginnings. We just don't know it at the time.
1103.author: Mitch Albom,

1104.quote: I believe the universe wants to be noticed. I think the universe is inprobably biased toward the consciousness, that it rewards intelligence in part because the universe enjoys its elegance being observed. And who am I, living in the middle of history, to tell the universe that it-or my observation of it-is temporary?
1104.author: John Green,

1105.quote: The more I see, the less I know for sure.
1105.author: John Lennon

1106.quote: It is a curious thought, but it is only when you see people looking ridiculous that you realize just how much you love them.
1106.author: Agatha Christie,

1107.quote: I was within and without, simultaneously enchanted and repelled by the inexhaustible variety of life.
1107.author: Fitzgerald F. Scott,

1108.quote:
Name one hero who was happy."
I considered. Heracles went mad and killed his family; Theseus lost his bride and father; Jason's children and new wife were murdered by his old; Bellerophon killed the Chimera but was crippled by the fall from Pegasus' back.
"You can't." He was sitting up now, leaning forward.
"I can't."
"I know. They never let you be famous AND happy." He lifted an eyebrow. "I'll tell you a secret."
"Tell me." I loved it when he was like this.
"I'm going to be the first." He took my palm and held it to his. "Swear it."
"Why me?"
"Because you're the reason. Swear it."
"I swear it," I said, lost in the high color of his cheeks, the flame in his eyes.
"I swear it," he echoed.
We sat like that a moment, hands touching. He grinned.
"I feel like I could eat the world raw.
1108.author: Madeline Miller,

1109.quote: Treat everyone with politeness and kindness, not because they are nice, but because you are.
1109.author: Roy T. Bennett,

1111.quote: Everyone has talent. What's rare is the courage to follow it to the dark places where it leads.
1111.author: Erica Jong

1112.quote: An intellectual says a simple thing in a hard way. An artist says a hard thing in a simple way.
1112.author: Charles Bukowski

1113.quote: There was nowhere to go but everywhere, so just keep on rolling under the stars.
1113.author: Jack Kerouac,

1115.quote: It was books that made me feel that perhaps I was not completely alone. They could be honest with me, and I with them.
1115.author: Cassandra Clare,

1116.quote: We all have our time machines, don't we. Those that take us back are memories...And those that carry us forward, are dreams.
1116.author: H.G. Wells

1117.quote: Francois Rabelais. He was a poet. And his last words were "I go to seek a Great Perhaps." That's why I'm going. So I don't have to wait until I die to start seeking a Great Perhaps.
1117.author: John Green,

1118.quote: Book collecting is an obsession, an occupation, a disease, an addiction, a fascination, an absurdity, a fate. It is not a hobby. Those who do it must do it.
1118.author: Jeanette Winterson

1119.quote: There are far, far better things ahead than any we leave behind.
1119.author: C.S. Lewis

1120.quote: You've got about as much charm as a dead slug.
1120.author: Suzanne Collins,

1121.quote: My mission in life is not merely to survive, but to thrive; and to do so with some passion, some compassion, some humor, and some style.
1121.author: Maya Angelou

1122.quote:
Be grateful for what you already have while you pursue your goals. 
If you aren't grateful for what you already have, what makes you think you would be happy with more.
1122.author: Roy T. Bennett,

1123.quote: You believe lies so you eventually learn to trust no one but yourself.
1123.author: Marilyn Monroe

1124.quote: When you stop expecting people to be perfect, you can like them for who they are.
1124.author: Donald Miller,

1125.quote: When the power of love overcomes the love of power, the world will know peace.
1125.author: Jimi Hendrix

1126.quote:
How do you feel, Georgie?" whispered Mrs. Weasley.
George's fingers groped for the side of his head.
"Saintlike," he murmured.
"What's wrong with him?" croaked Fred, looking terrified. "Is his mind affected?"
"Saintlike," repeated George, opening his eyes and looking up at his brother. "You see...I'm HOLEY, Fred, geddit?
1126.author: J.K. Rowling,

1127.quote: Some birds are not meant to be caged, that's all. Their feathers are too bright, their songs too sweet and wild. So you let them go, or when you open the cage to feed them they somehow fly out past you. And the part of you that knows it was wrong to imprison them in the first place rejoices, but still, the place where you live is that much more drab and empty for their departure.
1127.author: Stephen King,

1128.quote: A good library will never be too neat, or too dusty, because somebody will always be in it, taking books off the shelves and staying up late reading them.
1128.author: Lemony Snicket,

1129.quote: And I like large parties. They're so intimate. At small parties there isn't any privacy.
1129.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,

1130.quote: You're wishin' too much, baby. You gotta stop wearing your wishbone where your backbone oughtta be.
1130.author: Elizabeth Gilbert,

1131.quote: Albus Severus," Harry said quietly, so that nobody but Ginny could hear, and she was tactful enough to pretend to be waving to Rose, who was now on the train, "you were named for two headmasters of Hogwarts. One of them was a Slytherin and he was probably the bravest man I ever knew.
1131.author: J.K. Rowling,

1132.quote: Why didn't I learn to treat everything like it was the last time. My greatest regret was how much I believed in the future.
1132.author: Jonathan Safran Foer,

1133.quote: The Chinese use two brush strokes to write the word 'crisis.' One brush stroke stands for danger; the other for opportunity. In a crisis, be aware of the danger--but recognize the opportunity.
1133.author: John F. Kennedy

1134.quote: I don't believe in the kind of magic in my books. But I do believe something very magical can happen when you read a good book.
1134.author: J.K. Rowling

1135.quote:
Believe in Your Heart

Believe in your heart that you're meant to live a life full of passion, purpose, magic and miracles.
1135.author: Roy T. Bennett,

1137.quote: Judge a man by his questions rather than by his answers.
1137.author: Voltaire

1138.quote: After nourishment, shelter and companionship, stories are the thing we need most in the world.
1138.author: Philip Pullman

1139.quote: Learn what is to be taken seriously and laugh at the rest.
1139.author: Herman Hesse

1140.quote: How vain it is to sit down to write when you have not stood up to live.
1140.author: Henry David Thoreau

1141.quote: What Is Love? I have met in the streets a very poor young man who was in love. His hat was old, his coat worn, the water passed through his shoes and the stars through his soul
1141.author: Victor Hugo ,

1142.quote: It's just that...I just think that some things are meant to be broken. Imperfect. Chaotic. It's the universe's way of providing contrast, you know? There have to be a few holes in the road. It's how life is.
1142.author: Sarah Dessen,

1143.quote: We are all atheists about most of the gods that humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further.
1143.author: Richard Dawkins,

1144.quote: Tell your heart that the fear of suffering is worse than the suffering itself. And that no heart has ever suffered when it goes in search of its dreams, because every second of the search is a second's encounter with God and with eternity.
1144.author: Paulo Coelho,

1145.quote:
Don't." Clary raised a warning hand. "I'm not really in the mood right now."
"That's got to be the first time a girl's ever said that to me," Jace mused.
1145.author: Cassandra Clare,

1146.quote: Basically, I have two speeds.... Hostile or smart-aleck. Your choice.
1146.author: James Patterson,

1147.quote: He's a wallflower. You see things. You keep quiet about them. And you understand.
1147.author: Stephen Chbosky,

1148.quote: History will be kind to me for I intend to write it.
1148.author: Winston S. Churchill

1149.quote: No matter how much suffering you went through, you never wanted to let go of those memories.
1149.author: haruki murakami

1150.quote: If no one in the entire world cared about you, did you really exist at all?
1150.author: Cassandra Clare,

1151.quote: Stories never really end...even if the books like to pretend they do. Stories always go on. They don't end on the last page, any more than they begin on the first page.
1151.author: Cornelia Funke,

1152.quote: A book, too, can be a star, a living fire to lighten the darkness, leading out into the expanding universe.
1152.author: Madeleine L'Engle

1153.quote: Life is to be enjoyed, not endured
1153.author: Gordon B. Hinckley

1154.quote:
Well, now
If little by little you stop loving me
I shall stop loving you
Little by little
If suddenly you forget me
Do not look for me
For I shall already have forgotten you

If you think it long and mad the wind of banners that passes through my life
And you decide to leave me at the shore of the heart where I have roots
Remember
That on that day, at that hour, I shall lift my arms
And my roots will set off to seek another land
1154.author: Pablo Neruda,

1155.quote: A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us.
1155.author: Franz Kafka

1156.quote: Hate the sin, love the sinner.
1156.author: Mahatma Gandhi

1157.quote: We have to allow ourselves to be loved by the people who really love us, the people who really matter. Too much of the time, we are blinded by our own pursuits of people to love us, people that don't even matter, while all that time we waste and the people who do love us have to stand on the sidewalk and watch us beg in the streets! It's time to put an end to this. It's time for us to let ourselves be loved.
1157.author: C. JoyBell C.

1158.quote:
You're off to Great Places!
Today is your day!
Your mountain is waiting,
So... get on your way!
1158.author: Dr. Seuss,

1159.quote: The one thing that doesn't abide by majority rule is a person's conscience.
1159.author: Harper Lee,

1160.quote: Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.
1160.author: Albert Einstein

1162.quote: Do you wish me a good morning, or mean that it is a good morning whether I want it or not; or that you feel good this morning; or that it is a morning to be good on?
1162.author: J.R.R. Tolkien,

1163.author: William Shakespeare,

1164.quote: The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe. If you try it, you will be lonely often, and sometimes frightened. But no price is too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself.
1164.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

1165.quote: Don't bend; don't water it down; don't try to make it logical; don't edit your own soul according to the fashion. Rather, follow your most intense obsessions mercilessly.
1165.author: Franz Kafka

1166.quote:
I can listen no longer in silence. I must speak to you by such means as are within my reach. You pierce my soul. I am half agony, half hope. Tell me not that I am too late, that such precious feelings are gone for ever. I offer myself to you again with a heart even more your own than when you almost broke it, eight years and a half ago. Dare not say that man forgets sooner than woman, that his love has an earlier death. I have loved none but you. Unjust I may have been, weak and resentful I have been, but never inconstant. You alone have brought me to Bath. For you alone, I think and plan. Have you not seen this? Can you fail to have understood my wishes? I had not waited even these ten days, could I have read your feelings, as I think you must have penetrated mine. I can hardly write. I am every instant hearing something which overpowers me. You sink your voice, but I can distinguish the tones of that voice when they would be lost on others. Too good, too excellent creature! You do us justice, indeed. You do believe that there is true attachment and constancy among men. Believe it to be most fervent, most undeviating, in F. W.

I must go, uncertain of my fate; but I shall return hither, or follow your party, as soon as possible. A word, a look, will be enough to decide whether I enter your father's house this evening or never.
1166.author: Jane Austen,

1167.quote: The heart is an arrow. It demands aim to land true.
1167.author: Leigh Bardugo,

1168.quote: You are imperfect, permanently and inevitably flawed. And you are beautiful.
1168.author: Amy Bloom

1169.quote: But in the end one needs more courage to live than to kill himself.
1169.author: Albert Camus

1170.quote: I dream my painting and I paint my dream.
1170.author: Vincent Willem van Gogh

1171.quote: Why are women... so much more interesting to men than men are to women?
1171.author: Virginia Woolf

1172.quote: You can't be happy unless you're unhappy sometimes".
1172.author: Lauren Oliver,

1173.quote: Just because you call an electric eel a rubber duck doesn't make it a rubber duck, does it? And God help the poor bastard who decides they want to take a bath with the duckie. (Jace Wayland)
1173.author: Cassandra Clare,

1174.quote: Sanity and happiness are an impossible combination.
1174.author: Mark Twain

1175.quote: The reason it hurts so much to separate is because our souls are connected.
1175.author: Nicholas Sparks

1176.quote: If you obey all of the rules, you miss all of the fun.
1176.author: Katharine Hepburn

1177.quote: Nobody ever figures out what life is all about, and it doesn't matter. Explore the world. Nearly everything is really interesting if you go into it deeply enough.
1177.author: Richard P. Feynman

1178.quote: People who claim that they're evil are usually no worse than the rest of us... It's people who claim that they're good, or any way better than the rest of us, that you have to be wary of.
1178.author: Gregory Maguire,

1179.quote: Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught.
1179.author: Oscar Wilde

1180.quote: Never close your lips to those whom you have already opened your heart.
1180.author: Charles Dickens

1181.quote: Reading is escape, and the opposite of escape; it's a way to make contact with reality after a day of making things up, and it's a way of making contact with someone else's imagination after a day that's all too real.
1181.author: Nora Ephron

1182.quote:
there are worse things
than being alone
but it often takes
decades to realize this
and most often when you do
it's too late
and there's nothing worse
than too late
1182.author: Charles Bukowski

1183.quote: Mom. I have something to tell you. I'm undead. Now, I know you may have some preconceived notions about the undead. I know you may not be comfortable with the idea of me being undead. But I'm here to tell you that undead are just like you and me ... well, okay. Possibly more like me than you.
1183.author: Cassandra Clare,

1184.quote: People are more difficult to work with than machines. And when you break a person, he can't be fixed.
1184.author: Rick Riordan,

1185.quote: If she's amazing, she won't be easy. If she's easy, she won't be amazing. If she's worth it, you wont give up. If you give up, you're not worthy. ... Truth is, everybody is going to hurt you; you just gotta find the ones worth suffering for.
1185.author: Bob Marley,

1186.quote: Follow your heart, listen to your inner voice, stop caring about what others think.
1186.author: Roy T. Bennett,

1187.quote: Maybe who we are isn't so much about what we do, but rather what we're capable of when we least expect it.
1187.author: Jodi Picoult,

1188.quote: If you're losing your soul and you know it, then you've still got a soul left to lose
1188.author: charles bukowski

1189.quote: If you're lonely when you're alone, you're in bad company.
1189.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

1190.quote: Dance, when you're broken open. Dance, if you've torn the bandage off. Dance in the middle of the fighting. Dance in your blood. Dance when you're perfectly free.
1190.author: Rumi

1191.quote: It isn't possible to love and part. You will wish that it was. You can transmute love, ignore it, muddle it, but you can never pull it out of you. I know by experience that the poets are right: love is eternal.
1191.author: E.M. Forster,

1192.quote:
It's not natural for women to fight."
"It's not natural for someone to be as stupid as he is tall, and yet there you stand.
1192.author: Leigh Bardugo,

1193.quote: Things we lose have a way of coming back to us in the end, if not always in the way we expect.
1193.author: JK Rowling,

1194.quote: Many people lose the small joys in the hope for the big happiness.
1194.author: Pearl S. Buck

1195.quote:
You see, cuckoos are parasites. They lay their eggs in other birds' nests. When the egg hatches, the baby cuckoo pushes the other baby birds out of the nest. The poor parent birds work themselves to death trying to find enough food to feed the enormous cuckoo child who has murdered their babies and taken their places."
"Enormous?" said Jace. "Did you just call me fat?"
"It was an analogy."
"I am not fat.
1195.author: Cassandra Clare,

1196.quote: This is your life and its ending one moment at a time.
1196.author: Chuck Palahniuk,

1197.quote: He thinks he'll be remembered as the villain in the story. But I forgot to tell him that the villain is usually the person who locks up the maiden and throws away the key. He was the one who let me out.
1197.author: Sarah J. Maas,

1198.quote: A man can no more diminish God's glory by refusing to worship Him than a lunatic can put out the sun by scribbling the word 'darkness' on the walls of his cell.
1198.author: C.S. Lewis,

1199.quote: Out of the corner of her eye she thought she saw Jace shoot her a look of white rage - but when she glanced at him, he looked as he always did: easy, confident, slightly bored. "In future, Clarissa," he said, "it might be wise to mention that you already have a man in your bed, to avoid such tedious situations." "You invited him into bed?" Simon demanded, looking shaken. "Ridiculous, isn't it?" said Jace. "We would never have all fit." "I didn't invite him into bed," Clary snapped. "We were just kissing." "Just kissing?" Jace's tone mocked her with its false hurt. "How swiftly you dismiss our love.
1199.author: Cassandra Clare,

1200.quote: War must be, while we defend our lives against a destroyer who would devour all; but I do not love the bright sword for its sharpness, nor the arrow for its swiftness, nor the warrior for his glory. I love only that which they defend.
1200.author: J.R.R. Tolkien,

1201.quote: Holey? You have the the whole world of ear-related humor before you, you go for holey?
1201.author: J.K. Rowling,

1202.quote: No amount of regretting can change the past, and no amount of worrying can change the future.
1202.author: Roy T. Bennett,

1203.quote: Once you have tasted flight, you will forever walk the earth with your eyes turned skyward, for there you have been, and there you will always long to return.
1203.author: Leonardo da Vinci

1204.quote: Finally, from so little sleeping and so much reading, his brain dried up and he went completely out of his mind.
1204.author: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra,

1205.quote: And so with the sunshine and the great bursts of leaves growing on the trees, just as things grow in fast movies, I had that familiar conviction that life was beginning over again with the summer.
1205.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,

1206.quote: Don't say you don't have enough time. You have exactly the same number of hours per day that were given to Helen Keller, Pasteur, Michelangelo, Mother Teresa, Leonardo da Vinci, Thomas Jefferson, and Albert Einstein.
1206.author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

1207.quote: You don't know what goes on in anyone's life but your own. And when you mess with one part of a person's life, you're not messing with just that part. Unfortunately, you can't be that precise and selective. When you mess with one part of a person's life, you're messing with their entire life. Everything. . . affects everything.
1207.author: Jay Asher,

1208.quote: Books have a unique way of stopping time in a particular moment and saying: Let's not forget this.
1208.author: Dave Eggers

1209.quote:
And on the subject of burning books: I want to congratulate librarians, not famous for their physical strength or their powerful political connections or their great wealth, who, all over this country, have staunchly resisted anti-democratic bullies who have tried to remove certain books from their shelves, and have refused to reveal to thought police the names of persons who have checked out those titles.

So the America I loved still exists, if not in the White House or the Supreme Court or the Senate or the House of Representatives or the media. The America I love still exists at the front desks of our public libraries.
1209.author: Kurt Vonnegut,

1210.quote: The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays.
1210.author: Soren Kierkegaard

1211.quote: Don't take life too seriously. Punch it in the face when it needs a good hit. Laugh at it.
1211.author: Colleen Hoover,

1212.quote: That was the thing. You never got used to it, the idea of someone being gone. Just when you think it's reconciled, accepted, someone points it out to you, and it just hits you all over again, that shocking.
1212.author: Sarah Dessen,

1213.quote: If you gave someone your heart and they died, did they take it with them? Did you spend the rest of forever with a hole inside you that couldn't be filled?
1213.author: Jodi Picoult,

1214.quote: Life is about accepting the challenges along the way, choosing to keep moving forward, and savoring the journey.
1214.author: Roy T. Bennett,

1215.quote:
Trees are poems the earth writes upon the sky, We fell them down and turn them into paper,
That we may record our emptiness.
1215.author: Kahlil Gibran

1216.quote: We have to continually be jumping off cliffs and developing our wings on the way down.
1216.author: Kurt Vonnegut,

1217.quote: When someone is crying, of course, the noble thing to do is to comfort them. But if someone is trying to hide their tears, it may also be noble to pretend you do not notice them.
1217.author: Lemony Snicket,

1218.quote: If you are allergic to a thing, it is best not to put that thing in your mouth, particularly if the thing is cats.
1218.author: Lemony Snicket,

1219.quote: Usually I'm remarkably good natured. Try me on a day that doesn't end in y.
1219.author: Cassandra Clare

1220.quote:
Mad Girl's Love Song

I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead;
I lift my lids and all is born again.
(I think I made you up inside my head.)

The stars go waltzing out in blue and red,
And arbitrary blackness gallops in:
I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead.

I dreamed that you bewitched me into bed
And sung me moon-struck, kissed me quite insane.
(I think I made you up inside my head.)

God topples from the sky, hell's fires fade:
Exit seraphim and Satan's men:
I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead.

I fancied you'd return the way you said,
But I grow old and I forget your name.
(I think I made you up inside my head.)

I should have loved a thunderbird instead;
At least when spring comes they roar back again.
I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead.
(I think I made you up inside my head.)
1220.author: Sylvia Plath

1221.quote: I could easily forgive his pride, if he had not mortified mine.
1221.author: Jane Austen,

1222.quote:
The Road goes ever on and on
Down from the door where it began.
Now far ahead the Road has gone,
And I must follow, if I can,
Pursuing it with eager feet,
Until it joins some larger way
Where many paths and errands meet.
And whither then? I cannot say
1222.author: J.R.R. Tolkien,

1223.quote: One love, one heart, one destiny.
1223.author: Robert Marley

1224.quote: One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well.
1224.author: Virginia Woolf,

1225.quote: Stories may well be lies, but they are good lies that say true things, and which can sometimes pay the rent.
1225.author: Neil Gaiman

1226.quote: I'm a grenade and at some point I'm going to blow up and I would like to minimize the casualties, okay?
1226.author: John Green,

1227.quote: If you want to really hurt you parents, and you don't have the nerve to be gay, the least you can do is go into the arts. I'm not kidding. The arts are not a way to make a living. They are a very human way of making life more bearable. Practicing an art, no matter how well or badly, is a way to make your soul grow, for heaven's sake. Sing in the shower. Dance to the radio. Tell stories. Write a poem to a friend, even a lousy poem. Do it as well as you possible can. You will get an enormous reward. You will have created something.
