1227.author: Kurt Vonnegut,

1228.quote:
Top 15 Things Money Can't Buy
Time. Happiness. Inner Peace. Integrity. Love. Character. Manners. Health. Respect. Morals. Trust. Patience. Class. Common sense. Dignity.
1228.author: Roy T. Bennett,

1229.quote:
There was a clatter as the basilisk fangs cascaded out of Hermione's arms. Running at Ron, she flung them around his neck and kissed him full on the mouth. Ron threw away the fangs and broomstick he was holding and responded with such enthusiasm that he lifted Hermione off her feet. 
"Is this the moment?" Harry asked weakly, and when nothing happened except that Ron and Hermione gripped each other still more firmly and swayed on the spot, he raised his voice. "OI! There's a war going on here!" 
Ron and Hermione broke apart, their arms still around each other. 
"I know, mate," said Ron, who looked as though he had recently been hit on the back of the head with a Bludger, "so it's now or never, isn't it?" 
"Never mind that, what about the Horcrux?" Harry shouted. "D'you think you could just --- just hold it in, until we've got the diadem?" 
"Yeah --- right --- sorry ---" said Ron, and he and Hermione set about gathering up fangs, both pink in the face.
1229.author: J.K. Rowling,

1230.quote: If you have two friends in your lifetime, you're lucky. If you have one good friend, you're more than lucky.
1230.author: S.E. Hinton

1231.quote: Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away.
1231.author: Philip K. Dick,

1232.quote: When someone leaves, it's because someone else is about to arrive.
1232.author: Paulo Coelho,

1233.quote: I will not let anyone walk through my mind with their dirty feet.
1233.author: mahatma gandhi

1234.quote: People, I have discovered, are layers and layers of secrets. You believe you know them, that you understand them, but their motives are always hidden from you, buried in their own hearts. You will never know them, but sometimes you decide to trust them.
1234.author: Veronica Roth,

1235.quote: I am a cage, in search of a bird.
1235.author: Franz Kafka

1236.quote: The greater the love, the greater the tragedy when it's over.
1236.author: Nicholas Sparks,

1237.quote: The measure of intelligence is the ability to change.
1237.author: Albert Einstein

1238.quote: Any fool can be happy. It takes a man with real heart to make beauty out of the stuff that makes us weep.
1238.author: Clive Barker,

1239.quote: When a man is denied the right to live the life he believes in, he has no choice but to become an outlaw.
1239.author: Nelson Mandela

1240.quote: Have enough courage to trust love one more time and always one more time.
1240.author: Maya Angelou

1241.quote: And now that you don't have to be perfect, you can be good.
1241.author: John Steinbeck,

1242.quote: The thing about growing up with Fred and George," said Ginny thoughtfully, "is that you sort of start thinking anything's possible if you've got enough nerve.
1242.author: J. K. Rowling,

1243.quote:
If I should ever die, God forbid, let this be my epitaph:
THE ONLY PROOF HE NEEDED
FOR THE EXISTENCE OF GOD
WAS MUSIC
1243.author: kurt vonnegut

1244.quote:
I want
To do with you what spring does with the cherry trees.
1244.author: Pablo Neruda,

1245.quote: Maybe there's something you're afraid to say, or someone you're afraid to love, or somewhere you're afraid to go. It's gonna hurt. It's gonna hurt because it matters.
1245.author: John Green,

1246.quote: Don't be satisfied with stories, how things have gone with others. Unfold your own myth.
1246.author: Rumi,

1247.quote: I, myself, am made entirely of flaws, stitched together with good intentions.
1247.author: Augusten Burroughs

1248.quote:
Acts of Kindness:
A random act of kindness, no matter how small, can make a tremendous impact on someone else's life.
1248.author: Roy T. Bennett,

1249.quote: If you are irritated by every rub, how will your mirror be polished?
1249.author: Rumi

1250.quote: The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly.
1250.author: Bukkyo Dendo Kyokai,

1251.quote: Every generation imagines itself to be more intelligent than the one that went before it, and wiser than the one that comes after it.
1251.author: George Orwell

1252.quote: Someone I loved once gave me a box full of darkness. It took me years to understand that this too, was a gift.
1252.author: Mary Oliver

1253.quote: I'm quite illiterate, but I read a lot.
1253.author: J.D. Salinger,

1254.quote: There are no faster or firmer friendships than those formed between people who love the same books.
1254.author: Irving Stone,

1255.quote: Fighting for peace is like screwing for virginity.
1255.author: George Carlin

1256.quote: Because you are beautiful. I enjoy looking at beautiful people, and I decided a while ago not to deny myself the simpler pleasures of existence
1256.author: John Green,

1257.quote: One ought, every day at least, to hear a little song, read a good poem, see a fine picture, and, if it were possible, to speak a few reasonable words.
1257.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe,

1258.quote: When we are tired, we are attacked by ideas we conquered long ago.
1258.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

1259.quote: In ancient times cats were worshipped as gods; they have not forgotten this.
1259.author: Terry Pratchett

1260.quote: Time is a drug. Too much of it kills you.
1260.author: Terry Pratchett,

1261.quote: Confront the dark parts of yourself, and work to banish them with illumination and forgiveness. Your willingness to wrestle with your demons will cause your angels to sing.
1261.author: August Wilson

1262.quote: But a mermaid has no tears, and therefore she suffers so much more.
1262.author: Hans Christian Andersen,

1263.quote: What you do, the way you think, makes you beautiful.
1263.author: Scott Westerfeld,

1264.quote: You're not to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who does it or says it.
1264.author: Malcolm X,

1265.quote: Love is not affectionate feeling, but a steady wish for the loved person's ultimate good as far as it can be obtained.
1265.author: C.S. Lewis

1266.quote: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.
1266.author: Plato

1267.quote:
And still, after all this time,
The sun never says to the earth,
"You owe Me."

Look what happens with
A love like that,
It lights the Whole Sky.
1267.author: Hafiz

1268.quote: Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut.
1268.author: Ernest Hemingway

1269.quote: When you do things from your soul, you feel a river moving in you, a joy.
1269.author: Rumi

1270.quote: I'm so glad I live in a world where there are Octobers.
1270.author: L. M. Montgomery,

1271.quote: I do things like get in a taxi and say, "The library, and step on it.
1271.author: David Foster Wallace,

1272.quote: Both Rowling and Meyer, they're speaking directly to young people. ... The real difference is that Jo Rowling is a terrific writer and Stephenie Meyer can't write worth a darn. She's not very good.
1272.author: Stephen King

1274.quote: I can resist anything except temptation.
1274.author: Oscar Wilde,

1275.quote: No, I'm just a very naughty boy. I do all sorts of bad things. I kick kittens. I make rude gestures at nuns.
1275.author: Cassandra Clare,

1276.quote: You were born with wings, why prefer to crawl through life?
1276.author: Rumi

1277.quote: It is true that those we meet can change us, sometimes so profoundly that we are not the same afterwards, even unto our names.
1277.author: Yann Martel,

1278.quote: Maybe ever'body in the whole damn world is scared of each other.
1278.author: John Steinbeck,

1279.quote: When we are no longer able to change a situation, we are challenged to change ourselves.
1279.author: Viktor E. Frankl,

1280.quote:
As if you were on fire from within.

The moon lives in the lining of your skin.
1280.author: Pablo Neruda

1281.quote: The moment you doubt whether you can fly, you cease for ever to be able to do it.
1281.author: J. M. Barrie,

1282.quote:
Forget safety.
Live where you fear to live.
Destroy your reputation.
Be notorious.
1282.author: Rumi

1283.quote: After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.
1283.author: Aldous Huxley,

1284.quote: Be brave to stand for what you believe in even if you stand alone.
1284.author: Roy T. Bennett,

1285.quote:
For last year's words belong to last year's language 
And next year's words await another voice.
1285.author: T.S. Eliot,

1286.quote:
Three Rings for the Elven-kings under the sky,
 Seven for the Dwarf-lords in their halls of stone,
Nine for Mortal Men, doomed to die,
 One for the Dark Lord on his dark throne
In the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie.
 One Ring to rule them all, One Ring to find them,
 One Ring to bring them all and in the darkness bind them.
In the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie.
1286.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

1287.quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
1287.author: Anais Nin

1288.quote: I wanted to tell the book thief many things, about beauty and brutality. But what could I tell her about those things that she didn't already know? I wanted to explain that I am constantly overestimating and underestimating the human race-that rarely do I ever simply estimate it. I wanted to ask her how the same thing could be so ugly and so glorious, and its words and stories so damning and brilliant.
1288.author: Markus Zusak,

1289.quote: Do your thing and don't care if they like it.
1289.author: Tina Fey,

1290.quote: The best books... are those that tell you what you know already.
1290.author: George Orwell,

1291.quote: It is a great thing to start life with a small number of really good books which are your very own.
1291.author: Arthur Conan Doyle

1292.quote: When I was a boy of 14, my father was so ignorant I could hardly stand to have the old man around. But when I got to be 21, I was astonished at how much the old man had learned in seven years.
1292.author: Mark Twain

1293.quote: How did it get so late so soon?
1293.author: Dr. Seuss

1294.quote: The first draft of anything is shit.
1294.author: Ernest Hemingway

1295.quote: It's not the face, but the expressions on it. It's not the voice, but what you say. It's not how you look in that body, but the thing you do with it. You are beautiful.
1295.author: Stephenie Meyer,

1296.quote: You speak an infinite deal of nothing.
1296.author: William Shakespeare,

1297.quote: They say when you are missing someone that they are probably feeling the same, but I don't think it's possible for you to miss me as much as I'm missing you right now
1297.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

1298.quote: He does something to me, that boy. Every time. It's his only detriment. He steps on my heart. He makes me cry.
1298.author: Markus Zusak,

1299.quote: How wrong is it for a woman to expect the man to build the world she wants, rather than to create it herself?
1299.author: Anais Nin

1300.quote: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, many are strong at the broken places.
1300.author: Ernest Hemingway

1301.quote: You know what charm is: a way of getting the answer yes without having asked any clear question.
1301.author: Albert Camus,

1302.quote: You is kind. You is smart. You is important.
1302.author: Kathryn Stockett,

1303.quote: The world was hers for the reading.
1303.author: Betty Smith,

1304.quote: Understanding is the first step to acceptance, and only with acceptance can there be recovery.
1304.author: J.K. Rowling,

1305.quote: I would like to be the air that inhabits you for a moment only. I would like to be that unnoticed and that necessary.
1305.author: Margaret Atwood

1306.quote: To me, Fearless is not the absense of fear. It's not being completely unafraid. To me, Fearless is having fears. Fearless is having doubts. Lots of them. To me, Fearless is living in spite of those things that scare you to death.
1306.author: Taylor Swift

1307.quote: I was thinking about the first time I ever saw you," he said, "and how after that I couldn't forget you. I wanted to, but I couldn't stop myself. I forced Hodge to let me be the one who came to find you and bring you back to the Institue. And even back then, in that stupid coffee shop, when I saw you sitting on that couch with Simon, even then that felt wrong to me-- I should have been the one sitting with you. The one who made you laugh like that. I couldn't get rid of that feeling. That it should have been me. And the more I knew you, the more I felt it--it had never been like that for me before. I'd always wanted a girl and then gotten to know her and not wanted her anymore, but with you the feeling just got stronger and stronger until that night when you showed up at Renwick's and I knew.
1307.author: Cassandra Clare,

1308.quote: Imagine smiling after a slap in the face. Then think of doing it twenty-four hours a day.
1308.author: Markus Zusak,

1309.quote: Isn't it odd how much fatter a book gets when you've read it several times?" Mo had said..."As if something were left between the pages every time you read it. Feelings, thoughts, sounds, smells...and then, when you look at the book again many years later, you find yourself there, too, a slightly younger self, slightly different, as if the book had preserved you like a pressed flower...both strange and familiar.
1309.author: Cornelia Funke,

1310.quote: The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that your very existence is an act of rebellion.
1310.author: Albert Camus

1311.quote: I am an excitable person who only understands life lyrically, musically, in whom feelings are much stronger as reason. I am so thirsty for the marvelous that only the marvelous has power over me. Anything I can not transform into something marvelous, I let go. Reality doesn't impress me. I only believe in intoxication, in ecstasy, and when ordinary life shackles me, I escape, one way or another. No more walls.
1311.author: Anais Nin

1312.quote: I never change, I simply become more myself.
1312.author: Joyce Carol Oates,

1313.quote: There is not always a good guy. Nor is there always a bad one. Most people are somewhere in between.
1313.author: Patrick Ness,

1314.quote: All you have to do is write one true sentence. Write the truest sentence that you know.
1314.author: Ernest Hemingway

1315.quote:
It's not because I want to make out with her."
Hold on." He grabbed a pencil and scrawled excitedly at the paper as if he'd just made a mathematical breakthrough and then looked back up at me. "I just did some calculations, and I've been able to determine that you're full of shit
1315.author: John Green,

1316.quote: Today a reader, tomorrow a leader.
1316.author: Margaret Fuller

1317.quote: Don't feel bad, I'm usually about to die.
1317.author: Rick Riordan,

1318.quote: An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field.
1318.author: Niels Bohr

1319.quote: But I don't want comfort. I want God, I want poetry, I want real danger, I want freedom, I want goodness. I want sin.
1319.author: Aldous Huxley,

1320.quote: We waste time looking for the perfect lover, instead of creating the perfect love.
1320.author: Tom Robbins

1321.quote: Atticus told me to delete the adjectives and I'd have the facts.
1321.author: Harper Lee,

1322.quote: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well.
1322.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

1323.quote:
It doesn't interest me what you do for a living. I want to know what you ache for, and if you dare to dream of meeting your heart's longing.
It doesn't interest me how old you are. I want to know if you will risk looking like a fool for love, for your dream, for the adventure of being alive. 
It doesn't interest me what planets are squaring your moon. I want to know if you have touched the center of your own sorrow, if you have been opened by life's betrayals or have become shriveled and closed from fear of further pain!I want to know if you can sit with pain, mine or your own, without moving to hide it or fade it, or fix it. 
I want to know if you can be with joy, mine or your own, if you can dance with wildness and let the ecstasy fill you to the tips of your fingers and toes without cautioning us to be careful, to be realistic, to remember the limitations of being human. 
It doesn't interest me if the story you are telling me is true. I want to know if you can disappoint another to be true to yourself; if you can bear the accusation of betrayal and not betray your own soul; if you can be faithlessand therefore trustworthy. 
I want to know if you can see beauty even when it's not pretty, every day,and if you can source your own life from its presence. 
I want to know if you can live with failure, yours and mine, and still stand on the edge of the lake and shout to the silver of the full moon, Yes!
It doesn't interest me to know where you live or how much money you have. I want to know if you can get up, after the night of grief and despair, weary and bruised to the bone, and do what needs to be done to feed the children. 
It doesn't interest me who you know or how you came to be here. I want to know if you will stand in the center of the fire with me and not shrink back. 
It doesn't interest me where or what or with whom you have studied. I want to know what sustains you, from the inside, when all else falls away. 
I want to know if you can be alone with yourself and if you truly like the company you keep in the empty moments.
1323.author: Oriah Mountain Dreamer

1324.quote: I dream. Sometimes I think that's the only right thing to do.
1324.author: Haruki Murakami,

1325.quote: There are years that ask questions and years that answer.
1325.author: Zora Neale Hurston,

1326.quote:
Is standing by the window muttering about blood something he does all the time?" asked Simon.
"No," Jace said. "Sometimes he sits on the couch and does it.
1326.author: Cassandra Clare,

1327.quote: We should consider every day lost on which we have not danced at least once.
1327.author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

1328.quote: Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity or registering wrongs.
1328.author: Charlotte Bronte,

1329.quote: Happiness is the consequence of personal effort. You fight for it, strive for it, insist upon it, and sometimes even travel around the world looking for it. You have to participate relentlessly in the manifestations of your own blessings. And once you have achieved a state of happiness, you must never become lax about maintaining it. You must make a mighty effort to keep swimming upward into that happiness forever, to stay afloat on top of it.
1329.author: Elizabeth Gilbert,

1330.quote: It is not that I'm so smart. But I stay with the questions much longer.
1330.author: Albert Einstein

1331.quote: Letting go means to come to the realization that some people are a part of your history, but not a part of your destiny.
1331.author: Steve Maraboli

1332.quote: It happens to everyone as they grow up. You find out who you are and what you want, and then you realize that people you've known forever don't see things the way you do. So you keep the wonderful memories, but find yourself moving on.
1332.author: Nicholas Sparks

1333.quote: At some point, you just pull off the Band-Aid, and it hurts, but then it's over and you're relieved.
1333.author: John Green,

1334.quote: The bravest people are the ones who don't mind looking like cowards.
1334.author: T.H. White,

1335.quote: Words are easy, like the wind; faithful friends are hard to find.
1335.author: William Shakespeare,

1336.quote:
Isabelle drifted over, Jace a pace behind her. She was wearing a long black dress with boots and an even longer cutaway coat of soft green velvet, the color of moss. "I can't believe you did it!" she exclaimed. "How did you get Magnus to let Jace leave?"
"Traded him for Alec," Clary said.
Isabelle looked mildly alarmed. "Not permanently?"
"No," said Jace. "Just for a few hours. Unless I don't come back," he added thoughtfully. "In which case, maybe he does get to keep Alec. Think of it as a lease with an option to buy."
Isabelle looked dubious. "Mom and Dad won't be pleased if they find out."
"That you freed a possible criminal by trading away your brother to a warlock who looks like a gay Sonic the Hedgehog and dresses like the Child Catcher from Chitty Chitty Bang Bang?" Simon inquired. "No, probably not.
1336.author: Cassandra Clare,

1337.quote: If you ever find yourself in the wrong story, leave.
1337.author: Mo Willems,

1338.quote: A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything, and the value of nothing.
1338.author: Oscar Wilde

1339.quote: Sometimes it seems safer to hold it all in, where the only person who can judge is yourself.
1339.author: Sarah Dessen

1340.quote: Perhaps it's impossible to wear an identity without becoming what you pretend to be.
1340.author: Orson Scott Card,

1341.quote: Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air.
1341.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

1342.quote: Despite my ghoulish reputation, I really have the heart of a small boy. I keep it in a jar on my desk.
1342.author: Robert Bloch

1343.quote: All we demanded was our right to twinkle.
1343.author: Marilyn Monroe

1344.quote:
I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead; 
I lift my eyes and all is born again.
1344.author: Sylvia Plath,

1345.quote:
Tonight I can write the saddest lines
I loved her, and sometimes she loved me too.
1345.author: Pablo Neruda,

1346.quote: You might be poor, your shoes might be broken, but your mind is a palace.
1346.author: Frank McCourt,

1347.quote: You don't remember what happened. What you remember becomes what happened.
1347.author: John Green,

1348.quote: Never be afraid to trust an unknown future to a known God.
1348.author: Corrie ten Boom

1349.quote: If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.
1349.author: Virginia Woolf

1350.quote: Gravitation is not responsible for people falling in love.
1350.author: Albert Einstein

1351.quote: If a book about failures doesn't sell, is it a success?
1351.author: Jerry Seinfeld

1352.quote: Wherever you go becomes a part of you somehow.
1352.author: Anita Desai

1353.quote: The beginning of love is the will to let those we love be perfectly themselves, the resolution not to twist them to fit our own image. If in loving them we do not love what they are, but only their potential likeness to ourselves, then we do not love them: we only love the reflection of ourselves we find in them
1353.author: Thomas Merton,

1354.quote: Literature is the most agreeable way of ignoring life.
1354.author: Fernando Pessoa,

1355.quote:
Maybe you can afford to wait. Maybe for you there's a tomorrow. Maybe for you there's one thousand tomorrows, or three thousand, or ten, so much time you can bathe in it, roll around it, let it slide like coins through you fingers. So much time you can waste it.
But for some of us there's only today. And the truth is, you never really know.
1355.author: Lauren Oliver,

1356.quote:
These violent delights have violent ends
And in their triumph die, like fire and powder,
Which as they kiss consume. The sweetest honey
Is loathsome in his own deliciousness
And in the taste confounds the appetite.
Therefore love moderately; long love doth so;
Too swift arrives as tardy as too slow.
1356.author: William Shakespeare,

1357.quote: Suffering has been stronger than all other teaching, and has taught me to understand what your heart used to be. I have been bent and broken, but - I hope - into a better shape.
1357.author: Charles Dickens,

1358.quote: Don't be afraid of death; be afraid of an unlived life. You don't have to live forever, you just have to live.
1358.author: Natalie Babbitt,

1359.quote: Many a book is like a key to unknown chambers within the castle of one's own self.
1359.author: Franz Kafka

1360.quote: The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof.
1360.author: Barbara Kingsolver,

1361.quote: You need to learn how to select your thoughts just the same way you select your clothes every day. This is a power you can cultivate. If you want to control things in your life so bad, work on the mind. That's the only thing you should be trying to control.
1361.author: Elizabeth Gilbert,

1362.quote: There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics.
1362.author: Benjamin Disraeli

1363.quote: All great and precious things are lonely.
1363.author: John Steinbeck,

1364.quote: Great things happen to those who don't stop believing, trying, learning, and being grateful.
1364.author: Roy T. Bennett,

1365.quote: I'm sure the universe is full of intelligent life. It's just been too intelligent to come here.
1365.author: Arthur C. Clarke

1366.quote: It's been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will.
1366.author: Lucy Maud Montgomery,

1367.quote: Don't part with your illusions. When they are gone you may still exist, but you have ceased to live.
1367.author: Mark Twain

1368.quote: Someday, somewhere - anywhere, unfailingly, you'll find yourself, and that, and only that, can be the happiest or bitterest hour of your life.
1368.author: Pablo Neruda

1369.quote: You here to finish me off, Sweetheart?
1369.author: Suzanne Collins,

1370.quote: Never lose hope. Storms make people stronger and never last forever.
1370.author: Roy T. Bennett,

1371.quote: Oh well... I'd just been thinking, if you had died, you'd have been welcome to share my toilet.
1371.author: J.K. Rowling,

1372.quote:
Fall down again, Bella?'
No, Emmett, I punched a werewolf in the face.
1372.author: Stephenie Meyer,

1373.quote:
Grover was sniffing the wind, looking nervous. He fished out his acorns and threw them into the sand, then played his pipes. They rearranged themselves in a pattern that made no sense to me, but Grover looked concerned. 
"That's us," he said. "Those five nuts right there." 
"Which one is me?" I asked. 
"The little deformed one," Zoe suggested. 
"Oh, shut up.
1373.author: Rick Riordan,

1374.quote: I cannot believe in a God who wants to be praised all the time.
1374.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

1375.quote: People think that intimacy is about sex. But intimacy is about truth. When you realize you can tell someone your truth, when you can show yourself to them, when you stand in front of them bare and their response is 'you're safe with me'- that's intimacy.
1375.author: Taylor Jenkins Reid,

1376.quote: Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book. And then there are books like An Imperial Affliction, which you can't tell people about, books so special and rare and yours that advertising your affection feels like betrayal
1376.author: John Green,

1377.quote: Don't you think it's better to be extremely happy for a short while, even if you lose it, than to be just okay for your whole life?
1377.author: Audrey Niffenegger,

1378.quote: You know, when it works, love is pretty amazing. It's not overrated. There's a reason for all those songs.
1378.author: Sarah Dessen,

1379.quote:
Don't stop there. I suppose there are also, what, vampires and werewolves and zombies?"
"Of course there are. Although you mostly find zombies farther south, where the voudun priests are."
"What about mummies? Do they only hang around Egypt?"
"Don't be ridiculous. No one believes in mummies.
1379.author: Cassandra Clare,

1380.quote: Don't waste your time with explanations: people only hear what they want to hear.
1380.author: Paulo Coelho

1381.quote: Don't feel sorry for yourself. Only assholes do that.
1381.author: Haruki Murakami,

1382.quote: I wasn't actually in love, but I felt a sort of tender curiosity.
1382.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,

1383.quote: People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading.
1383.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

1384.quote: Whatever the cost of our libraries, the price is cheap compared to that of an ignorant nation.
1384.author: Walter Cronkite

1385.quote: You will do foolish things, but do them with enthusiasm.
1385.author: Colette

1386.quote: Say 'provoking' again. Your mouth looks provocative when you do.
1386.author: Becca Fitzpatrick,

1387.quote: Is 'fat' really the worst thing a human being can be? Is 'fat' worse than 'vindictive', 'jealous', 'shallow', 'vain', 'boring' or 'cruel'? Not to me.
1387.author: J.K. Rowling

1388.quote: It is forbidden to kill; therefore all murderers are punished unless they kill in large numbers and to the sound of trumpets.
1388.author: Voltaire

1389.quote: You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?
1389.author: George Bernard Shaw,

1390.quote: It's probably not just by chance that I'm alone. It would be very hard for a man to live with me, unless he's terribly strong. And if he's stronger than I, I'm the one who can't live with him. ... I'm neither smart nor stupid, but I don't think I'm a run-of-the-mill person. I've been in business without being a businesswoman, I've loved without being a woman made only for love. The two men I've loved, I think, will remember me, on earth or in heaven, because men always remember a woman who caused them concern and uneasiness. I've done my best, in regard to people and to life, without precepts, but with a taste for justice.
1390.author: Coco Chanel

1391.quote: We are just an advanced breed of monkeys on a minor planet of a very average star. But we can understand the Universe. That makes us something very special.
1391.author: Stephen Hawking

1392.quote: We all bear scars,... Mine just happen to be more visible than most.
1392.author: Sarah J. Maas,

1393.quote: He smiled understandingly-much more than understandingly. It was one of those rare smiles with a quality of eternal reassurance in it, that you may come across four or five times in life. It faced--or seemed to face--the whole eternal world for an instant, and then concentrated on you with an irresistible prejudice in your favor. It understood you just as far as you wanted to be understood, believed in you as you would like to believe in yourself, and assured you that it had precisely the impression of you that, at your best, you hoped to convey.
1393.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,

1394.quote: I woke up thinking a very pleasant thought. There is lots left in the world to read.
1394.author: Nicholson Baker,

1395.quote: Look after my heart - I've left it with you.
1395.author: Stephenie Meyer,

1396.quote: Growing apart doesn't change the fact that for a long time we grew side by side; our roots will always be tangled. I'm glad for that.
1396.author: Ally Condie,

1397.quote: Words are pale shadows of forgotten names. As names have power, words have power. Words can light fires in the minds of men. Words can wring tears from the hardest hearts.
1397.author: Patrick Rothfuss,

1398.quote:
I crave your mouth, your voice, your hair.
Silent and starving, I prowl through the streets. 
Bread does not nourish me, dawn disrupts me, all day 
I hunt for the liquid measure of your steps. 

I hunger for your sleek laugh, 
your hands the color of a savage harvest, 
hunger for the pale stones of your fingernails, 
I want to eat your skin like a whole almond. 

I want to eat the sunbeam flaring in your lovely body, 
the sovereign nose of your arrogant face, 
I want to eat the fleeting shade of your lashes, 

and I pace around hungry, sniffing the twilight, 
hunting for you, for your hot heart, 
Like a puma in the barrens of Quitratue.
1398.author: Pablo Neruda

1399.quote: Time is an illusion. Lunchtime doubly so.
1399.author: Douglas Adams,

1400.quote: The past has no power over the present moment.
1400.author: Eckhart Tolle

1401.quote:
Jesper knocked his head against the hull and cast his eyes heavenward. Fine. But if Pekka Rollins kills us all, I'm going to get Wylan's ghost to teach my ghost how to play the flute just so that I can annoy the hell out of your ghost.
Brekker's lips quirked. I'll just hire Matthias' ghost to kick your ghost's ass.
My ghost won't associate with your ghost, Matthias said primly, and then wondered if the sea air was rotting his brain.
1401.author: Leigh Bardugo,

1402.quote: To say goodbye is to die a little.
1402.author: Raymond Chandler,

1403.quote: I love you like a fat kid loves cake!
1403.author: Scott Adams

1404.quote: When I discover who I am, I'll be free.
1404.author: Ralph Ellison,

1405.quote: Everyone you will ever meet knows something you don't.
1405.author: Bill  Nye

1406.quote: What and how much had I lost by trying to do only what was expected of me instead of what I myself had wished to do?
1406.author: Ralph Ellison,

1407.quote: Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get
1407.author: W.P. Kinsella

1408.quote: If you want to be a writer, you must do two things above all others: read a lot and write a lot.
1408.author: Stephen King

1409.quote: Live in the present, remember the past, and fear not the future, for it doesn't exist and never shall. There is only now.
1409.author: Christopher Paolini,

1410.quote: If I cannot be better than them, I will become so much worse.
1410.author: Holly Black,

1411.quote: It was not the feeling of completeness I so needed, but the feeling of not being empty.
1411.author: Jonathan Safran Foer,

1412.quote: And when her lips met mine, I knew that I could live to be a hundred and visit every country in the world, but nothing would ever compare to that single moment when I first kissed the girl of my dreams and knew that my love would last forever.
1412.author: Nicholas Sparks,

1413.quote: Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness, and many of our people need it sorely on these accounts. Broad, wholesome, charitable views of men and things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all one's lifetime.
1413.author: Mark Twain,

1414.quote:
Knock, And He'll open the door
Vanish, And He'll make you shine like the sun
Fall, And He'll raise you to the heavens
Become nothing, And He'll turn you into everything.
1414.author: Jalal Ad-Din Rumi

1415.quote: Do not fear failure but rather fear not trying.
1415.author: Roy T. Bennett,

1416.quote: What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say.
1416.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

1417.quote: Welcome to the wonderful world of jealousy, he thought. For the price of admission, you get a splitting headache, a nearly irresistable urge to commit murder, and an inferiority complex. Yippee.
1417.author: J.R. Ward,

1418.quote: I can shake off everything as I write; my sorrows disappear, my courage is reborn.
1418.author: Anne Frank

1419.quote: You never know what worse luck your bad luck has saved you from.
1419.author: Cormac McCarthy,

1420.quote: Hello babies. Welcome to Earth. It's hot in the summer and cold in the winter. It's round and wet and crowded. On the outside, babies, you've got a hundred years here. There's only one rule that I know of, babies-"God damn it, you've got to be kind.
1420.author: Kurt Vonnegut

1421.quote: If you want to tell people the truth, make them laugh, otherwise they'll kill you.
1421.author: George Bernard Shaw

1422.quote: That it will never come again is what makes life so sweet.
1422.author: Emily Dickinson

1423.quote: He stepped down, trying not to look long at her, as if she were the sun, yet he saw her, like the sun, even without looking.
1423.author: Leo Tolstoy,

1424.quote:
Maybe...you'll fall in love with me all over again."
"Hell," I said, "I love you enough now. What do you want to do? Ruin me?"
"Yes. I want to ruin you."
"Good," I said. "That's what I want too.
1424.author: Ernest Hemingway,

1425.quote: Have you ever noticed that anybody driving slower than you is an idiot, and anyone going faster than you is a maniac?
1425.author: George Carlin

1426.quote: If we wait for the moment when everything, absolutely everything is ready, we shall never begin.
1426.author: Ivan Turgenev

1427.quote: Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence.
1427.author: Robert Frost

1428.quote: Take pride in your pain; you are stronger than those who have none
1428.author: Lois Lowry,

1429.quote: Never say 'no' to adventures. Always say 'yes,' otherwise you'll lead a very dull life.
1429.author: Ian Fleming

1430.quote: Love is an untamed force. When we try to control it, it destroys us. When we try to imprison it, it enslaves us. When we try to understand it, it leaves us feeling lost and confused.
1430.author: Paulo Coelho

1431.quote: Yeah, Quirrell was a great teacher. There was just that minor drawback of him having Lord Voldemort sticking out of the back of his head!
1431.author: J.K. Rowling,

1432.quote: You can't measure the mutual affection of two human beings by the number of words they exchange.
1432.author: Milan Kundera

1434.quote: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
1434.author: George Bernard Shaw,

1435.quote:
How do you spell 'love'?" - Piglet
"You don't spell it...you feel it." - Pooh
1435.author: A.A. Milne

1436.quote: Money can't buy happiness, but it can make you awfully comfortable while you're being miserable.
1436.author: Clare Boothe Luce

1437.quote: I nodded, looking at Rachel with respect. "You hit the Lord of the Titans in the eye with a blue plastic hairbrush.
1437.author: Rick Riordan

1438.quote: If you treat an individual as he is, he will remain how he is. But if you treat him as if he were what he ought to be and could be, he will become what he ought to be and could be.
1438.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

1439.quote:
They're not hideous, said Tessa.
 Will blinked at her. What?
 Gideon and Gabriel, said Tessa. They're really quite good-looking, not hideous at all.
 I spoke, said Will, in sepulchral tones, of the pitch-black inner depths of their souls.
 Tessa snorted. And what color do you suppose the inner depths of your soul are, Will Herondale?
 Mauve, said Will.
1439.author: Cassandra Clare,

1440.quote: So it's you and a syringe against the Capitol? See, this is why no one lets you make the plans.
1440.author: Suzanne Collins,

1441.quote: When it is dark enough, you can see the stars.
1441.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

1442.quote: Though she be but little, she is fierce!
1442.author: William Shakespeare,

1443.quote:
So you're always honest," I said.
"Aren't you?"
"No," I told him. "I'm not."
"Well, that's good to know, I guess."
"I'm not saying I'm a liar," I told him. He raised his eyebrows. "That's not how I meant it, anyways."
"How'd you mean it, then?"
"I just...I don't always say what I feel."
"Why not?"
"Because the truth sometimes hurts," I said.
"Yeah," he said. "So do lies, though.
1443.author: Sarah Dessen,

1444.quote: you can, you should, and if you're brave enough to start, you will.
1444.author: Stephen King,

1445.quote: Reading furnishes the mind only with materials of knowledge; it is thinking that makes what we read ours.
1445.author: John Locke

1446.quote: The meek may inherit the earth, but at the moment it belongs to the conceited. Like me.
1446.author: Cassandra Clare,

1447.quote:
Clary, 

Despite everything, I can't bear the thought of this ring being lost forever, any more then I can bear the thought of leaving you forever. And though I have no choice about the one, at least I can choose about the other. I'm leaving you our family ring because you have as much right to it as I do.
I'm writing this watching the sun come up. You're asleep, dreams moving behind your restless eyelids. I wish I knew what you were thinking. I wish I could slip into your head and see the world the way you do. I wish I could see <u>myself</u> the way you do. But maybe I dont want to see that. Maybe it would make me feel even more than I already do that I'm perpetuating some kind of Great Lie on you, and I couldn't stand that. 
I belong to you. You could do anything you wanted with me and I would let you. You could ask anything of me and I'd break myself trying to make you happy. My heart tells me this is the best and greatest feeling I have ever had. But my mind knows the difference between wanting what you can't have and wanting what you shouldn't want. And I shouldn't want you.
All night I've watched you sleeping, watched the moonlight come and go, casting its shadows across your face in black and white. I've never seen anything more beautiful. I think of the life we could have had if things were different, a life where this night is not a singular event, separate from everything else that's real, but every night. But things aren't different, and I can't look at you without feeling like I've tricked you into loving me.
The truth no one is willing to say out loud is that no one has a shot against Valentine but me. I can get close to him like no one else can. I can pretend I want to join him and he'll believe me, up until that last moment where I end it all, one way or another. I have something of Sebastian's; I can track him to where my father's hiding, and that's what I'm going to do. So I lied to you last night. I said I just wanted one night with you. But I want every night with you. And that's why I have to slip out of your window now, like a coward. Because if I had to tell you this to your face, I couldn't make myself go. 
I don't blame you if you hate me, I wish you would. As long as I can still dream, I will dream of you. 

_Jace
1447.author: Cassandra Clare,

1448.quote: You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read.
1448.author: James Baldwin

1449.quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
1449.author: Marcus Aurelius,

1450.quote: We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
1450.author: Joseph Campbell

1451.quote: Let us learn to show our friendship for a man when he is alive and not after he is dead.
1451.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,

1452.quote: Every great love starts with a great story...
1452.author: Nicholas Sparks,

1453.quote: There are three rules for writing a novel. Unfortunately, no one knows what they are.
1453.author: W. Somerset Maugham

1454.quote: So many things are possible just as long as you don't know they're impossible.
1454.author: Norton Juster,

1455.quote: The only way to get through life is to laugh your way through it. You either have to laugh or cry. I prefer to laugh. Crying gives me a headache.
1455.author: Marjorie Pay Hinckley

1456.quote: Life, he realize, was much like a song. In the beginning there is mystery, in the end there is confirmation, but it's in the middle where all the emotion resides to make the whole thing worthwhile.
1456.author: Nicholas Sparks,

1457.quote: Every man I meet wants to protect me. I can't figure out what from.
1457.author: Mae West

1458.quote: Books should go where they will be most appreciated, and not sit unread, gathering dust on a forgotten shelf, don't you agree?
1458.author: Christopher Paolini

1459.quote: And I thought about how many people have loved those songs. And how many people got through a lot of bad times because of those songs. And how many people enjoyed good times with those songs. And how much those songs really mean. I think it would be great to have written one of those songs. I bet if I wrote one of them, I would be very proud. I hope the people who wrote those songs are happy. I hope they feel it's enough. I really do because they've made me happy. And I'm only one person.
1459.author: Stephen Chbosky,

1460.quote: I could not tell you if I loved you the first moment I saw you, or if it was the second or third or fourth. But I remember the first moment I looked at you walking toward me and realized that somehow the rest of the world seemed to vanish when I was with you.
1460.author: Cassandra Clare,

1461.quote: What is that you express in your eyes? It seems to me more than all the print I have read in my life.
1461.author: Walt Whitman

1462.quote: Love is a temporary madness, it erupts like volcanoes and then subsides. And when it subsides, you have to make a decision. You have to work out whether your roots have so entwined together that it is inconceivable that you should ever part. Because this is what love is. Love is not breathlessness, it is not excitement, it is not the promulgation of promises of eternal passion, it is not the desire to mate every second minute of the day, it is not lying awake at night imagining that he is kissing every cranny of your body. No, don't blush, I am telling you some truths. That is just being "in love", which any fool can do. Love itself is what is left over when being in love has burned away, and this is both an art and a fortunate accident.
1462.author: Shawn Slovo,

1463.quote:
What if it lines up like it did in the Trojan War ... Athena versus Poseidon?"
"I don't know. But I just know that I'll be fighting next to you."
"Why?"
"Because you're my friend, Seaweed Brain. Any more stupid questions?
1463.author: Rick Riordan,

1464.quote: You couldn't relive your life, skipping the awful parts, without losing what made it worthwhile. You had to accept it as a whole--like the world, or the person you loved.
1464.author: Stewart O'Nan,

1465.quote: No woman really wants a man to carry her off; she only wants him to want to do it.
1465.author: Elizabeth Peters

1466.quote: If I got rid of my demons, I'd lose my angels.
1466.author: Tennessee Williams,

1467.quote: Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them; that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.
1467.author: Lao Tzu

1468.quote: A ship is safe in harbor, but that's not what ships are for.
1468.author: John A. Shedd

1469.author: William Shakespeare,

1470.quote: I realize now that dying is easy. Living is hard.
1470.author: Gayle Forman,

1471.quote: I cannot teach anybody anything. I can only make them think
1471.author: Socrates

1472.quote: Everybody talks about wanting to change things and help and fix, but ultimately all you can do is fix yourself. And that's a lot. Because if you can fix yourself, it has a ripple effect.
1472.author: Rob Reiner

1473.quote:
To be, or not to be: that is the question:
Whether 'tis nobler in the mind to suffer
The slings and arrows of outrageous fortune,
Or to take arms against a sea of troubles,
And by opposing end them? To die: to sleep;
No more; and by a sleep to say we end
The heart-ache and the thousand natural shocks
That flesh is heir to, 'tis a consummation
Devoutly to be wish'd. To die, to sleep;
To sleep: perchance to dream: ay, there's the rub;
For in that sleep of death what dreams may come
When we have shuffled off this mortal coil,
Must give us pause: there's the respect
That makes calamity of so long life;
For who would bear the whips and scorns of time,
The oppressor's wrong, the proud man's contumely,
The pangs of despised love, the law's delay,
The insolence of office and the spurns
That patient merit of the unworthy takes,
When he himself might his quietus make
With a bare bodkin? who would fardels bear,
To grunt and sweat under a weary life,
But that the dread of something after death,
The undiscover'd country from whose bourn
No traveller returns, puzzles the will
And makes us rather bear those ills we have
Than fly to others that we know not of?
Thus conscience does make cowards of us all;
And thus the native hue of resolution
Is sicklied o'er with the pale cast of thought,
And enterprises of great pith and moment
With this regard their currents turn awry,
And lose the name of action.--Soft you now!
The fair Ophelia! Nymph, in thy orisons
Be all my sins remember'd!
1473.author: William Shakespeare,

1474.quote: In politics, If you want anything said, ask a man. If you want anything done, ask a woman.
1474.author: Margaret Thatcher

1475.quote: I'm not young enough to know everything.
1475.author: J.M. Barrie,

1476.quote: All your life, you will be faced with a choice. You can choose love or hate...I choose love.
1476.author: Johnny Cash

1477.quote: Crying is all right in its way while it lasts. But you have to stop sooner or later, and then you still have to decide what to do.
1477.author: C.S. Lewis,

1478.quote:
If you are a dreamer come in
If you are a dreamer a wisher a liar
A hoper a pray-er a magic-bean-buyer
If youre a pretender com sit by my fire
For we have some flax golden tales to spin
Come in! 
Come in!
1478.author: Shel Silverstein

1479.quote: She read books as one would breathe air, to fill up and live.
1479.author: Annie Dillard,

1480.quote:
It's just that most really good-looking people are stupid, so I exceed expectations.'
'Right, it's primarily his hotness,' I said.
'It can be sort of blinding,' he said.
'It actually did blind our friend Isaac,' I said.
'Terrible tragedy, that. But can I help my own deadly beauty?'
'You cannot.'
'It is my burden, this beautiful face.'
'Not to mention your body.'
'Seriously, don't even get me started on my hot bod. You don't want to see me naked, Dave. Seeing me naked actually took Hazel Grace's breath away,' he said, nodding toward the oxygen tank.
1480.author: John Green,

1481.quote: Always find opportunities to make someone smile, and to offer random acts of kindness in everyday life.
1481.author: Roy T. Bennett,

1482.quote: There is no exquisite beauty... without some strangeness in the proportion.
1482.author: Edgar Allan Poe

1483.quote: I knew when I met you an adventure was going to happen.
1483.author: A.A. Milne

1484.quote: Youth is happy because it has the capacity to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.
1484.author: Franz Kafka

1485.quote: All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his.
1485.author: Oscar Wilde,

1486.quote: Anyone whose goal is 'something higher' must expect someday to suffer vertigo. What is vertigo? Fear of falling? No, Vertigo is something other than fear of falling. It is the voice of the emptiness below us which tempts and lures us, it is the desire to fall, against which, terrified, we defend ourselves.
1486.author: Milan Kundera,

1487.quote: Be clearly aware of the stars and infinity on high. Then life seems almost enchanted after all.
1487.author: Vincent Van Gogh

1488.quote: If you don't like someone's story, write your own.
1488.author: Chinua Achebe

1489.quote: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.
1489.author: Truman Capote

1490.quote:
The real story of the Fleece: there were these two children of Zeus, Cadmus and Europa, okay? They were about to get offered up as human sacrifices, when they prayed to Zeus to save them. So Zeus sent this magical flying ram with golden wool, which picked them up in Greece and carried them all the way to Colchis in Asia Minor. Well, actually it carried Cadmus. Europa fell off and died along the way, but that's not important."
"It was probably important to her.
1490.author: Rick Riordan,

1491.quote: And then he gives me a smile that just seems so genuinely sweet with just the right touch of shyness that unexpected warmth rushes through me.
1491.author: Suzanne Collins,

1492.quote: Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day.
1492.author: A.A. Milne,

1493.quote:
Time is
 Too Slow for those who Wait,
 Too Swift for those who Fear,
 Too Long for those who Grieve,
 Too Short for those who Rejoice;
 But for those who Love,
 Time is not.
1493.author: Henry van Dyke,

1494.quote: Biology gives you a brain. Life turns it into a mind.
1494.author: Jeffrey Eugenides,

1495.quote: Everyone is a moon, and has a dark side which he never shows to anybody.
1495.author: Mark Twain

1496.quote: It's a lot easier to be lost than found. It's the reason we're always searching and rarely discovered--so many locks not enough keys.
1496.author: Sarah Dessen,

1497.quote: I came from a real tough neighborhood. Once a guy pulled a knife on me. I knew he wasn't a professional, the knife had butter on it.
1497.author: Rodney Dangerfield

1498.quote: I regret that it takes a life to learn how to live.
1498.author: Jonathan Safran Foer,

1499.quote: Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.
1499.author: Sun Tzu,

1500.quote: The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it.
1500.author: Oscar Wilde,

1501.quote: Sometimes,' said Pooh, 'the smallest things take up the most room in your heart.
1501.author: A.A. Milne

1502.quote: Any fool knows men and women think differently at times, but the biggest difference is this. Men forget, but never forgive; women forgive, but never forget.
1502.author: Robert Jordan

1503.quote: There is no mistaking a real book when one meets it. It is like falling in love.
1503.author: Christopher Morley,

1504.quote:
When I am with you, we stay up all night.
When you're not here, I can't go to sleep.
Praise God for those two insomnias!
And the difference between them.
1504.author: Rumi

1505.quote: One can never have enough socks," said Dumbledore. "Another Christmas has come and gone and I didn't get a single pair. People will insist on giving me books.
1505.author: J.K. Rowling,

1506.quote:
Why were you lurking under our window?"
"Yes - yes, good point, Petunia! What were you doing under our windows, boy?"
"Listening to the news," said Harry in a resigned voice.
His aunt and uncle exchanged looks of outrage.
"Listening to the news! Again?"
"Well, it changes every day, you see," said Harry.
1506.author: J.K. Rowling,

1507.quote: Before you, Bella, my life was like a moonless night. Very dark, but there were stars, points of light and reason. ...And then you shot across my sky like a meteor. Suddenly everything was on fire; there was brilliancy, there was beauty. When you were gone, when the meteor had fallen over the horizon, everything went black. Nothing had changed, but my eyes were blinded by the light. I couldn't see the stars anymore. And there was no more reason, for anything.
1507.author: Stephenie Meyer,

1508.quote: If you don't know, the thing to do is not to get scared, but to learn.
1508.author: Ayn Rand,

1509.quote: A single dream is more powerful than a thousand realities.
1509.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne,

1510.quote:
Perhaps the greatest faculty our minds possess is the ability to cope with pain. Classic thinking teaches us of the four doors of the mind, which everyone moves through according to their need.

First is the door of sleep. Sleep offers us a retreat from the world and all its pain. Sleep marks passing time, giving us distance from the things that have hurt us. When a person is wounded they will often fall unconscious. Similarly, someone who hears traumatic news will often swoon or faint. This is the mind's way of protecting itself from pain by stepping through the first door.

Second is the door of forgetting. Some wounds are too deep to heal, or too deep to heal quickly. In addition, many memories are simply painful, and there is no healing to be done. The saying 'time heals all wounds' is false. Time heals most wounds. The rest are hidden behind this door.

Third is the door of madness. There are times when the mind is dealt such a blow it hides itself in insanity. While this may not seem beneficial, it is. There are times when reality is nothing but pain, and to escape that pain the mind must leave reality behind. 

Last is the door of death. The final resort. Nothing can hurt us after we are dead, or so we have been told.
1510.author: Patrick Rothfuss,

1511.quote: Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.
1511.author: Salvador Dali

1512.quote: A book is really like a lover. It arranges itself in your life in a way that is beautiful.
1512.author: Maurice Sendak

1513.quote:
Some lose all mind and become soul,insane.
some lose all soul and become mind, intellectual.
some lose both and become accepted
1513.author: Charles Bukowski

1514.quote: She says nothing at all, but simply stares upward into the dark sky and watches, with sad eyes, the slow dance of the infinite stars.
1514.author: Neil Gaiman,

1515.quote: Some people say, Never let them see you cry. I say, if you're so mad you could just cry, then cry. It terrifies everyone.
1515.author: Tina Fey,

1516.quote: You wanna fly, you got to give up the shit that weighs you down.
1516.author: Toni Morrison,

1517.quote: When people don't express themselves, they die one piece at a time.
1517.author: Laurie Halse Anderson,

1518.quote: America will never be destroyed from the outside. If we falter and lose our freedoms, it will be because we destroyed ourselves.
1518.author: Abraham Lincoln

1519.quote: It's funny how humans can wrap their mind around things and fit them into their version of reality.
1519.author: Rick Riordan,

1520.quote: Behind every exquisite thing that existed, there was something tragic.
1520.author: Oscar Wilde,

1521.quote: I've got nothing to do today but smile.
1521.author: Simon and Garfunkel

1522.quote: That's why they call it the American Dream, because you have to be asleep to believe it.
1522.author: George Carlin

1523.quote: You can cut all the flowers but you cannot keep Spring from coming.
1523.author: Pablo Neruda

1524.quote: Letting go doesn't mean that you don't care about someone anymore. It's just realizing that the only person you really have control over is yourself.
1524.author: Deborah Reber,

1525.quote: I stood still, vision blurring, and in that moment, I heard my heart break. It was a small, clean sound, like the snapping of a flower's stem.
1525.author: Diana Gabaldon,

1526.quote: I realize only one person will be damaged beyond repair if Peeta dies. Me.
1526.author: Suzanne Collins,

1527.quote: You cannot pick and choose what parts of her to love.
1527.author: Sarah J. Maas,

1528.quote: Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books.
1528.author: Julian Barnes,

1529.quote: All the secrets of the world are contained in books. Read at your own risk.
1529.author: Lemony Snicket

1530.quote: A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.
1530.author: Lao Tzu

1531.quote: It's often just enough to be with someone. I don't need to touch them. Not even talk. A feeling passes between you both. You're not alone.
1531.author: Marilyn Monroe

1532.quote: In life, unlike chess, the game continues after checkmate.
1532.author: Isaac Asimov

1533.quote: Children must be taught how to think, not what to think.
1533.author: Margaret Mead

1534.quote: A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools.
1534.author: Douglas Adams,

1535.quote: The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.
1535.author: William Arthur Ward

1536.quote: I think we ought to read only the kind of books that wound or stab us. If the book we're reading doesn't wake us up with a blow to the head, what are we reading for? So that it will make us happy, as you write? Good Lord, we would be happy precisely if we had no books, and the kind of books that make us happy are the kind we could write ourselves if we had to. But we need books that affect us like a disaster, that grieve us deeply, like the death of someone we loved more than ourselves, like being banished into forests far from everyone, like a suicide. A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us. That is my belief.
1536.author: Franz Kafka

1537.quote: Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society.
1537.author: Mark Twain

1538.quote:
Do I contradict myself?
Very well then I contradict myself,
(I am large, I contain multitudes.)
1538.author: Walt Whitman,

1539.quote: I have absolutely no pleasure in the stimulants in which I sometimes so madly indulge. It has not been in the pursuit of pleasure that I have periled life and reputation and reason. It has been the desperate attempt to escape from torturing memories, from a sense of insupportable loneliness and a dread of some strange impending doom.
1539.author: Edgar Allan Poe

1540.quote: We are cups, constantly and quietly being filled. The trick is, knowing how to tip ourselves over and let the beautiful stuff out.
1540.author: Ray Bradbury

1541.quote:
Was it hard?" I ask.
Letting go?"

Not as hard as holding on to something that wasn't real.
1541.author: Lisa Schroeder

1542.quote: There are so many fragile things, after all. People break so easily, and so do dreams and hearts.
1542.author: Neil Gaiman,

1543.quote: Every one of us is, in the cosmic perspective, precious. If a human disagrees with you, let him live. In a hundred billion galaxies, you will not find another.
1543.author: Carl Sagan,

1544.quote: The unreal is more powerful than the real. Because nothing is as perfect as you can imagine it. Because its only intangible ideas, concepts, beliefs, fantasies that last. Stone crumbles. Wood rots. People, well, they die. But things as fragile as a thought, a dream, a legend, they can go on and on. If you can change the way people think. The way they see themselves. The way they see the world. You can change the way people live their lives. That's the only lasting thing you can create.
1544.author: Chuck Palahniuk,

1545.quote: I've found that there is always some beauty left -- in nature, sunshine, freedom, in yourself; these can all help you.
1545.author: Anne Frank,

1546.quote: Remember to always be yourself. Unless you suck.
1546.author: Joss Whedon

1547.quote: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.
1547.author: Alice Walker

1548.quote:
A DEFINITION NOT FOUND
IN THE DICTIONARY
Not leaving: an act of trust and love,
often deciphered by children
1548.author: Markus Zusak,

1549.quote: A writer is someone for whom writing is more difficult than it is for other people.
1549.author: Thomas Mann,

1550.quote: Dogs never bite me. Just humans.
1550.author: Marilyn Monroe

1551.quote: I cannot sleep unless I am surrounded by books.
1551.author: Jorge Luis Borges

1552.quote:
Sometimes when I look at you, I feel I'm gazing at a distant star. 
It's dazzling, but the light is from tens of thousands of years ago.
Maybe the star doesn't even exist any more. Yet sometimes that light seems more real to me than anything.
1552.author: Haruki Murakami,

1553.quote: Raise your words, not voice. It is rain that grows flowers, not thunder.
1553.author: Rumi

1554.quote: I am selfish. I am brave.
1554.author: Veronica Roth,

1555.quote: Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
1555.author: Winston S. Churchill

1556.quote: I am too fond of reading books to care to write them.
1556.author: Oscar Wilde,

1557.quote: It's like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a story.
1557.author: Haruki Murakami,

1558.quote: I loved you like a man loves a woman he never touches, only writes to, keeps little photographs of.
1558.author: Charles Bukowski,

1559.quote: I think there's just one kind of folks. Folks.
1559.author: Harper Lee,

1560.quote:
A truth that's told with bad intent
Beats all the lies you can invent.
1560.author: William Blake,

1561.quote: Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.
1561.author: Kahlil Gibran

1562.quote: Stay gold, Ponyboy. Stay gold . . . The pillow seemed to sink a little, and Johnny died.
1562.author: S.E. Hinton,

1563.quote: It was, he thought, the difference between being dragged into the arena to face a battle to the death and walking into the arena with your head held high. Some people, perhaps, would say that there was little to choose between the two ways, but Dumbledore knew - and so do I, thought Harry, with a rush of fierce pride, and so did my parents - that there was all the difference in the world.
1563.author: J.K. Rowling,

1564.quote: Men are afraid that women will laugh at them. Women are afraid that men will kill them.
1564.author: Margaret Atwood

1565.quote: You will find that it is necessary to let things go; simply for the reason that they are heavy. So let them go, let go of them. I tie no weights to my ankles.
1565.author: C. JoyBell C.

1566.quote: I'm tough, I'm ambitious, and I know exactly what I want. If that makes me a bitch, okay.
1566.author: Madonna

1567.quote: It is my belief... that the truth is generally preferable to lies.
1567.author: J.K. Rowling,

1568.quote:
I'm not going to wear a red dress," she said.
"It would look stunning, My Lady," she called.
She spoke to the bubbles gathered on the surface of the water. "If there's anyone I wish to stun at dinner, I'll hit him in the face.
1568.author: Kristin Cashore,

1569.quote: Sometimes when I'm talking, my words can't keep up with my thoughts. I wonder why we think faster than we speak. Probably so we can think twice.
1569.author: Bill Watterson

1570.quote: There is a sacredness in tears....They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition and of unspeakable love.
1570.author: Washington Irving

1571.quote: You endure what is unbearable, and you bear it. That is all.
1571.author: Cassandra Clare,

1572.quote: Real loneliness is not necessarily limited to when you are alone.
1572.author: Charles Bukowski

1573.quote: The capacity for friendship is God's way of apologizing for our families.
1573.author: Jay McInerney,

1574.quote: You can't depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus.
1574.author: Mark Twain,

1575.quote: Anyway, I keep picturing all these little kids playing some game in this big field of rye and all. Thousands of little kids, and nobody's around - nobody big, I mean - except me. And I'm standing on the edge of some crazy cliff. What I have to do, I have to catch everybody if they start to go over the cliff - I mean if they're running and they don't look where they're going I have to come out from somewhere and catch them. That's all I do all day. I'd just be the catcher in the rye and all. I know it's crazy, but that's the only thing I'd really like to be.
1575.author: J. D. Salinger,

1576.quote: Much of my life had been devoted to trying not to cry in front of people who loved me, so I knew what Augustus was doing. You clench your teeth. You look up. You tell yourself that if they see you cry, it will hurt them, and you will be nothing but a Sadness in their lives, and you must not become a mere sadness, so you will not cry, and you say all of this to yourself while looking up at the ceiling, and then you swallow even though your throat does not want to close and you look at the person who loves you and smile.
1576.author: John Green,

1577.quote: The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.
1577.author: John Muir

1578.quote: If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man.
1578.author: Mark Twain

1579.quote: Stuff your eyes with wonder, he said, live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories.
1579.author: Ray Bradbury,

1580.quote: Better to be strong than pretty and useless.
1580.author: Lilith Saintcrow,

1581.quote: Ah! There is nothing like staying at home, for real comfort.
1581.author: Jane Austen

1582.quote: Is it so bad, then, to be misunderstood? Pythagoras was misunderstood, and Socrates, and Jesus, and Luther, and Copernicus, and Galileo, and Newton, and every pure and wise spirit that ever took flesh. To be great is to be misunderstood.
1582.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,

1583.quote: Maybe everyone can live beyond what they're capable of.
1583.author: Markus Zusak,

1584.quote: We both have war inside us. Sometimes it keeps us alive. Sometimes it threatens to destroy us.
1584.author: Veronica Roth,

1585.quote: But who can say what's best? That's why you need to grab whatever chance you have of happiness where you find it, and not worry about other people too much. My experience tells me that we get no more than two or three such chances in a life time, and if we let them go, we regret it for the rest of our lives.
1585.author: Haruki Murakami,

1586.quote: From the moment I picked up your book until I put it down, I was convulsed with laughter. Some day I intend reading it.
1586.author: Groucho Marx

1587.quote: A learning experience is one of those things that says, 'You know that thing you just did? Don't do that.
1587.author: Douglas Adams,

1588.quote: Don't Gain The World & Lose Your Soul, Wisdom Is Better Than Silver Or Gold.
1588.author: Bob Marley

1589.quote: People can lose their lives in libraries. They ought to be warned.
1589.author: Saul Bellow

1590.quote: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.
1590.author: Carl Gustav Jung

1591.quote: The one thing we can never get enough of is love. And the one thing we never give enough of is love.
1591.author: Henry Miller

1592.quote: I've been homesick for countries I've never been, and longed to be where I couldn't be.
1592.author: John Cheever

1593.quote: Would it save you a lot of time if I just gave up and went mad now?
1593.author: Douglas Adams,

1594.quote: Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today. Let us begin.
1594.author: Mother Theresa

1595.quote: The snake which cannot cast its skin has to die. As well the minds which are prevented from changing their opinions; they cease to be mind.
1595.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

1596.quote: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.
1596.author: Marcus Aurelius ,

1597.quote: There is only one thing in the world worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about.
1597.author: Oscar Wilde,

1599.quote: You only get one life. It's actually your duty to live it as fully as possible.
1599.author: Jojo Moyes,

1600.quote: We do not grow absolutely, chronologically. We grow sometimes in one dimension, and not in another; unevenly. We grow partially. We are relative. We are mature in one realm, childish in another. The past, present, and future mingle and pull us backward, forward, or fix us in the present. We are made up of layers, cells, constellations.
1600.author: Anais Nin

1601.quote: A purpose of human life, no matter who is controlling it, is to love whoever is around to be loved.
1601.author: Kurt Vonnegut,

1602.quote: Science and religion are not at odds. Science is simply too young to understand.
1602.author: Dan Brown,

1603.quote: Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.
1603.author: Thomas Jefferson

1604.quote: It's amazing how a little tomorrow can make up for a whole lot of yesterday.
1604.author: John Guare,

1605.quote: You realize that our mistrust of the future makes it hard to give up the past.
1605.author: Chuck Palahniuk,

1606.quote:
Love the life you live.
Live the life you love.
1606.author: Bob Marley

1607.quote: Our story has three parts: a beginning, a middle, and an end. And although this is the way all stories unfold, I still can't believe that ours didn't go on forever.
1607.author: Nicholas Sparks,

1608.quote: Even if you are on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.
1608.author: Will Rogers

1609.quote: Great minds are always feared by lesser minds.
1609.author: Dan Brown,

1610.quote: Let's think the unthinkable, let's do the undoable. Let us prepare to grapple with the ineffable itself, and see if we may not eff it after all.
1610.author: Douglas Adams,

1611.quote: Cruelty does not make a person dishonest, the same way bravery does not make a person kind.
1611.author: Veronica Roth,

1612.quote: Of all the trees we could've hit, we had to get one that hits back.
1612.author: J.K. Rowling,

1613.quote: And he took her in his arms and kissed her under the sunlit sky, and he cared not that they stood high upon the walls in the sight of many.
1613.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

1614.quote: The only way that we can live, is if we grow. The only way that we can grow is if we change. The only way that we can change is if we learn. The only way we can learn is if we are exposed. And the only way that we can become exposed is if we throw ourselves out into the open. Do it. Throw yourself.
1614.author: C. JoyBell C.

1615.quote:
Still round the corner there may wait
 A new road or a secret gate
And though I oft have passed them by
 A day will come at last when I
Shall take the hidden paths that run
 West of the Moon, East of the Sun.
1615.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

1616.quote: Three may keep a secret, if two of them are dead.
1616.author: Benjamin Franklin,

1617.quote: When he died, all things soft and beautiful and bright would be buried with him.
1617.author: Madeline Miller,

1618.quote:
She seems so cool, so focused, so quiet, yet her eyes remain fixed upon the horizon. You think you know all there is to know about her immediately upon meeting her, but everything you think you know is wrong. Passion flows through her like a river of blood. 

She only looked away for a moment, and the mask slipped, and you fell. All your tomorrows start here.
1618.author: Neil Gaiman,

1619.quote: I believe a strong woman may be stronger than a man, particularly if she happens to have love in her heart. I guess a loving woman is indestructible.
1619.author: John Steinbeck,

1620.quote: being alone never felt right. sometimes it felt good, but it never felt right.
1620.author: Charles Bukowski,

1621.quote: Anyone who falls in love is searching for the missing pieces of themselves. So anyone who's in love gets sad when they think of their lover. It's like stepping back inside a room you have fond memories of, one you haven't seen in a long time.
1621.author: Murakami, Haruki

1622.quote: I have come to accept the feeling of not knowing where I am going. And I have trained myself to love it. Because it is only when we are suspended in mid-air with no landing in sight, that we force our wings to unravel and alas begin our flight. And as we fly, we still may not know where we are going to. But the miracle is in the unfolding of the wings. You may not know where you're going, but you know that so long as you spread your wings, the winds will carry you.
1622.author: C. JoyBell C.

1623.quote: Art and love are the same thing: It's the process of seeing yourself in things that are not you.
1623.author: Chuck Klosterman,

1624.quote: You gave me a forever within the numbered days, and I'm grateful.
1624.author: John Green,

1625.quote: My Best Friend is a person who will give me a book I have not read.
1625.author: Abraham Lincoln

1626.quote: Beauty is only skin deep, but ugly goes clean to the bone.
1626.author: Dorothy Parker

1627.quote: If you hate a person, you hate something in him that is part of yourself. What isn't part of ourselves doesn't disturb us.
1627.author: Hermann Hesse,

1628.quote: When everyone knows you're a monster, you needn't waste time doing every monstrous thing.
1628.author: Leigh Bardugo,

1629.quote:
Don't tell me," Jace said, "Simon's turned himself into an ocelot and you want me to do something about it before Isabelle makes him into a stole. Well, you'll have have to wait till tomorrow. I'm out of commission." He pointed at himself - he was wearing blue pajamas with a hole in the sleeve. "Look. Jammies."
"Jace," Clary said, "this is important."
"Don't tell me," he said. "You've got a drawing emergency. You need a nude model. Well, I'm not in the mood. You could always ask Hodge," he said as an afterthought. "I hear he'll do anything for a -"
"JACE!" she interrupted him, her voice rising to a scream. "JUST SHUT UP FOR A SECOND AND LISTEN, WILL YOU?
1629.author: Cassandra Clare,

1630.quote: The best portion of a good man's life: his little, nameless unremembered acts of kindness and love.
1630.author: William Wordsworth,

1631.quote: Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.
1631.author: Victor Hugo,

1632.quote: Sometimes it's a form of love just to talk to somebody that you have nothing in common with and still be fascinated by their presence.
1632.author: David Byrne

1634.quote: Respect was invented to cover the empty place where love should be.
1634.author: Leo Tolstoy,

1635.quote: There is no such thing as bad people. We're all just people who sometimes do bad things.
1635.author: Colleen Hoover,

1636.quote: A woman without a man is like a fish without a bicycle.
1636.author: Irina Dunn

1637.quote: This is what you shall do; Love the earth and sun and the animals, despise riches, give alms to every one that asks, stand up for the stupid and crazy, devote your income and labor to others, hate tyrants, argue not concerning God, have patience and indulgence toward the people, take off your hat to nothing known or unknown or to any man or number of men, go freely with powerful uneducated persons and with the young and with the mothers of families, read these leaves in the open air every season of every year of your life, re-examine all you have been told at school or church or in any book, dismiss whatever insults your own soul, and your very flesh shall be a great poem and have the richest fluency not only in its words but in the silent lines of its lips and face and between the lashes of your eyes and in every motion and joint of your body.
1637.author: Walt Whitman

1638.quote: Every now and then I like to do as I'm told, just to confuse people.
1638.author: Tamora Pierce,

1639.quote: It's possible to go on, no matter how impossible it seems, and that in time, the grief . . . lessens. It may not go away completely, but after a while it's not so overwhelming.
1639.author: Nicholas Sparks,

1640.quote: Lighthouses don't go running all over an island looking for boats to save; they just stand there shining.
1640.author: Anne Lamott

1641.quote: Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen.
1641.author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon,

1642.quote: If I had a world of my own, everything would be nonsense. Nothing would be what it is, because everything would be what it isn't. And contrary wise, what is, it wouldn't be. And what it wouldn't be, it would. You see?
1642.author: Lewis Carroll,

1643.quote: Don't be so humble - you are not that great.
1643.author: Golda Meir

1644.quote: There are books of which the backs and covers are by far the best parts.
1644.author: Charles Dickens,

1645.quote:
I knew the second I met you
that there was something about you I needed. Turns out it 
wasn't something about you at all. It was just you.
1645.author: Jamie McGuire,

1646.quote: I like good strong words that mean something...
1646.author: Louisa May Alcott,
