1647.quote: I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.
1647.author: Louisa May Alcott,

1648.quote: It is thanks to my evening reading alone that I am still more or less sane.
1648.author: W.G. Sebald,

1649.quote: My imagination functions much better when I don't have to speak to people.
1649.author: Patricia Highsmith

1650.quote:
I meant," said Ipslore bitterly, "what is there in this world that truly makes living worthwhile?"
Death thought about it.
CATS, he said eventually. CATS ARE NICE.
1650.author: Terry Pratchett,

1651.quote: let me live, love, and say it well in good sentences
1651.author: Sylvia Plath,

1652.quote: I had already found that it was not good to be alone, and so made companionship with what there was around me, sometimes with the universe and sometimes with my own insignificant self; but my books were always my friends, let fail all else.
1652.author: Joshua Slocum,

1653.quote: Maybe there is a beast... maybe it's only us.
1653.author: William Golding,

1654.quote: I was wise enough never to grow up, while fooling people into believing I had.
1654.author: Margaret Mead

1655.quote: If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're mis-informed.
1655.author: Mark Twain

1656.quote: Yes, I was infatuated with you: I am still. No one has ever heightened such a keen capacity of physical sensation in me. I cut you out because I couldn't stand being a passing fancy. Before I give my body, I must give my thoughts, my mind, my dreams. And you weren't having any of those.
1656.author: Sylvia Plath,

1657.quote: Kindred spirits are not so scarce as I used to think. It's splendid to find out there are so many of them in the world.
1657.author: L.M. Montgomery,

1658.quote: It is easier to forgive an enemy than to forgive a friend.
1658.author: William Blake

1659.quote: What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make.
1659.author: Jane Goodall

1660.quote: The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.
1660.author: Bette Midler

1661.quote: I am constantly torn between killing myself and killing everyone around me.
1661.author: David Levithan,

1662.quote: Never give up... No one knows what's going to happen next.
1662.author: L. Frank Baum

1663.quote: Yes, frosting. The final defense of the dying.
1663.author: Suzanne Collins,

1664.quote: May the forces of evil become confused on the way to your house.
1664.author: George Carlin

1665.quote: Wisdom comes from experience. Experience is often a result of lack of wisdom.
1665.author: Terry Pratchett

1666.quote: A good book is an event in my life.
1666.author: Stendhal,

1667.quote: People who deny the existence of dragons are often eaten by dragons. From within.
1667.author: Ursula K. Le Guin,

1668.quote: Today was good. Today was fun. Tomorrow is another one.
1668.author: Dr. Seuss

1669.quote: Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet.
1669.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

1670.quote: One day you will kiss a man you can't breathe without, and find that breath is of little consequence.
1670.author: Karen Marie Moning,

1671.quote: I'm oxygen and he's dying to breathe.
1671.author: Tahereh Mafi,

1672.quote: Isn't it enough to see that a garden is beautiful without having to believe that there are fairies at the bottom of it too?
1672.author: Douglas Adams,

1673.quote: If neurotic is wanting two mutually exclusive things at one and the same time, then I'm neurotic as hell. I'll be flying back and forth between one mutually exclusive thing and another for the rest of my days.
1673.author: Sylvia Plath,

1674.quote: Once you had put the pieces back together, even though you may look intact, you were never quite the same as you'd been before the fall.
1674.author: Jodi Picoult

1675.quote: Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth.
1675.author: Alan Watts

1676.quote: There ain't no sin and there ain't no virtue. There's just stuff people do.
1676.author: John Steinbeck,

1677.quote: She was the heir of ash and fire, and she would bow to no one.
1677.author: Sarah J. Maas,

1678.quote: He was my mum and dad's best friend. He's a convicted murderer, but he's broken out of wizard prison and he's on the run. He likes to keep in touch with me, though...keep up with my news...check if I'm happy...
1678.author: J.K. Rowling,

1679.quote: If I'd observed all the rules I'd never have got anywhere.
1679.author: Marilyn Monroe

1680.quote: Promise me you'll never forget me because if I thought you would, I'd never leave.
1680.author: A.A. Milne

1681.quote: He was going to live forever, or die in the attempt.
1681.author: Joseph Heller,

1682.quote: To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance.
1682.author: Oscar Wilde,

1683.quote: If things start happening, don't worry, don't stew, just go right along and you'll start happening too.
1683.author: Dr. Seuss

1684.quote: A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality.
1684.author: John Lennon

1685.quote: The world is a dangerous place to live, not because of the people who are evil, but because of the people who don't do anything about it.
1685.author: Albert Einstein

1686.quote: Don't feel bad for one moment about doing what brings you joy.
1686.author: Sarah J. Maas,

1687.quote: People worry about kids playing with guns, and teenagers watching violent videos; we are scared that some sort of culture of violence will take them over. Nobody worries about kids listening to thousands - literally thousands - of songs about broken hearts and rejection and pain and misery and loss.
1687.author: Nick Hornby,

1688.quote:
I'm not sentimental--I'm as romantic as you are. The idea, you know,
is that the sentimental person thinks things will last--the romantic
person has a desperate confidence that they won't.
1688.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,

1689.quote: Pain insists upon being attended to. God whispers to us in our pleasures, speaks in our consciences, but shouts in our pains. It is his megaphone to rouse a deaf world.
1689.author: C.S. Lewis

1690.quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
1690.author: Confucius

1692.quote:
What are all these?" Clary asked.
"Vials of holy water, blessed knives, steel and silver blades," Jace said, piling the weapons on the floor beside him, "electrum wire - not much use at the moment but it's always good to have spares - silver bullets, charms of protetion, crucifixes, stars of David-"
"Jesus," said Clary
"I doubt he'd fit."
"Jace." Clary was appalled.
1692.author: Cassandra Clare,

1693.quote:
Do not go gentle into that good night.
Rage, rage against the dying of the light.
1693.author: Dylan Thomas,

1694.quote: Did you know that for pretty much the entire history of the human species, the average life span was less than thirty years? You could count on ten years or so of real adulthood, right? There was no planning for retirement, There was no planning for a career. There was no planning. No time for plannning. No time for a future. But then the life spans started getting longer, and people started having more and more future. And now life has become the future. Every moment of your life is lived for the future--you go to high school so you can go to college so you can get a good job so you can get a nice house so you can afford to send your kids to college so they can get a good job so they can get a nice house so they can afford to send their kids to college.
1694.author: John Green,

1695.quote:
Your beliefs become your thoughts, 
Your thoughts become your words, 
Your words become your actions, 
Your actions become your habits, 
Your habits become your values, 
Your values become your destiny.
1695.author: Gandhi

1696.quote: And I asked myself about the present: how wide it was, how deep it was, how much was mine to keep.
1696.author: Kurt Vonnegut,

1697.quote: Believe nothing you hear, and only one half that you see.
1697.author: Edgar Allan Poe

1699.quote: The world is full of magic things, patiently waiting for our senses to grow sharper.
1699.author: W.B. Yeats

1700.quote: My tongue will tell the anger of my heart, or else my heart concealing it will break.
1700.author: William Shakespeare,

1701.quote: No one knows for certain how much impact they have on the lives of other people. Oftentimes, we have no clue. Yet we push it just the same.
1701.author: Jay Asher,

1702.quote: Most books on witchcraft will tell you that witches work naked. This is because most books on witchcraft were written by men.
1702.author: Neil Gaiman

1703.quote: You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.
1703.author: Sharon Salzberg

1704.quote: She leaned down and looked at his lifeless face and Leisel kissed her best friend, Rudy Steiner, soft and true on his lips. He tasted dusty and sweet. He tasted like regret in the shadows of trees and in the glow of the anarchist's suit collection. She kissed him long and soft, and when she pulled herself away, she touched his mouth with her fingers...She did not say goodbye. She was incapable, and after a few more minutes at his side, she was able to tear herself from the ground. It amazes me what humans can do, even when streams are flowing down their faces and they stagger on...
1704.author: Markus Zusak,

1705.quote: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
1705.author: T.S. Eliot

1706.quote: Don't wait for a light to appear at the end of the tunnel, stride down there and light the bloody thing yourself.
1706.author: Sara Henderson

1707.quote: In the beginning there was nothing, which exploded.
1707.author: Terry Pratchett,

1708.quote: Who in the world am I? Ah, that's the great puzzle.
1708.author: Lewis Carroll ,

1709.quote: No matter what he does, every person on earth plays a central role in the history of the world. And normally he doesn't know it.
1709.author: Paulo Coelho,

1710.quote: For what it's worth: it's never too late or, in my case, too early to be whoever you want to be. There's no time limit, stop whenever you want. You can change or stay the same, there are no rules to this thing. We can make the best or the worst of it. I hope you make the best of it. And I hope you see things that startle you. I hope you feel things you never felt before. I hope you meet people with a different point of view. I hope you live a life you're proud of. If you find that you're not, I hope you have the courage to start all over again.
1710.author: Eric Roth,

1711.quote: Never underestimate the power of stupid people in large groups.
1711.author: George Carlin

1712.quote:
For whatever we lose (like a you or a me),
It's always our self we find in the sea.
1712.author: e.e. cummings,

1713.quote: It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious.
1713.author: Oscar Wilde,

1714.quote: The creatures outside looked from pig to man, and from man to pig, and from pig to man again; but already it was impossible to say which was which.
1714.author: George Orwell,

1715.quote: My soul is from elsewhere, I'm sure of that, and I intend to end up there.
1715.author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

1716.quote: Light thinks it travels faster than anything but it is wrong. No matter how fast light travels, it finds the darkness has always got there first, and is waiting for it.
1716.author: Terry Pratchett,

1717.quote: Only the dead have seen the end of war.
1717.author: Plato

1718.quote:
Do not fall in love with people like me. 
I will take you to museums, and parks, and monuments, and kiss you in every beautiful place, so that you can never go back to them without tasting me like blood in your mouth.
I will destroy you in the most beautiful way possible. And when I leave you will finally understand, why storms are named after people.
1718.author: Caitlyn Siehl,

1719.quote: We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.
1719.author: Leo Tolstoy,

1720.quote:
You possess other people's...bodies."

He accepted that statement with a nod.

"Do you want to possess my body?"

"I want to do a lot of things to your body, but that's not one of them.
1720.author: Becca Fitzpatrick,

1721.quote: I didn't need you, you idiot. I picked you. And then you picked me back.
1721.author: John Green,

1722.quote: Books are easily destroyed. But words will live as long as people can remember them.
1722.author: Tahereh Mafi,

1723.quote: You're alive only once, as far as we know, and what could be worse than getting to the end of your life and realizing you hadn't lived it?
1723.author: Edward Albee

1724.quote: People shouldn't be afraid of their government. Governments should be afraid of their people.
1724.author: Alan Moore,

1725.quote: Love is the absence of judgment.
1725.author: Dalai Lama XIV

1726.quote: In a way, it's nice to know that there are Greek gods out there, because you have somebody to blame when things go wrong. For instance, when you're walking away from a bus that's just been attacked by monster hags and blown up by lightning, and it's raining on top of everything else, most people might think that's just really bad luck; when you're a half-blood, you understand that some devine force is really trying to mess up your day.
1726.author: Rick Riordan,

1727.quote: One thing you can't hide - is when you're crippled inside.
1727.author: John Lennon

1728.quote: The library is inhabited by spirits that come out of the pages at night.
1728.author: Isabel Allende

1729.quote:
But he who dares not grasp the thorn 
Should never crave the rose.
1729.author: Anne Bronte

1730.quote: There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.
1730.author: J. K. Rowling,

1731.quote:
I knew, in the silence that followed, that anything could happen here. It might be too late: again, I might have missed my chance. But I would at least know I tried, that I took my heart and extended my hand, whatever the outcome.
"Okay," he said. He took a breath. "What would you do, if you could do anything?"
I took a step toward him, closing the space between us. "This," I said. And then I kissed him.
1731.author: Sarah Dessen,

1732.quote:
Everyone must leave something behind when he dies, my grandfather said. A child or a book or a painting or a house or a wall built or a pair of shoes made. Or a garden planted. Something your hand touched some way so your soul has somewhere to go when you die, and when people look at that tree or that flower you planted, you're there. 

It doesn't matter what you do, he said, so long as you change something from the way it was before you touched it into something that's like you after you take your hands away. The difference between the man who just cuts lawns and a real gardener is in the touching, he said. The lawn-cutter might just as well not have been there at all; the gardener will be there a lifetime.
1732.author: Ray Bradbury,

1733.quote: There was another life that I might have had, but I am having this one.
1733.author: Kazuo Ishiguro

1734.quote: I wonder if the snow loves the trees and fields, that it kisses them so gently? And then it covers them up snug, you know, with a white quilt; and perhaps it says, "Go to sleep, darlings, till the summer comes again.
1734.author: Lewis Carroll,

1735.quote: Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other.
1735.author: Mark Twain

1736.quote: I wanted a perfect ending. Now I've learned, the hard way, that some poems don't rhyme, and some stories don't have a clear beginning, middle, and end.
1736.author: Gilda Radner

1737.quote: Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.
1737.author: J.K. Rowling,

1738.quote: We can never judge the lives of others, because each person knows only their own pain and renunciation. It's one thing to feel that you are on the right path, but it's another to think that yours is the only path.
1738.author: Paulo Coelho

1739.quote:
The moon is a loyal companion.
It never leaves. It's always there, watching, steadfast, knowing us in our light and dark moments, changing forever just as we do. Every day it's a different version of itself. Sometimes weak and wan, sometimes strong and full of light. The moon understands what it means to be human.
Uncertain. Alone. Cratered by imperfections.
1739.author: Tahereh Mafi,

1740.quote: Success makes so many people hate you. I wish it wasn't that way. It would be wonderful to enjoy success without seeing envy in the eyes of those around you.
1740.author: Marilyn Monroe

1741.quote: Tell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learn.
1741.author: Benjamin Franklin

1742.quote: There is greatness in doing something you hate for the sake of someone you love.
1742.author: Shmuley Boteach

1743.quote: You think my first instinct is to protect you. Because you're small, or a girl, or a Stiff. But you're wrong." He leans his face close to mine and wraps his fingers around my chin. His hand smells like metal. When was the last time he held a gun, or a knife? My skin tingles at the point of contact, like he's transmitting electricity through his skin. "My first instinct is to push you until you break, just to see how hard I have to press." he says, his fingers squeezing at the word break. My body tenses at the edge in his voice, so I am coiled as tight as a spring, and I forget to breathe. His dark eyes lifting to mine, he adds, "But I resist it." "Why..." I swallow hard. "Why is that your first instinct?" "Fear doesn't shut you down; it wakes you up. I've seen it. It's fascinating." He releases me but doesn't pull away, his hand grazing my jaw, my neck. "Sometimes I just want to see it again. Want to see you awake.
1743.author: Veronica Roth,

1744.quote: Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there's so much to smile about.
1744.author: Marilyn Monroe

1745.quote: Our memory is a more perfect world than the universe: it gives back life to those who no longer exist.
1745.author: Guy de Maupassant

1746.quote: You have to know what you stand for, not just what you stand against.
1746.author: Laurie Halse Anderson,

1747.quote: I am glad you are here with me. Here at the end of all things, Sam.
1747.author: J.R.R. Tolkien,

1748.quote: Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.
1748.author: Thomas Merton ,

1749.quote: DON'T THINK OF IT AS DYING, said Death. JUST THINK OF IT AS LEAVING EARLY TO AVOID THE RUSH.
1749.author: Terry Pratchett,

1750.quote: Compassion is the basis of morality.
1750.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

1751.quote: Then I realize what it is. It's him. Something about him makes me feel like I am about to fall. Or turn to liquid. Or burst into flames.
1751.author: Veronica Roth,

1752.quote:
So when the moon's only partly full, you only feel a little wolfy?" 
"You could say that."
"Well, you can go ahead and hang your head out the car window if you feel like it."
"I'm a werewolf, not a golden retriever.
1752.author: Cassandra Clare

1753.quote:
The best fantasy is written in the language of dreams. It is alive as dreams are alive, more real than real ... for a moment at least ... that long magic moment before we wake.

 Fantasy is silver and scarlet, indigo and azure, obsidian veined with gold and lapis lazuli. Reality is plywood and plastic, done up in mud brown and olive drab. Fantasy tastes of habaneros and honey, cinnamon and cloves, rare red meat and wines as sweet as summer. Reality is beans and tofu, and ashes at the end. Reality is the strip malls of Burbank, the smokestacks of Cleveland, a parking garage in Newark. Fantasy is the towers of Minas Tirith, the ancient stones of Gormenghast, the halls of Camelot. Fantasy flies on the wings of Icarus, reality on Southwest Airlines. Why do our dreams become so much smaller when they finally come true?

 We read fantasy to find the colors again, I think. To taste strong spices and hear the songs the sirens sang. There is something old and true in fantasy that speaks to something deep within us, to the child who dreamt that one day he would hunt the forests of the night, and feast beneath the hollow hills, and find a love to last forever somewhere south of Oz and north of Shangri-La.

 They can keep their heaven. When I die, I'd sooner go to middle Earth.
1753.author: George R.R. Martin

1754.quote: The ships hung in the sky in much the same way that bricks don't.
1754.author: Douglas Adams,

1755.quote: When I had nothing to lose, I had everything. When I stopped being who I am, I found myself.
1755.author: Paulo Coelho,

1756.quote: In a time of destruction, create something.
1756.author: Maxine Hong Kingston

1757.quote: Youth can not know how age thinks and feels. But old men are guilty if they forget what it was to be young.
1757.author: J.K. Rowling ,

1758.quote: The beauty of a woman is not in the clothes she wears, the figure that she carries, or the way she combs her hair. The beauty of a woman is seen in her eyes, because that is the doorway to her heart, the place where love resides. True beauty in a woman is reflected in her soul. It's the caring that she lovingly gives, the passion that she shows & the beauty of a woman only grows with passing years.
1758.author: Audrey Hepburn

1759.quote: When the heart speaks, the mind finds it indecent to object.
1759.author: Milan Kundera,

1760.quote: Silence make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying, but the never needing to say that counts.
1760.author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

1761.quote: I have learned now that while those who speak about one's miseries usually hurt, those who keep silence hurt more.
1761.author: C. S. Lewis

1762.quote:
I want to see you.

Know your voice.

Recognize you when you
first come 'round the corner.

Sense your scent when I come 
into a room you've just left.

Know the lift of your heel,
the glide of your foot.

Become familiar with the way 
you purse your lips
then let them part, 
just the slightest bit,
when I lean in to your space
and kiss you.

I want to know the joy 
of how you whisper 
"more
1762.author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

1763.quote: Children begin by loving their parents; as they grow older they judge them; sometimes they forgive them.
1763.author: Oscar Wilde,

1764.quote: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.
1764.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

1765.quote: They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.
1765.author: Benjamin Franklin,

1766.quote:
My bounty is as boundless as the sea,
My love as deep; the more I give to thee,
The more I have, for both are infinite.
1766.author: William Shakespeare,

1767.quote: Remember, remember, this is now, and now, and now. Live it, feel it, cling to it. I want to become acutely aware of all I've taken for granted.
1767.author: Sylvia Plath

1768.quote: Even strength must bow to wisdom sometimes.
1768.author: Rick Riordan,

1769.quote: I'm saying that I'm a moody, insecure, narrow-minded, jealous, borderline homicidal bitch, and I want you to promise me that you're okay with that, because it's who I am, and you're what I need.
1769.author: Jeaniene Frost,

1770.quote: When you spend so long trapped in darkness, Lucien, you find that the darkness begins to stare back.
1770.author: Sarah J. Maas,

1771.quote: You can have it all. Just not all at once.
1771.author: Oprah Winfrey

1772.quote: I desire the things that will destroy me in the end.
1772.author: Sylvia Plath,

1773.quote: A child can teach an adult three things: to be happy for no reason, to always be busy with something, and to know how to demand with all his might that which he desires.
1773.author: Paulo Coelho

1774.quote:
silence is the language of god, 
all else is poor translation.
1774.author: Rumi

1775.quote:
Sonnet XVII

I do not love you as if you were salt-rose, or topaz,
or the arrow of carnations the fire shoots off.
I love you as certain dark things are to be loved,
in secret, between the shadow and the soul.

I love you as the plant that never blooms
but carries in itself the light of hidden flowers;
thanks to your love a certain solid fragrance,
risen from the earth, lives darkly in my body.

I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where.
I love you straightforwardly, without complexities or pride;
so I love you because I know no other way than this: 

where I does not exist, nor you,
so close that your hand on my chest is my hand,
so close that your eyes close as I fall asleep.
1775.author: Pablo Neruda

1776.quote: Life isn't finding shelter in the storm. It's about learning to dance in the rain.
1776.author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,

1777.quote: Never forget what you are, for surely the world will not. Make it your strength. Then it can never be your weakness.
1777.author: George R.R. Martin,

1778.quote: My library is an archive of longings.
1778.author: Susan Sontag,

1779.quote: If you want to keep a secret, you must also hide it from yourself.
1779.author: George Orwell,

1780.quote: Keep in mind that people change, but the past doesn't.
1780.author: Becca Fitzpatrick,

1781.quote: I suppose a fire that burns that bright is not meant to last.
1781.author: Veronica Roth,

1782.quote: Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know.
1782.author: Lao Tsu,

1783.quote: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
1783.author: Confucious

1784.quote: It's the questions we can't answer that teach us the most. They teach us how to think. If you give a man an answer, all he gains is a little fact. But give him a question and he'll look for his own answers.
1784.author: Patrick Rothfuss,

1785.quote: Confidence is ignorance. If you're feeling cocky, it's because there's something you don't know.
1785.author: Eoin Colfer,

1786.quote: We didn't talk about anything heavy or light. We were just there together. And that was enough
1786.author: Stephen Chbosky,

1787.quote: Books are the carriers of civilization...They are companions, teachers, magicians, bankers of the treasures of the mind. Books are humanity in print.
1787.author: Barbara W. Tuchman

1788.quote:
Your friend's poetry is terrible," he said.
Clary blinked, caught momentarily off guard. "What?"
"I said his poetry was terrible. It sounds like he ate a dictionary and started vomiting up words at random.
1788.author: Cassandra Clare,

1789.quote: You should never be surprised when someone treats you with respect, you should expect it.
1789.author: Sarah Dessen,

1790.quote: A girl should be two things: who and what she wants.
1790.author: Coco Chanel,

1791.quote: The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.
1791.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

1792.quote: Every time you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing.
1792.author: Mother Teresa

1793.quote: Lack of direction, not lack of time, is the problem. We all have twenty-four hour days.
1793.author: Zig Ziglar

1794.quote: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear - not absence of fear.
1794.author: Mark Twain

1795.quote: There is only one sin. and that is theft... when you tell a lie, you steal someones right to the truth.
1795.author: Khaled Hosseini,

1796.quote: Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts.
1796.author: Charles Dickens

1797.quote: A half-read book is a half-finished love affair.
1797.author: David Mitchell,

1798.quote:
Must you go? I was rather hoping you'd stay and be a ministering angel, but if you must go, you must."

"I'll stay," Will said a bit crossly, and threw himself down in the armchair Tessa had just vacated. "I can minister angelically."

"None too convincingly. And you're not as pretty to look at as Tessa is," Jem said, closing his eyes as he leaned back against the pillow.

"How rude. Many who have gazed upon me have compared the experience to gazing at the radiance of the sun."

Jem still had his eyes closed. "If they mean it gives you a headache, they aren't wrong.
1798.author: Cassandra Clare,

1799.quote:
I will remember the kisses 
our lips raw with love 
and how you gave me 
everything you had 
and how I 
offered you what was left of 
me, 
and I will remember your small room 
the feel of you 
the light in the window 
your records 
your books 
our morning coffee 
our noons our nights 
our bodies spilled together 
sleeping 
the tiny flowing currents 
immediate and forever 
your leg my leg 
your arm my arm 
your smile and the warmth 
of you 
who made me laugh 
again.
1799.author: Charles Bukowski

1800.quote:
Though my soul may set in darkness, it will rise in perfect light; 
I have loved the stars too fondly to be fearful of the night.
1800.author: Sarah   Williams,

1801.quote: Nothing in the world is ever completely wrong. Even a stopped clock is right twice a day.
1801.author: Paulo Coelho,

1802.quote: Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit.
1802.author: Oscar Wilde

1803.quote: A book lying idle on a shelf is wasted ammunition.
1803.author: Henry Miller,

1804.quote: I'll just have them change the entry in the demonology textbook from 'almost extinct' to 'not extinct enough for Alec. He prefers his monsters really, really extinct.' Will that make you happy?
1804.author: Cassandra Clare,

1805.quote: So please, oh please, we beg, we pray, go throw your TV set away, and in its place you can install, a lovely bookshelf on the wall.
1805.author: Roald Dahl

1806.quote: What's the good of living if you don't try a few things?
1806.author: Charles M. Schulz

1807.quote: Where there is love, there is often also hate. They can exist side by side.
1807.author: Cassandra Clare,

1808.quote: I say let the world go to hell, but I should always have my tea.
1808.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky,

1809.quote: Go on with what your heart tells you, or you will lose all.
1809.author: Rick Riordan,

1810.quote: A lot of you cared, just not enough.
1810.author: Jay Asher,

1811.quote: It's all in the view. That's what I mean about forever, too. For any one of us our forever could end in an hour, or a hundred years from now. You never know for sure, so you'd better make every second count.
1811.author: Sarah Dessen,

1812.quote: Change will not come if we wait for some other person, or if we wait for some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.
1812.author: Barack Obama

1813.quote: Owners of dogs will have noticed that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they will think you are god. Whereas owners of cats are compelled to realize that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they draw the conclusion that they are gods.
1813.author: Christopher Hitchens,

1814.quote: We need, in love, to practice only this: letting each other go. For holding on comes easily; we do not need to learn it.
1814.author: Rainer Maria Rilke,

1815.quote: I don't know that love changes. People change. Circumstances change.
1815.author: Nicholas Sparks

1816.quote: Learn to value yourself, which means: fight for your happiness.
1816.author: Ayn Rand

1817.quote: Lolita, light of my life, fire of my loins. My sin, my soul. Lo-lee-ta: the tip of the tongue taking a trip of three steps down the palate to tap, at three, on the teeth. Lo. Lee. Ta. She was Lo, plain Lo, in the morning, standing four feet ten in one sock. She was Lola in slacks. She was Dolly at school. She was Dolores on the dotted line. But in my arms she was always Lolita. Did she have a precursor? She did, indeed she did. In point of fact, there might have been no Lolita at all had I not loved, one summer, an initial girl-child. In a princedom by the sea. Oh when? About as many years before Lolita was born as my age was that summer. You can always count on a murderer for a fancy prose style. Ladies and gentlemen of the jury, exhibit number one is what the seraphs, the misinformed, simple, noble-winged seraphs, envied. Look at this tangle of thorns.
1817.author: Vladimir Nabokov,

1818.quote: Trust is like a mirror, you can fix it if it's broken, but you can still see the crack in that mother fucker's reflection.
1818.author: Lady Gaga

1819.quote: When you find your path, you must not be afraid. You need to have sufficient courage to make mistakes. Disappointment, defeat, and despair are the tools God uses to show us the way.
1819.author: Paulo Coelho,

1820.quote: Dreams do come true, if only we wish hard enough. You can have anything in life if you will sacrifice everything else for it.
1820.author: J.M. Barrie,

1821.quote: When I get lonely these days, I think: So BE lonely, Liz. Learn your way around loneliness. Make a map of it. Sit with it, for once in your life. Welcome to the human experience. But never again use another person's body or emotions as a scratching post for your own unfulfilled yearnings.
1821.author: Elizabeth Gilbert,

1822.quote: The glory of friendship is not the outstretched hand, not the kindly smile, nor the joy of companionship; it is the spiritual inspiration that comes to one when you discover that someone else believes in you and is willing to trust you with a friendship.
1822.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

1823.quote: Tact is the ability to tell someone to go to hell in such a way that they look forward to the trip.
1823.author: Winston Churchill

1824.quote: All alone! Whether you like it or not, alone is something you'll be quite a lot!
1824.author: Dr. Seuss,

1825.quote: I must learn to be content with being happier than I deserve.
1825.author: Jane Austen,

1826.quote: Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die.
1826.author: Herbert Hoover

1827.quote: A snowball in the face is surely the perfect beginning to a lasting friendship.
1827.author: Markus Zusak,

1828.quote: If you end up with a boring miserable life because you listened to your mom, your dad, your teacher, your priest, or some guy on television telling you how to do your shit, then you deserve it.
1828.author: Frank Zappa

1829.quote: If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to.
1829.author: Dorothy Parker

1830.quote: And thus the heart will break, yet brokenly live on.
1830.author: George Gordon Byron

1831.quote: In individuals, insanity is rare; but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule.
1831.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

1832.quote: Beautiful face. Beautiful body. Horrible attitude. It was the holy trinity of hot boys.
1832.author: Jennifer L. Armentrout,

1833.quote: Just because you're paranoid doesn't mean they aren't after you.
1833.author: Joseph Heller,

1834.quote:
Dreams like a podcast,
Downloading truth in my ears.
They tell me cool stuff."
"Apollo?" I guess, because I figured nobody else could make a haiku that bad.
He put his finger to his lips. "I'm incognito. Call me Fred."
"A god named Fred?
1834.author: Rick Riordan

1835.quote: Lost opportunities, lost possibilities, feelings we can never get back. That's part of what it means to be alive. But inside our heads - at least that's where I imagine it - there's a little room where we store those memories. A room like the stacks in this library. And to understand the workings of our own heart we have to keep on making new reference cards. We have to dust things off every once in awhile, let in fresh air, change the water in the flower vases. In other words, you'll live forever in your own private library.
1835.author: Haruki Murakami,

1836.quote: Politeness is deception in pretty packaging.
1836.author: Veronica Roth,

1837.quote: Expose yourself to your deepest fear; after that, fear has no power, and the fear of freedom shrinks and vanishes. You are free.
1837.author: Jim Morrison

1838.quote: That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence.
1838.author: Christopher Hitchens

1839.quote: Without suffering, there'd be no compassion.
1839.author: Nicholas Sparks,

1840.quote: Atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning...
1840.author: C.S. Lewis

1841.quote: The world is indeed comic, but the joke is on mankind.
1841.author: H. P. Lovecraft

1842.quote: Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
1842.author: Mark Twain

1843.quote: Worry never robs tomorrow of its sorrow, but only saps today of its strength.
1843.author: A.J. Cronin

1844.quote: God can't give us peace and happiness apart from Himself because there is no such thing.
1844.author: C.S. Lewis

1845.quote: Don't spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door.
1845.author: Coco Chanel

1846.quote: There is more to sex appeal than just measurements. I don't need a bedroom to prove my womanliness. I can convey just as much sex appeal, picking apples off a tree or standing in the rain.
1846.author: Audrey Hepburn

1847.quote: That's why when major badasses greet each other in movies, they don't say anything, they just nod. The nod means, 'I' am a badass, and I recognize that you, too, are a badass,' but they don't say anything because they're Wolverine and Magneto and it would mess up their vibe to explain.
1847.author: Cassandra Clare,

1848.quote: The saddest people I've ever met in life are the ones who don't care deeply about anything at all. Passion and satisfaction go hand in hand, and without them, any happiness is only temporary, because there's nothing to make it last.
1848.author: Nicholas Sparks,

1849.quote: If people refuse to look at you in a new light and they can only see you for what you were, only see you for the mistakes you've made, if they don't realize that you are not your mistakes, then they have to go.
1849.author: Steve Maraboli,

1850.quote:
You can't stop the future
You can't rewind the past
The only way to learn the secret
...is to press play.
1850.author: Jay Asher,

1851.quote: Fill your paper with the breathings of your heart.
1851.author: William Wordsworth

1852.quote: When I was a child, adults would tell me not to make things up, warning me of what would happen if I did. As far as I can tell so far, it seems to involve lots of foreign travel and not having to get up too early in the morning.
1852.author: Neil Gaiman,

1853.quote: If conversation was the lyrics, laughter was the music, making time spent together a melody that could be replayed over and over without getting stale.
1853.author: Nicholas Sparks

1854.quote: I want to grow old without facelifts. I want to have the courage to be loyal to the face I have made.
1854.author: Marilyn Monroe

1855.quote: Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.
1855.author: Steve Maraboli

1856.quote: Let our scars fall in love.
1856.author: Galway Kinnell

1857.quote: Families are messy. Immortal families are eternally messy. Sometimes the best we can do is to remind each other that we're related for better or for worse...and try to keep the maiming and killing to a minimum.
1857.author: Rick Riordan,

1858.quote: Time doesn't heal emotional pain, you need to learn how to let go.
1858.author: Roy T. Bennett,

1859.quote:
- "Why don't you like to be touched?" 
- "Because I'm fifty shades of fucked-up, Anastasia
1859.author: E.L. James,

1860.quote: If there's a single lesson that life teaches us, it's that wishing doesn't make it so.
1860.author: Lev Grossman,

1861.quote: The truth is what I make it. I could set this world on fire and call it rain.
1861.author: Victoria Aveyard,

1862.quote: We've got to live, no matter how many skies have fallen.
1862.author: D.H. Lawrence,

1863.quote: It wouldn't be my move," Jace agreed. "First the candy and flowers, then the apology letters, then the ravenous demon hordes. In that order.
1863.author: Cassandra Clare,

1864.quote: How nice -- to feel nothing, and still get full credit for being alive.
1864.author: Kurt Vonnegut,

1865.quote: I know I am but summer to your heart, and not the full four seasons of the year.
1865.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

1866.quote: It is a good rule after reading a new book, never to allow yourself another new one till you have read an old one in between.
1866.author: C.S. Lewis

1867.quote: A word after a word after a word is power.
1867.author: Margaret Atwood

1868.quote: Here is a lesson in creative writing. First rule: Do not use semicolons. They are transvestite hermaphrodites representing absolutely nothing. All they do is show you've been to college.
1868.author: Kurt Vonnegut,

1869.quote: Don't try to make life a mathematics problem with yourself in the center and everything coming out equal. When you're good, bad things can still happen. And if you're bad, you can still be lucky.
1869.author: Barbara Kingsolver,

1870.quote: If you would tell me the heart of a man, tell me not what he reads, but what he rereads.
1870.author: Francois Mauriac

1871.quote: I fell in love with him. But I don't just stay with him by default as if there's no one else available to me. I stay with him because I choose to, every day that I wake up, every day that we fight or lie to each other or disappoint each other. I choose him over and over again, and he chooses me.
1871.author: Veronica Roth,

1872.quote: We take for granted the very things that most deserve our gratitude.
1872.author: Cynthia Ozick

1873.quote: Honestly, if you were any slower, you'd be going backward.
1873.author: J.K. Rowling,

1874.quote: Is there no way out of the mind?
1874.author: Sylvia Plath

1875.quote: You shall know the truth and the truth shall make you mad.
1875.author: Aldous Huxley

1876.quote: Books are not made to be believed, but to be subjected to inquiry. When we consider a book, we mustn't ask ourselves what it says but what it means...
1876.author: Umberto Eco,

1877.quote: It was a mistake," you said. But the cruel thing was, it felt like the mistake was mine, for trusting you.
1877.author: David Levithan,

1878.quote: Nobody tells this to people who are beginners, I wish someone told me. All of us who do creative work, we get into it because we have good taste. But there is this gap. For the first couple years you make stuff, it's just not that good. It's trying to be good, it has potential, but it's not. But your taste, the thing that got you into the game, is still killer. And your taste is why your work disappoints you. A lot of people never get past this phase, they quit. Most people I know who do interesting, creative work went through years of this. We know our work doesn't have this special thing that we want it to have. We all go through this. And if you are just starting out or you are still in this phase, you gotta know its normal and the most important thing you can do is do a lot of work. Put yourself on a deadline so that every week you will finish one story. It is only by going through a volume of work that you will close that gap, and your work will be as good as your ambitions. And I took longer to figure out how to do this than anyone I've ever met. It's gonna take awhile. It's normal to take awhile. You've just gotta fight your way through.
1878.author: Ira Glass

1879.quote: Illegal aliens have always been a problem in the United States. Ask any Indian.
1879.author: Robert Orben

1880.quote: The trouble is not in dying for a friend, but in finding a friend worth dying for.
1880.author: Mark Twain

1881.quote:
If you know someone who's depressed, please resolve never to ask them why. Depression isn't a straightforward response to a bad situation; depression just is, like the weather.

Try to understand the blackness, lethargy, hopelessness, and loneliness they're going through. Be there for them when they come through the other side. It's hard to be a friend to someone who's depressed, but it is one of the kindest, noblest, and best things you will ever do.
1881.author: Stephen Fry

1882.quote: All parents damage their children. It cannot be helped. Youth, like pristine glass, absorbs the prints of its handlers. Some parents smudge, others crack, a few shatter childhoods completely into jagged little pieces, beyond repair.
1882.author: Mitch Albom,

1883.quote: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.
1883.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

1884.quote:
This is the way the world ends
Not with a bang but a whimper.
1884.author: T.S. Eliot

1885.quote: Talk sense to a fool and he calls you foolish.
1885.author: Euripides,

1887.quote:
Are you implying that shreds of my reputation remain intact?" Will demanded with mock horror. "Clearly I have been doing something wrong. Or not something wrong, as the case may be." 

He banged on the side of the carriage. "Thomas! We must away at once to the nearest brothel. I seek scandal and low companionship.
1887.author: Cassandra Clare,

1888.quote: They say time heals all wounds, but that presumes the source of the grief is finite
1888.author: Cassandra Clare,

1889.quote: Happiness is holding someone in your arms and knowing you hold the whole world.
1889.author: Orhan Pamuk,

1890.quote: I drink to make other people more interesting.
1890.author: Hemingway, Ernest

1891.quote: Open your heart. Someone will come. Someone will come for you. But first you must open your heart.
1891.author: Kate DiCamillo,

1892.quote: Scared is what you're feeling. Brave is what you're doing.
1892.author: Emma Donoghue,

1893.quote:
The helpful thought for which you look
Is written somewhere in a book.
1893.author: Edward Gorey

1894.quote: If you think you are too small to make a difference, try sleeping with a mosquito.
1894.author: Dalai Lama XIV

1895.quote:
Do not be afraid; our fate
Cannot be taken from us; it is a gift.
1895.author: Dante Alighieri,

1896.quote: A house without books is like a room without windows.
1896.author: Horace Mann

1897.quote: So many things become beautiful when you really look.
1897.author: Lauren Oliver,

1898.quote: Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world.
1898.author: Desmond Tutu

1899.quote: Don't compromise yourself - you're all you have.
1899.author: John Grisham,

1900.quote: Wheresoever you go, go with all your heart.
1900.author: Confucius

1901.quote: If A is a success in life, then A equals x plus y plus z. Work is x; y is play; and z is keeping your mouth shut
1901.author: Albert Einstein

1902.quote: I may not have been sure about what really did interest me, but I was absolutely sure about what didn't.
1902.author: Albert Camus,

1903.quote: From there to here, from here to there, funny things are everywhere!
1903.author: Dr. Seuss,

1904.quote: Our mothers always remain the strangest, craziest people we've ever met.
1904.author: Marguerite Duras

1905.quote:
As it has been said:
Love and a cough
cannot be concealed.
Even a small cough.
Even a small love.
1905.author: Anne Sexton

1906.quote: One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries.
1906.author: A.A. Milne

1907.quote: Nothing in the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and conscientious stupidity.
1907.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

1908.quote: I felt like crying but nothing came out. it was just a sort of sad sickness, sick sad, when you can't feel any worse. I think you know it. I think everybody knows it now and then. but I think I have known it pretty often, too often.
1908.author: Charles Bukowski,

1909.quote: Because you can't argue with all the fools in the world. It's easier to let them have their way, then trick them when they're not paying attention.
1909.author: Christopher Paolini

1910.quote: We're staying together," he promised. "You're not getting away from me. Never again.
1910.author: Rick Riordan,

1911.quote: A man who procrastinates in his choosing will inevitably have his choice made for him by circumstance.
1911.author: Hunter S. Thompson,

1912.quote:
Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on Thee
And I'll forgive Thy great big one on me.
1912.author: Robert Frost

1913.quote:
By the pricking of my thumbs, 
Something wicked this way comes.
1913.author: William Shakespeare,

1914.quote: You are not your job, you're not how much money you have in the bank. You are not the car you drive. You're not the contents of your wallet. You are not your fucking khakis. You are all singing, all dancing crap of the world.
1914.author: Chuck Palahniuk,

1915.quote:
I thought I'd lie on the floor and writhe in pain for a while," he grunted, "It relaxes me."
"It does? Oh - you're being sarcastic. That's a good sign probably.
1915.author: Cassandra Clare,

1916.quote: She refused to be bored chiefly because she wasn't boring.
1916.author: Zelda Fitzgerald,

1917.quote: Even in the Future the Story Begins with Once Upon a Time.
1917.author: Marissa Meyer,

1918.quote: What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do.
1918.author: Alan Bennett,

1919.quote: Most of all, I hate you because I think of you. Often. It's disgusting, and I can't stop.
1919.author: Holly Black,

1920.quote: the free soul is rare, but you know it when you see it - basically because you feel good, very good, when you are near or with them.
1920.author: Charles Bukowski,

1921.quote: Time is the longest distance between two places.
1921.author: Tennessee Williams,

1922.quote: The mind once enlightened cannot again become dark.
1922.author: Thomas Paine,

1923.quote: No one can construct for you the bridge upon which precisely you must cross the stream of life, no one but you yourself alone.
1923.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

1924.quote: I'm on Aslan's side even if there isn't any Aslan to lead it. I'm going to live as like a Narnian as I can even if there isn't any Narnia.
1924.author: C.S. Lewis,

1925.quote: Of all the words of mice and men, the saddest are, "It might have been.
1925.author: Kurt Vonnegut

1926.quote: Did you ever think that in a past life Alec was an old woman with ninety cats who was always yelling at the neighborhood kids to get off her lawn? Because I do,
1926.author: Cassandra Clare,

1927.quote: No one has ever become poor by giving.
1927.author: Anne Frank,

1928.quote: Ever has it been that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.
1928.author: Kahlil Gibran

1929.quote: The thing that is really hard, and really amazing, is giving up on being perfect and beginning the work of becoming yourself.
1929.author: Anna Quindlen

1930.quote: When people talk, listen completely. Most people never listen.
1930.author: Ernest Hemingway

1931.quote: Knowing too much of your future is never a good thing.
1931.author: Rick Riordan,

1932.quote: The nitrogen in our DNA, the calcium in our teeth, the iron in our blood, the carbon in our apple pies were made in the interiors of collapsing stars. We are made of starstuff.
1932.author: Carl Sagan,

1933.quote: It is a curious thing, Harry, but perhaps those who are best suited to power are those who have never sought it. Those who, like you, have leadership thrust upon them, and take up the mantle because they must, and find to their own surprise that they wear it well.
1933.author: J.K. Rowling,

1934.quote: You see I usually find myself among strangers because I drift here and there trying to forget the sad things that happened to me.
1934.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,

1935.quote: And I guess I realized at that moment that I really did love her. Because there was nothing to gain, and that didn't matter.
1935.author: Stephen Chbosky,

1936.quote: My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right.
1936.author: Abraham Lincoln

1937.quote: Whenever you read a cancer booklet or website or whatever, they always list depression among the side effects of cancer. But, in fact, depression is not a side effect of cancer. Depression is a side effect of dying.
1937.author: John Green,

1938.quote: I like to see people reunited, I like to see people run to each other, I like the kissing and the crying, I like the impatience, the stories that the mouth can't tell fast enough, the ears that aren't big enough, the eyes that can't take in all of the change, I like the hugging, the bringing together, the end of missing someone.
1938.author: Jonathan Safran Foer,

1939.quote: Courage is found in unlikely places.
1939.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

1940.quote: Never make someone a priority when all you are to them is an option.
1940.author: Maya Angelou

1941.quote: The pleasure of remembering had been taken from me, because there was no longer anyone to remember with. It felt like losing your co-rememberer meant losing the memory itself, as if the things we'd done were less real and important than they had been hours before.
1941.author: John Green,

1942.quote: The more you know who you are, and what you want, the less you let things upset you.
1942.author: Stephanie Perkins,

1943.quote: But in a solitary life, there are rare moments when another soul dips near yours, as stars once a year brush the earth. Such a constellation was he to me.
1943.author: Madeline Miller,

1944.quote: There is something delicious about writing the first words of a story. You never quite know where they'll take you.
1944.author: Beatrix Potter

1945.quote: Love can change a person the way a parent can change a baby- awkwardly, and often with a great deal of mess.
1945.author: Lemony Snicket,

1947.quote: Crying is for plain women. Pretty women go shopping.
1947.author: Oscar Wilde

1949.quote: I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best.
1949.author: Oscar Wilde

1950.quote: Try a little harder to be a little better.
1950.author: Gordon B. Hinckley

1951.quote: You may encounter many defeats, but you must not be defeated. In fact, it may be necessary to encounter the defeats, so you can know who you are, what you can rise from, how you can still come out of it.
1951.author: Maya Angelou

1952.quote: Reputation is what other people know about you. Honor is what you know about yourself.
1952.author: Lois McMaster Bujold,

1953.quote: That's what careless words do. They make people love you a little less.
1953.author: Arundhati Roy,

1954.quote: If I loved you less, I might be able to talk about it more.
1954.author: Jane Austen,

1955.quote: Let me give you a piece of advice. The handsome young fellow who's trying to rescue you from a hideous fate is never wrong. Not even if he says the sky is purple and made of hedgehogs.
1955.author: Cassandra Clare,

1956.quote: Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn't before! What if Christmas, he thought, doesn't come from a store. What if Christmas...perhaps...means a little bit more!
1956.author: Dr. Seuss,

1957.quote: When we least expect it, life sets us a challenge to test our courage and willingness to change; at such a moment, there is no point in pretending that nothing has happened or in saying that we are not yet ready. The challenge will not wait. Life does not look back. A week is more than enough time for us to decide whether or not to accept our destiny.
1957.author: Paulo Coelho,

1958.quote: My name is Celaena Sardothien. But it makes no difference if my name's Celaena or Lillian or Bitch, because I'd still beat you, no matter what you call me.
1958.author: Sarah J. Maas,

1959.quote: There is only one page left to write on. I will fill it with words of only one syllable. I love. I have loved. I will love.
1959.author: Dodie Smith,

1960.quote:
You could have fooled me. Everytime I called you, Luke said you were sick. I figured you were avoiding me. Again."
"I wasn't. I did want to talk to you. I've been thinking about you all the time."
"I've been thinking about you, too."
"I really was sick. I swear. I almost died back there on the ship, you know."
"I know. Everytime you almost die, I almost die myself.
1960.author: Cassandra Clare,

1961.quote:
It's not gray," Clary felt compelled to point out. "It's green."
"If there was such a thing as terminal literalism, you'd have died in childhood," said Jace.
1961.author: Cassandra Clare,

1962.quote: She had always wanted words, she loved them; grew up on them. Words gave her clarity, brought reason, shape.
1962.author: Michael Ondaatje,

1963.quote: To shine your brightest light is to be who you truly are.
1963.author: Roy T. Bennett

1964.quote: The beginning of love is the will to let those we love be perfectly themselves, the resolution not to twist them to fit our own image.
1964.author: Thomas Merton,

1965.quote: May the odds be ever in your favor!
1965.author: Suzanne Collins,

1966.quote: I want you always to remember me. Will you remember that I existed, and that I stood next to you here like this?
1966.author: Haruki Murakami,

1967.quote: The pleasure of all reading is doubled when one lives with another who shares the same books.
1967.author: Katherine Mansfield

1968.quote:
those who escape hell
however
never talk about
it
and nothing much
bothers them
after
that.
1968.author: Charles Bukowski

1969.quote:
I don't want tea," said Clary, with muffled force. "I want to find my mother. And then I want to find out who took her in the first place, and I want to kill them."
"Unfortunately," said Hodge, "we're all out of bitter revenge at the moment, so it's either tea or nothing.
1969.author: Cassandra Clare,

1970.quote: When did we see each other face-to-face? Not until you saw into my cracks and I saw into yours. Before that, we were just looking at ideas of each other, like looking at your window shade but never seeing inside. But once the vessel cracks, the light can get in. The light can get out.
1970.author: John Green,

1971.quote: Sometimes, when I have to do something I don't want to do, I pretend I'm a character from a book. It's easier to know what they would do.
1971.author: Cassandra Clare,

1972.quote: Strange as it may seem, I still hope for the best, even though the best, like an interesting piece of mail, so rarely arrives, and even when it does it can be lost so easily.
1972.author: Lemony Snicket,

1973.quote: I always channel my emotions into my work. That way, I don't hurt anyone but myself.
1973.author: Suzanne Collins,

1974.quote: I wrote the story myself. It's about a girl who lost her reputation and never missed it.
1974.author: Mae West

1975.quote:
Once upon a time, an angel and a devil fell in love. 

It did not end well.
1975.author: Laini Taylor,

1976.quote: I'm a success today because I had a friend who believed in me and I didn't have the heart to let him down.
1976.author: Abraham Lincoln

1978.quote: Don't let the bastards grind you down.
1978.author: Margaret Atwood,

1979.quote:
You're just worried they'll hire a male instructor and he'll be hotter than you." 
Jace's eyebrows went up. "Hotter than me?" 
"It could happen," Clary said, "You know, theoretically."
"Theoretically the planet could suddenly crack in half, leaving me on one side and you on the other, forever and tragically parted, but I'm not worried about that either. Some things," Jace said, with his customary crooked smile, "are just too unlikely to dwell upon.
1979.author: Cassandra Clare,

1980.quote: Did you know that 'I told you so' has a brother,Jacob?" she asked cutting me off. "His name is 'Shut the hell up'.
1980.author: Stephenie Meyer,

1981.quote: We are addicted to our thoughts. We cannot change anything if we cannot change our thinking.
1981.author: Santosh Kalwar,

1982.quote: If you look the right way, you can see that the whole world is a garden.
1982.author: Frances Hodgson Burnett,

1983.quote: Hope can be a powerful force. Maybe there's no actual magic in it, but when you know what you hope for most and hold it like a light within you, you can make things happen, almost like magic.
1983.author: Laini Taylor,

1984.quote: Sometimes you have to lose all you have to find out who you truly are.
1984.author: Roy T. Bennett,

1985.quote:
Peeta, how come I never know when you're having a nightmare? I say.

I don't know. I don't think I cry out or thrash around or anything. I just come to, paralyzed with terror, he says.

You should wake me, I say, thinking about how I can interrupt his sleep two or three times on a bad night. About how long it can take to calm me down.

It's not necessary. My nightmares are usually about losing you, he says. I'm okay once I realize you're here.
1985.author: Suzanne Collins,

1986.quote: What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?
1986.author: George Eliot

1987.quote: In time, the hurt began to fade and it was easier to just let it go. At least I thought it was. But in every boy I met in the next few years, I found myself looking for you, and when the feelings got too strong, I'd write you another letter. But I never sent them for fear of what I might find. By then, you'd gone on with your life and I didn't want to think about you loving someone else. I wanted to remember us like we were that summer. I didn't ever want to lose that.
1987.author: Nicholas Sparks,

1988.quote: When you play a game of thrones you win or you die.
1988.author: George R.R. Martin,

1989.quote: Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment.
1989.author: Rumi,

1990.quote: The heart has its reasons which reason knows not.
1990.author: Blaise Pascal

1991.quote: Where you used to be, there is a hole in the world, which I find myself constantly walking around in the daytime, and falling in at night. I miss you like hell.
1991.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

1993.quote:
Really, the combination of the scabs and the ointment looks hideous. I can't help enjoying his distress.
"Poor Finnick. Is this the first time in your life you haven't looked pretty?" I say.
"It must be. The sensation's completely new. How have you managed it all these years?" he asks.
"Just avoid mirrors. You'll forget about it," I say.
"Not if I keep looking at you," he says.
1993.author: Suzanne Collins,

1994.quote: Animals are my friends...and I don't eat my friends.
1994.author: George Bernard Shaw

1995.quote: I haven't been everywhere, but it's on my list.
1995.author: Susan Sontag

1996.quote: A wonderful fact to reflect upon, that every human creature is constituted to be that profound secret and mystery to every other.
1996.author: Charles Dickens,

1997.quote: If you work really hard, and you're kind, amazing things will happen.
1997.author: Conan O'Brien

1998.quote: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
1998.author: Pablo Picasso

1999.quote: Ah, music," he said, wiping his eyes. "A magic beyond all we do here!
1999.author: J.K. Rowling,

2000.quote: True love is usually the most inconvenient kind.
2000.author: Kiera Cass,

2001.quote:
You're an idiot."
"I've never claimed to be otherwise.
2001.author: Cassandra Clare,

2002.quote: Therefore, dear Sir, love your solitude and try to sing out with the pain it causes you. For those who are near you are far away... and this shows that the space around you is beginning to grow vast.... be happy about your growth, in which of course you can't take anyone with you, and be gentle with those who stay behind; be confident and calm in front of them and don't torment them with your doubts and don't frighten them with your faith or joy, which they wouldn't be able to comprehend. Seek out some simple and true feeling of what you have in common with them, which doesn't necessarily have to alter when you yourself change again and again; when you see them, love life in a form that is not your own and be indulgent toward those who are growing old, who are afraid of the aloneness that you trust.... and don't expect any understanding; but believe in a love that is being stored up for you like an inheritance, and have faith that in this love there is a strength and a blessing so large that you can travel as far as you wish without having to step outside it.
2002.author: Rainer Maria Rilke,

2003.quote: Tears are words that need to be written.
2003.author: Paulo Coelho

2004.quote: Faith is not the belief that God will do what you want. It is the belief that God will do what is right.
2004.author: Max Lucado,

2005.quote: I don't think of all the misery, but of the beauty that still remains.
2005.author: Anne Frank,

2006.quote: There is no place like home.
2006.author: L. Frank Baum,

2007.quote: You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is like an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty.
2007.author: Mahatma Gandhi

2008.quote: The important thing to you is not how many years in your life, but how much life in your years!
2008.author: Edward J. Stieglitz

2009.quote: Sometimes you read a book so special that you want to carry it around with you for months after you've finished just to stay near it.
2009.author: Markus Zusak

2010.quote: Every time you are tempted to react in the same old way, ask if you want to be a prisoner of the past or a pioneer of the future.
2010.author: Deepak Chopra

2011.quote: Ask not what you can do for your country. Ask what's for lunch.
2011.author: Orson Welles

2012.quote:
What day is it? asked Pooh. 
It's today, squeaked Piglet.
My favorite day, said Pooh.
2012.author: A.A. Milne

2013.quote: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.
2013.author: Elie Wiesel

2014.quote: Whatever you're meant to do, do it now. The conditions are always impossible.
2014.author: Doris Lessing

2015.quote: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everyone will respect you.
2015.author: Lao Tzu,

2016.quote: Give her hell from us, Peeves.
2016.author: J.K. Rowling,

2017.quote: Remain true to yourself, child. If you know your own heart, you will always have one friend who does not lie.
2017.author: Marion Zimmer Bradley,

2018.quote: I love books, by the way, way more than movies. Movies tell you what to think. A good book lets you choose a few thoughts for yourself. Movies show you the pink house. A good book tells you there's a pink house and lets you paint some of the finishing touches, maybe choose the roof style,park your own car out front. My imagination has always topped anything a movie could come up with. Case in point, those darned Harry Potter movies. That was so not what that part-Veela-chick, Fleur Delacour, looked like.
2018.author: Karen Marie Moning,

2019.quote:
In order to rise
From its own ashes
A phoenix
First
Must
Burn.
2019.author: Octavia Butler,

2020.quote: If you love what you do and are willing to do what it takes, it's within your reach. And it'll be worth every minute you spend alone at night, thinking and thinking about what it is you want to design or build. It'll be worth it, I promise.
2020.author: Steve Wozniak

2021.quote: I meant what I said and I said what I meant. An elephant's faithful one-hundred percent!
2021.author: Dr. Seuss,

2022.quote: Be thankful for everything that happens in your life; it's all an experience.
2022.author: Roy T. Bennett

2023.quote: Tomorrow may be hell, but today was a good writing day, and on the good writing days nothing else matters.
2023.author: Neil Gaiman

2024.quote: It is good to have an end to journey toward; but it is the journey that matters, in the end.
2024.author: Ursula K. Le Guin,

2025.quote:
Time was passing like a hand waving from a train I wanted to be on. 
I hope you never have to think about anything as much as I think about you.
2025.author: jonathan safran foer

2026.quote: Fear is a phoenix. You can watch it burn a thousand times and still it will return.
2026.author: Leigh Bardugo,

2027.quote:
I'm a business man," he'd told her. "No more, no less."
"You're a thief, Kaz."
"Isn't that what I just said?
2027.author: Leigh Bardugo,

2028.quote: I myself have never been able to find out precisely what feminism is: I only know that people call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat.
2028.author: Rebecca West

2029.quote: The reason it hurts so much to separate is because our souls are connected. Maybe they always have been and will be. Maybe we've lived a thousand lives before this one and in each of them we've found each other. And maybe each time, we've been forced apart for the same reasons. That means that this goodbye is both a goodbye for the past ten thousand years and a prelude to what will come.
2029.author: Nicholas Sparks,

2030.quote: Sometimes beautiful things come into our lives out of nowhere. We can't always understand them, but we have to trust in them. I know you want to question everything, but sometimes it pays to just have a little faith.
2030.author: Lauren Kate,

2031.quote: There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.
2031.author: Socrates

2032.quote: Remember, darkness does not always equate to evil, just as light does not always bring good.
2032.author: P.C. Cast,

2033.quote:
You'd think people had better things to gossip about," said Ginny as she sat on the common room floor, leaning against Harry's legs and reading the Daily Prophet. "Three Dementor attacks in a week, and all Romilda Vane does is ask me if it's true you've got a Hippogriff tattooed across your chest."
Ron and Hermione both roared with laughter. Harry ignored them.
What did you tell her?"
I told her it's a Hungarian Horntail," said Ginny, turning a page of the newspaper idly. "Much more macho."
Thanks," said Harry, grinning. "And what did you tell her Ron's got?"
A Pygmy Puff, but I didn't say where.
2033.author: J.K. Rowling,

2034.quote: Maybe some people just aren't meant to be in our lives forever. Maybe some people are just passing through. It's like some people just come through our lives to bring us something: a gift, a blessing, a lesson we need to learn. And that's why they're here. You'll have that gift forever.
2034.author: Danielle Steel,

2035.quote: I can only note that the past is beautiful because one never realises an emotion at the time. It expands later, and thus we don't have complete emotions about the present, only about the past.
2035.author: Virginia Woolf

2036.quote:
I'm going to wake Peeta," I say.
"No, wait," says Finnick. "Let's do it together. Put our faces right in front of his."
Well, there's so little opportunity for fun left in my life, I agree. We position ourselves on either side of Peeta, lean over until our faces are inches frim his nose, and give him a shake. "Peeta. Peeta, wake up," I say in a soft, singsong voice.
His eyelids flutter open and then he jumps like we've stabbed him. "Aa!"
Finnick and I fall back in the sand, laughing our heads off. Every time we try to stop, we look at Peeta's attempt to maintain a disdainful expression and it sets us off again.
2036.author: Suzanne Collins,

2037.quote: I'm sick of just liking people. I wish to God I could meet somebody I could respect.
2037.author: J.D. Salinger,

2038.quote: We were like gods at the dawning of the world, & our joy was so bright we could see nothing else but the other.
2038.author: Madeline Miller,

2039.quote: The longer and more carefully we look at a funny story, the sadder it becomes.
2039.author: Nikolai V. Gogol

2040.quote: Memories, even your most precious ones, fade surprisingly quickly. But I don't go along with that. The memories I value most, I don't ever see them fading.
2040.author: Kazuo Ishiguro,

2041.quote: Time is the coin of your life. You spend it. Do not allow others to spend it for you.
2041.author: Carl Sandburg

2042.quote: And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, 'If this isn't nice, I don't know what is.
2042.author: Kurt Vonnegut Jr.,

2043.quote:
so I wait for you like a lonely house
till you will see me again and live in me.
Till then my windows ache.
2043.author: Pablo Neruda,

2044.quote: A diary with no drawings of me in it? Where are the torrid fantasies? The romance covers?
2044.author: Cassandra Clare,

2045.quote: It's not worth doing something unless someone, somewhere, would much rather you weren't doing it.
2045.author: Terry Pratchett

2046.quote: I am always saying "Glad to've met you" to somebody I'm not at all glad I met. If you want to stay alive, you have to say that stuff, though.
2046.author: J.D. Salinger,

2047.quote:
There are so many ways to be brave in this world. Sometimes bravery involves laying down your life for something bigger than yourself, or for someone else. Sometimes it involves giving up everything you have ever known, or everyone you have ever loved, for the sake of something greater.

But sometimes it doesn't.

Sometimes it is nothing more than gritting your teeth through pain, and the work of every day, the slow walk toward a better life. 

That is the sort of bravery I must have now.
2047.author: Veronica Roth,

2048.quote: He needed to tell her...what? That she was lovely and brave and better than anything he deserved. That he was twisted, crooked, wrong, but not so broken that he couldn't pull himself together into some semblance of a man for her. That without meaning to, he'd begun to lean on her, to look for her, to need her near. He needed to thank her for his new hat.
2048.author: Leigh Bardugo,

2049.quote: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.
2049.author: Marcel Proust

2050.quote: You are all the colors in one, at full brightness.
2050.author: Jennifer Niven,

2051.quote:
He accused me of being Dumbledore's man through and through."
"How very rude of him."
"I told him I was."
Dumbledore opened his mouth to speak and then closed it again. Fawkes the phoenix let out a low, soft, musical cry. To Harry's intense embarrassment, he suddenly realized that Dumbledore's bright blue eyes looked rather watery, and stared hastily at his own knee. When Dumbledore spoke, however, his voice was quite steady. 
"I am very touched, Harry.
2051.author: J.K. Rowling,

2052.quote: From childhood's hour I have not been. As others were, I have not seen. As others saw, I could not awaken. My heart to joy at the same tone. And all I loved, I loved alone.
2052.author: Edgar Allan Poe

2053.quote: There are only the pursued, the pursuing, the busy and the tired.
2053.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,

2054.quote: Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and to have her nonsense respected.
2054.author: Charles Lamb,

2055.quote: You can only become truly accomplished at something you love. Don't make money your goal. Instead pursue the things you love doing and then do them so well that people can't take their eyes off of you.
2055.author: Maya Angelou

2056.quote: It is easy to love people in memory; the hard thing is to love them when they are there in front of you.
2056.author: John Updike,

2057.quote: He was gone, and I did not have time to tell him what I had just now realized: that I forgave him, and that she forgave us, and that we had to forgive to survive in the labyrinth. There were so many of us who would have to live with things done and things left undone that day. Things that did not go right, things that seemed okay at the time because we could not see the future. If only we could see the endless string of consequences that result from our smallest actions. But we can't know better until knowing better is useless. And as I walked back to give Takumi's note to the Colonel, I saw that I would never know. I would never know her well enough to know her thoughts in those last minutes, would never know if she left us on purpose. But the not-knowing would not keep me from caring, and I would always love Alaska Young, my crooked neighbor, with all my crooked heart.
2057.author: John Green,

2058.quote: You are not entitled to your opinion. You are entitled to your informed opinion. No one is entitled to be ignorant.
2058.author: Harlan Ellison

2059.quote:
Words, I think, are such unpredictable creatures.
 No gun, no sword, no army or king will ever be more powerful than a sentence. Swords may cut and kill, but words will stab and stay, burying themselves in our bones to become corpses we carry into the future, all the time digging and failing to rip their skeletons from our flesh.
2059.author: Tahereh Mafi,

2060.quote: You know how they say you only hurt the ones you love? Well, it works both ways.
2060.author: Chuck Palahniuk,

2061.quote: Adults are just obsolete children and the hell with them.
2061.author: Dr. Seuss

2062.quote: Happiness consists in getting enough sleep. Just that, nothing more.
2062.author: Robert A. Heinlein,

2063.quote: When I was about eight, I decided that the most wonderful thing, next to a human being, was a book.
2063.author: Margaret Walker

2064.quote: It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party.
2064.author: Nick Hornby

2065.quote: I read once that the ancient Egyptians had fifty words for sand & the Eskimos had a hundred words for snow. I wish I had a thousand words for love, but all that comes to mind is the way you move against me while you sleep & there are no words for that.
2065.author: Brian Andreas,

2066.quote: Sometimes the Bible in the hand of one man is worse than a whisky bottle in the hand of (another)... There are just some kind of men who - who're so busy worrying about the next world they've never learned to live in this one, and you can look down the street and see the results.
2066.author: Harper Lee,

2067.quote: Always go to other people's funerals, otherwise they won't come to yours.
2067.author: Yogi Berra,

2068.quote: It's hard to enjoy practical jokes when your whole life feels like one.
2068.author: Rick Riordan,

2069.quote: If we couldn't laugh we would all go insane.
2069.author: Robert Frost

2070.quote: And all the books you've read have been read by other people. And all the songs you've loved have been heard by other people. And that girl that's pretty to you is pretty to other people. and that if you looked at these facts when you were happy, you would feel great because you are describing 'unity.
2070.author: Stephen Chbosky,

2071.quote: Lost love is still love. It takes a different form, that's all. You can't see their smile or bring them food or tousle their hair or move them around a dance floor. But when those senses weaken another heightens. Memory. Memory becomes your partner. You nurture it. You hold it. You dance with it.
2071.author: Mitch Albom

2072.quote: I like too many things and get all confused and hung-up running from one falling star to another till i drop. This is the night, what it does to you. I had nothing to offer anybody except my own confusion.
2072.author: Jack Kerouac

2073.quote: If you don't know history, then you don't know anything. You are a leaf that doesn't know it is part of a tree.
2073.author: Michael Crichton

2074.quote: When I was your age, television was called books.
2074.author: William Goldman,

2075.quote: Writing is like sex. First you do it for love, then you do it for your friends, and then you do it for money.
2075.author: Virginia Woolf

2076.quote:
What do you want?"
"Just coffee. Black - like my soul.
2076.author: Cassandra Clare,

2077.quote:
