2464.quote: The feelings that hurt most, the emotions that sting most, are those that are absurd - The longing for impossible things, precisely because they are impossible; nostalgia for what never was; the desire for what could have been; regret over not being someone else; dissatisfaction with the world's existence. All these half-tones of the soul's consciousness create in us a painful landscape, an eternal sunset of what we are.
2464.author: Fernando Pessoa

2465.quote: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
2465.author: Helen Keller,

2466.quote: You'll miss the best things if you keep your eyes shut.
2466.author: Dr. Seuss,

2467.quote: I know it's wrong - God, it's all kinds of wrong - but I just want to lie down with you and wake up with you, just once, just once ever in my life.
2467.author: Cassandra Clare,

2468.quote: You deal with mythological stuff for a few years, you learn that paradises are usually places where you get killed.
2468.author: Rick Riordan,

2469.quote: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
2469.author: Marcus Aurelius,

2470.quote: We can't be afraid of change. You may feel very secure in the pond that you are in, but if you never venture out of it, you will never know that there is such a thing as an ocean, a sea. Holding onto something that is good for you now, may be the very reason why you don't have something better.
2470.author: C. JoyBell C.

2471.quote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.
2471.author: Walt Whitman

2472.quote: There are nights when the wolves are silent and only the moon howls.
2472.author: George Carlin

2473.quote: The thing that makes you exceptional, if you are at all, is inevitably that which must also make you lonely.
2473.author: Lorraine Hansberry

2474.quote: Only a generation of readers will spawn a generation of writers.
2474.author: Steven Spielberg

2475.quote: Don't cry over someone who wouldn't cry over you.
2475.author: Lauren Conrad

2476.quote: You will lose what you value most, so treasure it while you can.
2476.author: Richelle Mead,

2477.quote: Whoever is careless with the truth in small matters cannot be trusted with important matters
2477.author: Albert Einstein

2478.quote: No great mind has ever existed without a touch of madness.
2478.author: Aristotle

2479.quote: Laughter is wine for the soul - laughter soft, or loud and deep, tinged through with seriousness - the hilarious declaration made by man that life is worth living.
2479.author: Sean O'Casey

2480.quote: We learn from failure, not from success!
2480.author: Bram Stoker,

2481.quote:
to love life, to love it even
when you have no stomach for it
and everything you've held dear
crumbles like burnt paper in your hands,
your throat filled with the silt of it.
When grief sits with you, its tropical heat
thickening the air, heavy as water
more fit for gills than lungs;
when grief weights you like your own flesh
only more of it, an obesity of grief,
you think, How can a body withstand this?
Then you hold life like a face
between your palms, a plain face,
no charming smile, no violet eyes,
and you say, yes, I will take you
I will love you, again.
2481.author: Ellen Bass

2482.quote: Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll land among the stars.
2482.author: Norman Vincent Peale

2483.quote: I want to be in a relationship where you telling me you love me is just a ceremonious validation of what you already show me.
2483.author: Steve Maraboli,

2484.quote:
there is a place in the heart that
will never be filled

a space

and even during the
best moments
and
the greatest times
times

we will know it

we will know it
more than
ever

there is a place in the heart that
will never be filled
and

we will wait
and
wait

in that space.
2484.author: Charles bukowski

2485.quote: Great minds discuss ideas. Average minds discuss events. Small minds discuss people.
2485.author: Henry Thomas Buckle

2486.quote: You can only be young once. But you can always be immature.
2486.author: Pat  Monahan

2487.quote: It would seem that Our Lord finds our desires not too strong, but too weak. We are half-hearted creatures, fooling about with drink and sex and ambition when infinite joy is offered us, like an ignorant child who wants to go on making mud pies in a slum because he cannot imagine what is meant by the offer of a holiday at the sea. We are far too easily pleased.
2487.author: C.S. Lewis,

2488.quote: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that receives it.
2488.author: Edith Wharton

2490.quote: You forget what you want to remember, and you remember what you want to forget.
2490.author: Cormac McCarthy,

2491.quote: We do not believe in ourselves until someone reveals that deep inside us something is valuable, worth listening to, worthy of our trust, sacred to our touch. Once we believe in ourselves we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight or any experience that reveals the human spirit.
2491.author: E.E. Cummings

2492.quote: All a girl really wants is for one guy to prove to her that they are not all the same.
2492.author: Marilyn Monroe

2493.quote: If you never did you should. These things are fun and fun is good.
2493.author: Dr. Seuss

2494.quote: Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.
2494.author: Oscar Wilde

2495.quote: I got schooled this year by a boy. A boy that I'm seriously, deeply, madly, incredibly, and undeniably in love with. And he taught me the most important thing of all... To put the emphasis On life .
2495.author: Colleen Hoover,

2496.quote: Does such a thing as 'the fatal flaw,' that showy dark crack running down the middle of a life, exist outside literature? I used to think it didn't. Now I think it does. And I think that mine is this: a morbid longing for the picturesque at all costs.
2496.author: Donna Tartt,

2497.quote: The impossible could not have happened, therefore the impossible must be possible in spite of appearances.
2497.author: Agatha Christie,

2498.quote: We do not need magic to transform our world. We carry all of the power we need inside ourselves already.
2498.author: J.K. Rowling,

2499.quote: I am both happy and sad at the same time, and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be.
2499.author: Stephen Chbosky,

2500.quote: The trouble was, I had been inadequate all along, I simply hadn't thought about it.
2500.author: Sylvia Plath,

2501.quote: Only you can control your future.
2501.author: Dr. Seuss

2502.quote: It is nothing to die. It is frightful not to live.
2502.author: Victor Hugo,

2503.quote:
Instructions for living a life. 
Pay attention. 
Be astonished. 
Tell about it.
2503.author: Mary Oliver

2504.quote: There must be something in books, something we can't imagine, to make a woman stay in a burning house; there must be something there. You don't stay for nothing.
2504.author: Ray Bradbury,

2505.quote: And then I am going to rattle the stars.
2505.author: Sarah J. Maas,

2506.quote:
I don't go out with strangers," I said.

"Good thing I do. I'll pick you up at five.
2506.author: Becca Fitzpatrick,

2508.quote: If someone were to harm my family or a friend or somebody I love, I would eat them. I might end up in jail for 500 years, but I would eat them.
2508.author: Johnny Depp

2509.quote: It is better, I think, to grab at the stars than to sit flustered because you know you cannot reach them.
2509.author: R.A. Salvatore,

2510.quote: A person who has good thoughts cannot ever be ugly. You can have a wonky nose and a crooked mouth and a double chin and stick-out teeth, but if you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely.
2510.author: Roald Dahl,

2511.quote: Stars, hide your fires; Let not light see my black and deep desires.
2511.author: William Shakespeare,

2512.quote:
There are moments when troubles enter our lives and we can do nothing to avoid them.
But they are there for a reason. Only when we have overcome them will we understand why they were there.
2512.author: Paulo Coelho,

2514.quote: The best way to not feel hopeless is to get up and do something. Don't wait for good things to happen to you. If you go out and make some good things happen, you will fill the world with hope, you will fill yourself with hope.
2514.author: Barack Obama

2515.quote: Sometimes love means letting go when you want to hold on tighter.
2515.author: Melissa Marr,

2516.quote: Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.
2516.author: Oscar Wilde

2517.quote: Pity those who don't feel anything at all.
2517.author: Sarah J. Maas,

2518.quote: Anti-intellectualism has been a constant thread winding its way through our political and cultural life, nurtured by the false notion that democracy means that 'my ignorance is just as good as your knowledge.'
2518.author: Isaac Asimov

2519.quote: A mother is the truest friend we have, when trials heavy and sudden fall upon us; when adversity takes the place of prosperity; when friends desert us; when trouble thickens around us, still will she cling to us, and endeavor by her kind precepts and counsels to dissipate the clouds of darkness, and cause peace to return to our hearts.
2519.author: Washington Irving

2520.quote: Courage isn't having the strength to go on - it is going on when you don't have strength.
2520.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

2521.quote: God does not play dice with the universe; He plays an ineffable game of His own devising, which might be compared, from the perspective of any of the other players [i.e. everybody], to being involved in an obscure and complex variant of poker in a pitch-dark room, with blank cards, for infinite stakes, with a Dealer who won't tell you the rules, and who smiles all the time.
2521.author: Terry Pratchett,

2522.quote: Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.
2522.author: C.G. Jung

2523.quote:
Watch out for intellect,
because it knows so much it knows nothing
and leaves you hanging upside down,
mouthing knowledge as your heart
falls out of your mouth.
2523.author: Anne Sexton,

2524.quote: Be glad. Be good. Be brave.
2524.author: Eleanor Hodgman Porter

2525.quote: A well-composed book is a magic carpet on which we are wafted to a world that we cannot enter in any other way.
2525.author: Caroline Gordon

2526.quote: It isn't what we say or think that defines us, but what we do.
2526.author: Jane Austen,

2527.quote: The soul is healed by being with children.
2527.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

2528.quote: Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood.
2528.author: Jane Yolen,

2529.quote: My life has a superb cast, but I cannot figure out the plot.
2529.author: Ashleigh Brilliant

2530.quote: You think because he doesn't love you that you are worthless. You think that because he doesn't want you anymore that he is right -- that his judgement and opinion of you are correct. If he throws you out, then you are garbage. You think he belongs to you because you want to belong to him. Don't. It's a bad word, 'belong.' Especially when you put it with somebody you love. Love shouldn't be like that. Did you ever see the way the clouds love a mountain? They circle all around it; sometimes you can't even see the mountain for the clouds. But you know what? You go up top and what do you see? His head. The clouds never cover the head. His head pokes through, beacuse the clouds let him; they don't wrap him up. They let him keep his head up high, free, with nothing to hide him or bind him. You can't own a human being. You can't lose what you don't own. Suppose you did own him. Could you really love somebody who was absolutely nobody without you? You really want somebody like that? Somebody who falls apart when you walk out the door? You don't, do you? And neither does he. You're turning over your whole life to him. Your whole life, girl. And if it means so little to you that you can just give it away, hand it to him, then why should it mean any more to him? He can't value you more than you value yourself.
2530.author: Toni Morrison

2531.quote: When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion.
2531.author: Abraham Lincoln

2532.quote: The worst type of crying wasn't the kind everyone could see--the wailing on street corners, the tearing at clothes. No, the worst kind happened when your soul wept and no matter what you did, there was no way to comfort it. A section withered and became a scar on the part of your soul that survived. For people like me and Echo, our souls contained more scar tissue than life.
2532.author: Katie McGarry,

2533.quote: I decided as long as I'm going to hell, I might as well do it thoroughly.
2533.author: Stephenie Meyer,

2534.quote: The past is never where you think you left it.
2534.author: Katherine Anne Porter

2535.quote: The more clearly we can focus our attention on the wonders and realities of the universe about us, the less taste we shall have for destruction.
2535.author: Rachel Carson

2536.quote: He who knows all the answers has not been asked all the questions.
2536.author: Confucius

2537.quote: The longer I live, the more I observe that carrying around anger is the most debilitating to the person who bears it.
2537.author: Katharine Graham

2538.quote: You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.
2538.author: Jack London

2539.quote: The water hears and understands. The ice does not forgive.
2539.author: Leigh Bardugo,

2540.quote: Dreams are always crushing when they don't come true. But it's the simple dreams that are often the most painful because they seem so personal, so reasonable, so attainable. You're always close enough to touch, but never quite close enough to hold and it's enough to break your heart.
2540.author: Nicholas Sparks,

2541.quote: The purpose of a storyteller is not to tell you how to think, but to give you questions to think upon.
2541.author: Brandon Sanderson,

2542.quote: Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart
2542.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

2543.quote: It's so much darker when a light goes out than it would have been if it had never shone.
2543.author: John Steinbeck,

2544.quote: We dream to give ourselves hope. To stop dreaming - well, that's like saying you can never change your fate.
2544.author: Amy Tan,

2545.quote: If you have the words, there's always a chance that you'll find the way.
2545.author: Seamus Heaney,

2546.quote: When you trip over love, it is easy to get up. But when you fall in love, it is impossible to stand again.
2546.author: Albert Einstein

2547.quote: To do the useful thing, to say the courageous thing, to contemplate the beautiful thing: that is enough for one man's life.
2547.author: T.S. Eliot,

2548.quote: This is a new year. A new beginning. And things will change.
2548.author: Taylor Swift

2549.quote: I know not all that may be coming, but be it what it will, I'll go to it laughing.
2549.author: Herman Melville,

2550.quote: Do you not see how necessary a world of pains and troubles is to school an intelligence and make it a soul?
2550.author: John Keats,

2551.quote: Never miss a good chance to shut up.
2551.author: Will Rogers

2552.quote:
You are okay?" he asked. "Not eaten by monsters?"
"Not even a little bit." I showed him that I still had both arms and both legs, and Tyson clapped happily.
"Yay!" he said. "Now we can eat peanut butter sandwiches and ride fish ponies! We can fight monsters and see Annabeth and make things go BOOM!"
I hoped he didn't mean all at the same time, but I told him absolutely, we'd have a lot of fun this summer.
2552.author: Rick Riordan,

2553.quote: An intellectual? Yes. And never deny it. An intellectual is someone whose mind watches itself. I like this, because I am happy to be both halves, the watcher and the watched. "Can they be brought together?" This is a practical question. We must get down to it. "I despise intelligence" really means: "I cannot bear my doubts.
2553.author: Albert Camus

2554.quote: Usually we walk around constantly believing ourselves. "I'm okay" we say. "I'm alright". But sometimes the truth arrives on you and you can't get it off. That's when you realize that sometimes it isn't even an answer--it's a question. Even now, I wonder how much of my life is convinced.
2554.author: Markus Zusak,

2555.quote: A man is but the product of his thoughts. What he thinks, he becomes.
2555.author: Mahatma Gandhi

2556.quote: I am beginning to learn that it is the sweet, simple things of life which are the real ones after all.
2556.author: Laura Ingalls Wilder

2557.quote: It stops here. With me and you. It ends with us.
2557.author: Colleen Hoover,

2558.quote: Your assumptions are your windows on the world. Scrub them off every once in a while, or the light won't come in.
2558.author: Alan Alda

2559.quote: I'm on a roller coaster that only goes up, my friend.
2559.author: John Green,

2560.quote: We sometimes encounter people, even perfect strangers, who begin to interest us at first sight, somehow suddenly, all at once, before a word has been spoken.
2560.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,

2561.quote:
If books could have more, give more, be more, show more, they would still need readers who bring to them sound and smell and light and all the rest that can't be in books.
	The book needs you.
2561.author: Gary Paulsen,

2562.quote: I guess that's what saying good-bye is always like--like jumping off an edge. The worst part is making the choice to do it. Once you're in the air, there's nothing you can do but let go.
2562.author: Lauren Oliver,

2563.quote:
He was the crazy one who had painted himself black and defeated the world.

She was the book thief without the words.

Trust me, though, the words were on their way, and when they arrived, Liesel would hold them in her hands like the clouds, and she would wring them out like rain.
2563.author: Markus Zusak,

2564.quote: In one aspect, yes, I believe in ghosts, but we create them. We haunt ourselves.
2564.author: Laurie Halse Anderson,

2565.quote: I don't mind making jokes, but I don't want to look like one.
2565.author: Marilyn Monroe

2566.quote: I write differently from what I speak, I speak differently from what I think, I think differently from the way I ought to think, and so it all proceeds into deepest darkness.
2566.author: Franz Kafka

2567.quote: I know how devastated you must be to miss me, but leave a message, and I'll try to ease your agony
2567.author: Richelle Mead,

2568.quote: I think there should be a rule that everyone in the world should get a standing ovation at least once in their lives.
2568.author: R.J. Palacio,

2569.quote:
If you're texting Magnus to say 'I think u r kewl,' I'm going to kill you."
"Who's Magnus?" Max inquired.
"He's a warlock," said Alec.
"A sexy, sexy warlock," Isabelle told Max, ignoring Alec's look of total fury.
"But warlocks are bad," protested Max, looking baffled.
"Exactly," said Isabelle.
2569.author: Cassandra Clare,

2570.quote: Look at everything always as though you were seeing it either for the first or last time: Thus is your time on earth filled with glory.
2570.author: Betty Smith,

2571.quote: The best way out is always through.
2571.author: Robert Frost

2572.quote: The thing I realize is, that it's not what you take, it's what you leave.
2572.author: Jennifer Niven,

2573.quote: Behind this mask there is more than just flesh. Beneath this mask there is an idea... and ideas are bulletproof.
2573.author: Alan Moore,

2574.quote:
The course of true love never did run smooth; But, either it was different in blood,
O cross! too high to be enthrall'd to low.
 Or else misgraffed in respect of years,
 O spite! too old to be engag'd to young. 
Or else it stood upon the choice of friends,
O hell! to choose love by another's eye.
2574.author: William Shakespeare,

2575.quote:
Well, she's not responding to my advances," he observed more brightly than he felt, "so she must be dead." 
"Or she's a woman of good taste and sense.
2575.author: Cassandra Clare,

2576.quote: There are much worse games to play.
2576.author: Suzanne Collins,

2577.quote: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
2577.author: Walt Disney

2578.quote: Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise.
2578.author: Margaret Atwood,

2580.quote: For to know a man's library is, in some measure, to know his mind.
2580.author: Geraldine Brooks,

2581.quote: What is right is not always popular and what is popular is not always right.
2581.author: Albert Einstein

2582.quote: Feminism is the radical notion that women are human beings.
2582.author: Cheris Kramarae

2584.quote: Name the greatest of all inventors. Accident.
2584.author: Mark Twain

2585.quote: When you consider things like the stars, our affairs don't seem to matter very much, do they?
2585.author: Virginia Woolf

2586.quote: Well-read people are less likely to be evil.
2586.author: Lemony Snicket,

2587.quote:
How long was I asleep?" she whispered. He didn't respond. 
"How long was I asleep?" she asked again, and noticed a hint of red in his cheeks. 
"You were asleep, too?" 
"Until you began drooling on my shoulder.
2587.author: Sarah J. Maas,

2588.quote: Do not set aside your happiness. Do not wait to be happy in the future. The best time to be happy is always now.
2588.author: Roy T. Bennett

2589.quote: Children learn more from what you are than what you teach.
2589.author: W.E.B. DuBois

2590.quote: We shall meet in the place where there is no darkness.
2590.author: George Orwell,

2591.quote: If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can ever warm me, I know that is poetry.
2591.author: Emily Dickinson

2592.quote: Sex is part of nature. I go along with nature.
2592.author: Marilyn Monroe

2593.quote: It is easy in the world to live after the world's opinion; it is easy in solitude to live after our own; but the great man is he who in the midst of the crowd keeps with perfect sweetness the independence of solitude.
2593.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,

2594.quote: Good sex is like good bridge. If you don't have a good partner, you'd better have a good hand.
2594.author: Mae West

2595.quote: With enough courage, you can do without a reputation.
2595.author: Margaret Mitchell

2596.quote: Talking to a drunk person was like talking to an extremely happy, severely brain-damaged three-year-old.
2596.author: John Green,

2597.quote: Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along.
2597.author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

2598.quote: Maybe this world is another planet's hell.
2598.author: Aldous Huxley

2599.quote: Of course motivation is not permanent. But then, neither is bathing; but it is something you should do on a regular basis.
2599.author: Zig Ziglar,

2600.quote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
2600.author: Walt Disney

2601.quote: Luxury is not a necessity to me, but beautiful and good things are.
2601.author: Anais Nin

2602.quote: The desire to reach for the stars is ambitious. The desire to reach hearts is wise.
2602.author: Maya Angelou

2603.quote: Nobody gets everything in this life. You decide your priorities and you make your choices. I'd decided long ago that any cake I had would be eaten.
2603.author: Donald E. Westlake,

2604.quote: When I look at my life and its secret colours, I feel like bursting into tears.
2604.author: Albert Camus,

2605.quote: I'm happy. Which often looks like crazy.
2605.author: David Henry Hwang,

2606.quote: Love is like a tree: it grows by itself, roots itself deeply in our being and continues to flourish over a heart in ruin. The inexplicable fact is that the blinder it is, the more tenacious it is. It is never stronger than when it is completely unreasonable.
2606.author: Victor Hugo,

2607.quote: What is straight? A line can be straight, or a street, but the human heart, oh, no, it's curved like a road through mountains.
2607.author: Tennessee Williams,

2608.quote: Life is a mirror: if you frown at it, it frowns back; if you smile, it returns the greeting.
2608.author: William Makepeace Thackeray

2609.quote: Without you in my arms, I feel an emptiness in my soul. I find myself searching the crowds for your face - I know it's an impossibility, but I cannot help myself.
2609.author: Nicholas Sparks,

2610.quote: Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity.
2610.author: G.K. Chesterton

2611.quote:
There's a bluebird in my heart that wants to get out
but I'm too tough for him,
I say, stay in there, I'm not going to let anybody see you.
2611.author: Charles Bukowski

2612.quote:
You could say sorry," suggested Harry bluntly. 
"What, and get attacked by another flock of canaries?" muttered Ron.
"What did you have to imitate her for?"
"She laughed at my mustache!"
"So did I, it was the stupidest thing I've ever seen.
2612.author: J.K. Rowling,

2613.quote: When people say impossible, they usually mean improbable.
2613.author: Leigh Bardugo,

2614.quote: District 12: Where you can starve to death in safety.
2614.author: Suzanne Collins,

2617.quote:
How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.
I love thee to the depth and breadth and height
My soul can reach
2617.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

2618.quote: I opened myself to the gentle indifference of the world.
2618.author: Albert Camus,

2619.quote: Five exclamation marks, the sure sign of an insane mind.
2619.author: Terry Pratchett,

2620.quote: What draws people to be friends is that they see the same truth. They share it.
2620.author: C. S. Lewis

2621.quote: Some things in life are out of your control. You can make it a party or a tragedy.
2621.author: Nora Roberts,

2622.quote:
God alert!" Blackjack yelled. "It's the wine dude!
Mr. D sighed in exasperation. "The next person, or horse, who calls me the 'wine dude' will end up in a bottle of Merlot!
2622.author: Rick Riordan,

2623.quote: We dream in our waking moments, and walk in our sleep.
2623.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne,

2624.quote:
Gus: "It tastes like..."
Me: "Food."
Gus: "Yes, precisely. It tastes like food, excellently prepared. But it does not taste, how do I put this delicately...?"
Me: "It does not taste like God Himself cooked heaven into a series of five dishes which were then served to you accompanied by several luminous balls of fermented, bubbly plasma while actual and literal flower petals floated down around your canal-side dinner table."
Gus: "Nicely phrased."
Gus's father: "Our children are weird."
My dad: "Nicely phrased.
2624.author: John Green,

2625.quote: If you stay, I'll do whatever you want. I'll quit the band, go with you to New York. But if you need me to go away, I'll do that, too. I was talking to Liz and she said maybe coming back to your old life would be too painful, that maybe it'd be easier for you to erase us. And that would suck, but I'd do it. I can lose you like that if I don't lose you today. I'll let you go. If you stay.
2625.author: Gayle Forman,

2626.quote: There is nothing like looking, if you want to find something. You certainly usually find something, if you look, but it is not always quite the something you were after.
2626.author: J.R.R. Tolkien,

2627.quote: Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love.
2627.author: Charles M. Schulz

2628.quote: Now that she had nothing to lose, she was free.
2628.author: Paulo Coelho,

2629.quote: Women want love to be a novel. Men, a short story.
2629.author: Daphne du Maurier

2630.quote: If there's one thing I've learned, it's this: We all want everything to be okay. We don't even wish so much for fantastic or marvelous or outstanding. We will happily settle for okay, because most of the time, okay is enough.
2630.author: David Levithan,

2631.quote: There will be a few times in your life when all your instincts will tell you to do something, something that defies logic, upsets your plans, and may seem crazy to others. When that happens, you do it. Listen to your instincts and ignore everything else. Ignore logic, ignore the odds, ignore the complications, and just go for it.
2631.author: Judith McNaught,

2632.quote: The sunlight claps the earth, and the moonbeams kiss the sea: what are all these kissings worth, if thou kiss not me?
2632.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

2633.quote: You believe in a book that has talking animals, wizards, witches, demons, sticks turning into snakes, burning bushes, food falling from the sky, people walking on water, and all sorts of magical, absurd and primitive stories, and you say that we are the ones that need help?
2633.author: Mark Twain

2634.quote: The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated.
2634.author: Mahatma Gandhi

2635.quote: Believe in your infinite potential. Your only limitations are those you set upon yourself.
2635.author: Roy T. Bennett,

2636.quote: It is not the length of life, but the depth.
2636.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

2637.quote:
Will rolled up his sleeves. "We'll probably have to knock down the door--"
 "Or," said Jem, reaching out and giving the knob a twist, "not."
 The door swung open onto a rectangle of darkness.
 "Now, that's simply laziness," said Will.
2637.author: Cassandra Clare,

2638.quote: Do not train a child to learn by force or harshness; but direct them to it by what amuses their minds, so that you may be better able to discover with accuracy the peculiar bent of the genius of each.
2638.author: Plato

2639.quote: However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?
2639.author: Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

2640.quote: I decided it is better to scream. Silence is the real crime against humanity.
2640.author: Nadezhda Mandelstam,

2641.quote:
Have you tried talking to her?" 
"No. We've been punching her in the face repeatedly. What? You don't think that will work?
2641.author: Cassandra Clare,

2642.quote: I suffer from girlnextdooritis where the guy is friends with you and that's it.
2642.author: Taylor Swift

2643.quote: Fiction is the lie through which we tell the truth.
2643.author: Albert Camus

2644.quote: Death is so terribly final, while life is full of possibilities.
2644.author: George R.R. Martin,

2645.quote: There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact.
2645.author: Arthur Conan Doyle,

2646.quote:
So light a fire!" Harry choked. "Yes...of course...but there's no wood!" ... 
"HAVE YOU GONE MAD!" Ron bellowed. "ARE YOU A WITCH OR NOT!
2646.author: J.K. Rowling,

2647.quote: You get what anybody gets - you get a lifetime.
2647.author: Neil Gaiman,

2648.quote: It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen.
2648.author: George Orwell,

2649.quote: That which you believe becomes your world.
2649.author: Richard Matheson,

2650.quote: Being with you never felt wrong. It's the one thing I did right. You're the one thing I did right.
2650.author: Becca Fitzpatrick,

2651.quote: She was a genius of sadness, immersing herself in it, separating its numerous strands, appreciating its subtle nuances. She was a prism through which sadness could be divided into its infinite spectrum.
2651.author: Jonathan Safran Foer,

2652.quote: And Lot's wife, of course, was told not to look back where all those people and their homes had been. But she did look back, and I love her for that, because it was so human. So she was turned into a pillar of salt. So it goes.
2652.author: Kurt Vonnegut,

2653.quote: The things we love destroy us every time, lad. Remember that.
2653.author: George R.R. Martin,

2654.quote: When you read a book, you hold another's mind in your hands.
2654.author: James Burke

2655.quote: It takes something more than intelligence to act intelligently.
2655.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,

2656.quote: To die, it's easy. But you have to struggle for life.
2656.author: Art Spiegelman,

2657.quote: Music is ... A higher revelation than all Wisdom & Philosophy
2657.author: Ludwig van Beethoven

2658.quote: Real generosity towards the future lies in giving all to the present.
2658.author: Albert Camus,

2659.quote: The role of a writer is not to say what we can all say, but what we are unable to say.
2659.author: Anais Nin

2660.quote:
A girl calls and asks, "Does it hurt very much to die?"
"Well, sweetheart," I tell her, "yes, but it hurts a lot more to keep living.
2660.author: Chuck Palahniuk,

2661.quote: One should always be drunk. That's all that matters...But with what? With wine, with poetry, or with virtue, as you chose. But get drunk.
2661.author: Charles Baudelaire,

2662.quote: Adults are always asking little kids what they want to be when they grow up 'cause they're looking for ideas.
2662.author: Paula Poundstone

2663.quote: Freedom (n.): To ask nothing. To expect nothing. To depend on nothing.
2663.author: Ayn Rand,

2665.quote: The most terrible poverty is loneliness, and the feeling of being unloved.
2665.author: Mother Teresa

2666.quote: Why do beautiful songs make you sad?' 'Because they aren't true.' 'Never?' 'Nothing is beautiful and true.
2666.author: Jonathan Safran Foer,

2667.quote: I like this place and could willingly waste my time in it.
2667.author: William Shakespeare

2669.quote: Unfortunately, the clock is ticking, the hours are going by. The past increases, the future recedes. Possibilities decreasing, regrets mounting.
2669.author: Haruki Murakami,

2670.quote: I love you as certain dark things are loved, secretly, between the shadow and the soul.
2670.author: Pablo Neruda,

2671.quote: Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else.
2671.author: Judy Garland

2672.quote: But until a person can say deeply and honestly, "I am what I am today because of the choices I made yesterday," that person cannot say, "I choose otherwise.
2672.author: Stephen R. Covey,

2673.quote: She looked at nice young men as if she could smell their stupidity.
2673.author: Flannery O'Connor

2674.quote: But I believe in true love, you know? I don't believe that everybody gets to keep their eyes or not get sick or whatever, but everybody should have true love, and it should last at least as long as your life does.
2674.author: John Green,

2675.quote: Sometimes, the best way to help someone is just to be near them.
2675.author: Veronica Roth,

2676.quote: I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception.
2676.author: Groucho Marx

2677.quote: I guess by now I should know enough about loss to realize that you never really stop missing someone-you just learn to live around the huge gaping hole of their absence.
2677.author: Alyson Noel,

2678.quote:
In the world I am
Always a stranger
I do not understand its language
It does not understand my silence
2678.author: Bei Dao

2679.quote: I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become.
2679.author: Carl Gustav Jung

2680.quote: Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier. Be the living expression of God's kindness: kindness in your face, kindness in your eyes, kindness in your smile.
2680.author: Mother Teresa

2681.quote: There is no such thing as a "broken family." Family is family, and is not determined by marriage certificates, divorce papers, and adoption documents. Families are made in the heart. The only time family becomes null is when those ties in the heart are cut. If you cut those ties, those people are not your family. If you make those ties, those people are your family. And if you hate those ties, those people will still be your family because whatever you hate will always be with you.
2681.author: C. JoyBell C.

2682.quote: Sometimes you lose a battle. But mischief always wins the war
2682.author: John Green,

2683.quote: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
2683.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

2684.quote: The mountains are calling and I must go.
2684.author: John Muir

2685.quote: My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness.
2685.author: Dalai Lama XIV

2686.quote: I am a forest, and a night of dark trees: but he who is not afraid of my darkness, will find banks full of roses under my cypresses.
2686.author: Friedrich Nietzsche,

2687.quote: I'm always happy," Sasha said. "Sometimes I just forget.
2687.author: Jennifer Egan,

2688.quote: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
2688.author: Confucius,

2689.quote: If you are a student you should always get a good nights sleep unless you have come to the good part of your book, and then you should stay up all night and let your schoolwork fall by the wayside, a phrase which means 'flunk'.
2689.author: Lemony Snicket

2690.quote: A concept is a brick. It can be used to build a courthouse of reason. Or it can be thrown through the window.
2690.author: Gilles Deleuze,

2691.quote: Lord, what fools these mortals be!
2691.author: William Shakespeare,

2692.quote:
When you go into the ER, one of the first things they ask you to do is rate your pain on a scale of one to ten, and from there they decide which drugs to use and how quickly to use them. I'd been asked this question hundreds of times over the years, and I remember once early on when I couldn't get my breath and it felt like my chest was on fire, flames licking the inside of my ribs fighting for a way to burn out of my body, my parents took me to the ER. nurse asked me about the pain, and I couldn't even speak, so I held up nine fingers.

Later, after they'd given me something, the nurse came in and she was kind of stroking my head while she took my blood pressure and said, "You know how I know you're a fighter? You called a ten a nine."

But that wasn't quite right. I called it a nine because I was saving my ten. And here it was, the great and terrible ten, slamming me again and again as I lay still and alone in my bed staring at the ceiling, the waves tossing me against the rocks then pulling me back out to sea so they could launch me again into the jagged face of the cliff, leaving me floating faceup on the water, undrowned.
2692.author: John Green,

2693.quote: To survive, you must tell stories.
2693.author: Umberto Eco,

2694.quote: I want everyone to meet you. You're my favorite person of all time.
2694.author: Rainbow Rowell,

2695.quote: After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations.
2695.author: Oscar Wilde,

2696.quote:
I feel like someone breathed new air into my lungs. I am not Abnegation. I am not Dauntless. 
I am Divergent.
2696.author: Veronica Roth,

2697.quote: You never know what life is like, until you have lived it.
2697.author: Marilyn Monroe

2698.quote: We don't need a list of rights and wrongs, tables of dos and don'ts: we need books, time, and silence. Thou shalt not is soon forgotten, but Once upon a time lasts forever.
2698.author: Philip Pullman

2699.quote: Listen with curiosity. Speak with honesty. Act with integrity. The greatest problem with communication is we don't listen to understand. We listen to reply. When we listen with curiosity, we don't listen with the intent to reply. We listen for what's behind the words.
2699.author: Roy T. Bennett,

2700.quote: There are perhaps many causes worth dying for, but to me, certainly, there are none worth killing for.
2700.author: Albert Dietrich,

2701.quote:
There is a saying in Tibetan, 'Tragedy should be utilized as a source of strength.'
No matter what sort of difficulties, how painful experience is, if we lose our hope, that's our real disaster.
2701.author: Dalai Lama XIV

2702.author: Kurt Vonnegut,

2703.quote: To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.
2703.author: Mahatma Gandhi

2704.quote: If you win, you need not have to explain...If you lose, you should not be there to explain!
2704.author: Adolf Hitler

2705.quote:
What's up?" I asked.

You tell me," he said. "You were the one about ready to start making out with Adrian."

It was an experiment," I said. "It was part of my therapy."

What the hell kind of therapy are you in?
2705.author: Richelle Mead,

2706.quote: Man often becomes what he believes himself to be. If I keep on saying to myself that I cannot do a certain thing, it is possible that I may end by really becoming incapable of doing it. On the contrary, if I have the belief that I can do it, I shall surely acquire the capacity to do it even if I may not have it at the beginning.
2706.author: Mahatma Gandhi

2707.quote: We are all born sexual creatures,thank God, but it's a pity so many people despise and crush this natural gift.
2707.author: Marilyn Monroe

2708.quote: And so I try to be kind to everything I see, and in everything I see, I see him.
2708.author: Hanya Yanagihara,

2709.quote: Ask for what you want and be prepared to get it!
2709.author: Maya Angelou

2710.quote: The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also.
2710.author: Mark Twain

2711.quote: The mind I love must have wild places.
2711.author: Katherine Mansfield

2712.quote: It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.
2712.author: George Washington

2713.quote: What's terrible is to pretend that second-rate is first-rate. To pretend that you don't need love when you do; or you like your work when you know quite well you're capable of better.
2713.author: Doris Lessing,

2714.quote: It's only those who do nothing that make no mistakes, I suppose.
2714.author: Joseph Conrad,

2715.quote: Every weirdo in the world is on my wavelength.
2715.author: Thomas Pynchon

2716.quote: History does not always repeat itself. Sometimes it just yells, 'Can't you remember anything I told you?' and lets fly with a club.
2716.author: John W. Campbell Jr.

2717.quote: If I am not good to myself, how can I expect anyone else to be good to me?
2717.author: Maya Angelou

2718.quote: Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not.
2718.author: Pablo Picasso,

2719.quote: This is where it all begins. Everything starts here, today.
2719.author: David Nicholls,

2720.quote:
Stop fighting me!" he said, trying to pull on the arm he held.

He was in a precarious position himself, straddling the rail as he tried to lean over far enough to get me and actually hold onto me.

Let go of me! I yelled back.

But he was too strong and managed to haul most of me over the rail, enough so that I wasn't in total danger of falling again.

See, here's the thing. In that moment before I let go, I really had been contemplating my death. I'd come to terms with it and accepted it. I also, however, had known Dimitri might do something exactly like this. He was just that fast and that good. That was why I was holding my stake in the hand that was dangling free.

I looked him in the eye. "I will always love you."

Then I plunged the stake into his chest.

It wasn't as precise a blow as I would have liked, not with the skilled way he was dodging. I struggled to get the stake in deep enough to his heart, unsure if I could do it from this angle. Then, his struggles stopped. His eyes stared at me, stunned, and his lips parted, almost into a smile, albeit a grisly and pained one.

"That's what I was supposed to say. . . he gasped out.

Those were his last words.
2720.author: Richelle Mead,

2721.quote: So we shall let the reader answer this question for himself: who is the happier man, he who has braved the storm of life and lived or he who has stayed securely on shore and merely existed?
2721.author: Hunter S. Thompson

2722.quote: When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better.
2722.author: Mae West

2723.quote: Learn the rules, break the rules, make up new rules, break the new rules.
2723.author: Marvin Bell

2724.quote: Life has no remote....get up and change it yourself!
2724.author: Mark A. Cooper,

2725.quote: Oh, we're playing nice now? Shall we have tea first? Brew up a nice pot of kiss-my-ass?
2725.author: Julie Kagawa,

2726.quote: I'm afraid that sometimes you'll play lonely games too. Games you can't win 'cause you'll play against you.
2726.author: Dr. Seuss

2727.quote: Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.
2727.author: Anais Nin

2728.quote: Because,' she said, 'when you're scared but you still do it anyway, that's brave.
2728.author: Neil Gaiman,

2729.quote: I hope you find someone you can't live without.I really do. And I hope you never have to know what it's like to have to try and live without them.
2729.author: Kiera Cass,

2730.quote: What is that feeling when you're driving away from people and they recede on the plain till you see their specks dispersing? - it's the too-huge world vaulting us, and it's good-bye. But we lean forward to the next crazy venture beneath the skies.
2730.author: Jack Kerouac,

2731.quote: May your trails be crooked, winding, lonesome, dangerous, leading to the most amazing view.
2731.author: Edward Abbey

2732.quote: Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.
2732.author: Steve Maraboli,

2733.quote:
To lose balance sometimes for love is part of living a balanced
life.
2733.author: Elizabeth Gilbert,

2734.quote:
Passion makes a person stop eating, sleeping, working, feeling at peace. A lot of people are frightened because, when it appears, it demolishes all the old things it finds in its path. 

No one wants their life thrown into chaos. That is why a lot of people keep that threat under control, and are somehow capable of sustaining a house or a structure that is already rotten. They are the engineers of the superseded. 

Other people think exactly the opposite: they surrender themselves without a second thought, hoping to find in passion the solutions to all their problems. They make the other person responsible for their happiness and blame them for their possible unhappiness. They are either euphoric because something marvelous has happened or depressed because something unexpected has just ruined everything. 

Keeping passion at bay or surrendering blindly to it - which of these two attitudes is the least destructive? 

I don't know.
2734.author: Paulo Coelho,

2735.quote: Poetry is what gets lost in translation.
2735.author: Robert Frost

2736.quote: As long as she thinks of a man, nobody objects to a woman thinking.
2736.author: Virginia Woolf,

2737.quote: The mystery of human existence lies not in just staying alive, but in finding something to live for.
2737.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,

2738.quote: Life is like a prism. What you see depends on how you turn the glass.
2738.author: Jonathan Kellerman

2739.quote: You're something between a dream and a miracle.
2739.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

2740.quote: When things break, it's not the actual breaking that prevents them from getting back together again. It's because a little piece gets lost - the two remaining ends couldn't fit together even if they wanted to. The whole shape has changed.
2740.author: John Green,

2741.quote:
Seventeen, eh!" said Hagrid as he accepted a bucket-sized glass of wine from Fred.
"Six years to the day we met, Harry, d'yeh remember it?"
"Vaguely," said Harry, grinning up at him. "Didn't you smash down the front door, give Dudley a pig's tail, and tell me I was a wizard?"
"I forge' the details," Hagrid chortled.
2741.author: J.K. Rowling,

2742.quote: And then I felt sad because I realized that once people are broken in certain ways, they can't ever be fixed, and this is something nobody ever tells you when you are young and it never fails to surprise you as you grow older as you see the people in your life break one by one. You wonder when your turn is going to be, or if it's already happened.
2742.author: Douglas Coupland,

2743.quote: Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place.
2743.author: Zora Neale Hurston

2744.quote: Never leave a friend behind. Friends are all we have to get us through this life--and they are the only things from this world that we could hope to see in the next.
2744.author: Dean Koontz,

2745.quote: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.
2745.author: Charles Dickens

2746.quote: You have everything needed for the extravagant journey that is your life.
2746.author: Carlos Castaneda

2747.quote: The Darkling slumped back in his chair. Fine, he said with a weary shrug. Make me your villain.
2747.author: Leigh Bardugo,

2748.quote: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
2748.author: Confucius

2749.quote: I am going to take this bucket of water and pour it on the flames of hell, and then I am going to use this torch to burn down the gates of paradise so that people will not love God for want of heaven or fear of hell, but because He is God.
2749.author: John Green,

2750.quote: Whenever you think or you believe or you know, you're a lot of other people: but the moment you feel, you're nobody-but-yourself.
2750.author: e.e. cummings

2751.quote: The starting point of all achievement is DESIRE. Keep this constantly in mind. Weak desire brings weak results, just as a small fire makes a small amount of heat.
2751.author: Napoleon Hill,

2752.quote: Help others without any reason and give without the expectation of receiving anything in return.
2752.author: Roy T. Bennett,

2753.quote: My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the heck she is.
2753.author: Ellen DeGeneres

2754.quote: Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television.
2754.author: Woody Allen

2755.quote: Morality is simply the attitude we adopt towards people we personally dislike.
2755.author: Oscar Wilde,

2756.quote: Happiness is something that comes into our lives through doors we don't even remember leaving open.
2756.author: Rose Wilder Lane

2757.quote: I know some who are constantly drunk on books as other men are drunk on whiskey.
2757.author: H.L. Mencken

2759.quote: We do not remember days, we remember moments.
2759.author: Jennifer Niven,

2760.quote: Don't let the muggles get you down.
2760.author: J.K. Rowling,

2761.quote: The sad truth is the truth is sad.
2761.author: Lemony Snicket,

2762.quote: If you want to be happy, be.
2762.author: Tolstoy Leo

2763.quote: That's the thing about girls. Every time they do something pretty, even if they're not much to look at, or even if they're sort of stupid, you fall in love with them, and then you never know where the hell you are. Girls. Jesus Christ. They can drive you crazy. They really can.
2763.author: J.D. Salinger,

2764.quote: People speak sometimes about the "bestial" cruelty of man, but that is terribly unjust and offensive to beasts, no animal could ever be so cruel as a man, so artfully, so artistically cruel.
2764.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

2765.quote: Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding.
2765.author: Albert Einstein

2766.quote: It is easy to forget how full the world is of people, full to bursting, and each of them imaginable and consistently misimagined.
2766.author: John Green,

2767.quote: We are always the same age inside.
2767.author: Gertrude Stein

2768.quote: When we are children we seldom think of the future. This innocence leaves us free to enjoy ourselves as few adults can. The day we fret about the future is the day we leave our childhood behind.
2768.author: Patrick Rothfuss,

2769.quote: Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing.
2769.author: Ken Kesey,

2770.quote: Being the richest man in the cemetery doesn't matter to me. Going to bed at night saying we've done something wonderful... that's what matters to me.
2770.author: Steve Jobs

2771.quote: Sometimes it takes a good fall to really know where you stand
2771.author: Hayley Williams

2772.quote: What is honor compared to a woman's love? What is duty against the feel of a newborn son in your arms . . . or the memory of a brother's smile? Wind and words. Wind and words. We are only human, and the gods have fashioned us for love. That is our great glory, and our great tragedy.
2772.author: George R.R. Martin,

2773.quote: You may tell a tale that takes up residence in someone's soul, becomes their blood and self and purpose. That tale will move them and drive them and who knows that they might do because of it, because of your words. That is your role, your gift.
2773.author: Erin Morgenstern,

2774.quote: I just want you to know that you're very special... and the only reason I'm telling you is that I don't know if anyone else ever has.
2774.author: Stephen Chbosky,

2775.quote: I restore myself when I'm alone.
2775.author: Marilyn Monroe

2776.quote: Poetry is what happens when nothing else can.
2776.author: Charles Bukowski

2777.quote:
When they asked me what I wanted to be I said I didn't know.
"Oh, sure you know," the photographer said.
"She wants," said Jay Cee wittily, "to be everything.
2777.author: Sylvia Plath,

2778.quote: I don't suffer from my insanity -- I enjoy every minute of it.
2778.author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,

2779.quote: Push yourself. Don't Settle. Just live well. Just LIVE.
2779.author: Jojo Moyes,

2780.quote: True friends are always together in spirit.
2780.author: L.M. Montgomery,

2781.quote: If everybody minded their own business, the world would go around a great deal faster than it does.
2781.author: Lewis Caroll,

2782.quote: This is what we call love. When you are loved, you can do anything in creation. When you are loved, there's no need at all to understand what's happening, because everything happens within you.
2782.author: Paulo Coelho,

2783.quote: Dare to live the life you have dreamed for yourself. Go forward and make your dreams come true.
2783.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

2784.quote: Silly things do cease to be silly if they are done by sensible people in an impudent way.
2784.author: Jane Austen,

2785.quote: The mass of men lead lives of quiet desperation. What is called resignation is confirmed desperation. From the desperate city you go into the desperate country, and have to console yourself with the bravery of minks and muskrats. A stereotyped but unconscious despair is concealed even under what are called the games and amusements of mankind. There is no play in them, for this comes after work. But it is a characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things..
2785.author: Henry David Thoreau,

2786.quote: Spring is the time of plans and projects.
2786.author: Leo Tolstoy,

2787.quote: If you let people into your life a little bit, they can be pretty damn amazing.
2787.author: Sherman Alexie,

2788.quote: I didn't go to religion to make me happy. I always knew a bottle of Port would do that. If you want a religion to make you feel really comfortable, I certainly don't recommend Christianity.
2788.author: C. S. Lewis

2789.quote: If we listened to our intellect we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go in business because we'd be cynical: "It's gonna go wrong." Or "She's going to hurt me." Or,"I've had a couple of bad love affairs, so therefore . . ." Well, that's nonsense. You're going to miss life. You've got to jump off the cliff all the time and build your wings on the way down.
2789.author: Ray Bradbury

2790.quote: There is no point treating a depressed person as though she were just feeling sad, saying, 'There now, hang on, you'll get over it.' Sadness is more or less like a head cold- with patience, it passes. Depression is like cancer.
2790.author: Barbara Kingsolver,

2791.quote: I don't want to be married just to be married. I can't think of anything lonelier than spending the rest of my life with someone I can't talk to, or worse, someone I can't be silent with.
2791.author: Mary Ann Shaffer,

2792.quote: If you try to fail, and succeed, which have you done?
2792.author: George Carlin

2793.quote: Question everything. Your love, your religion, your passion. If you don't have questions, you'll never find answers.
2793.author: Colleen Hoover,

2794.quote: Holding people away from you, and denying yourself love, that doesn't make you strong. if anything, it makes you weaker. Because you're doing it out of fear.
2794.author: Sarah Dessen,

2795.quote: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity
2795.author: Albert Einstein

2796.quote: The unhappiest people in this world, are those who care the most about what other people think.
2796.author: C. JoyBell C.

2797.quote: People are capable, at any time in their lives, of doing what they dream of.
2797.author: Paulo Coelho,

2798.quote:
I clench his hands to the point of pain. "Stay with me."
His pupils contract to pinpoints, dialate again rapidly, and then return to something resembling normalcy. "Always," he murmurs.
2798.author: Suzanne Collins,

2799.quote: Threats are the last resort of a man with no vocabulary.
2799.author: Tamora Pierce,

2800.quote: If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.
2800.author: Marcus Aurelius,

2801.quote: Listen up - there's no war that will end all wars.
2801.author: Haruki Murakami,

2802.quote: Damn, Claire. Warn a guy before you do a face-plant on the floor next time. I could have looked all heroic and caught you or something -Shane
2802.author: Rachel Caine,

2803.quote: Don't waste your love on somebody, who doesn't value it.
2803.author: William Shakespeare,

2804.quote: Crows remember human faces. They remember the people who feed them, who are kind to them. And the people who wrong them too. They don't forget. They tell each other who to look after and who to watch out for.
2804.author: Leigh Bardugo,

2805.quote: I address you all tonight for who you truly are: wizards, mermaids, travelers, adventurers, and magicians. You are the true dreamers.
2805.author: Brian Selznick,

2806.quote: Never attempt to teach a pig to sing; it wastes your time and annoys the pig.
2806.author: Robert Heinlein,

2807.quote: The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.
2807.author: Ben Okri

2808.quote: Dogs are our link to paradise. They don't know evil or jealousy or discontent. To sit with a dog on a hillside on a glorious afternoon is to be back in Eden, where doing nothing was not boring--it was peace.
2808.author: Milan Kundera

2809.quote:
My only love sprung from my only hate!
Too early seen unknown, and known too late!
Prodigious birth of love it is to me,
That I must love a loathed enemy.
2809.author: William Shakespeare

2810.quote: Imagination is everything. It is the preview of life's coming attractions.
2810.author: Albert Einstein

2811.quote: Whatever you do, you need courage. Whatever course you decide upon, there is always someone to tell you that you are wrong. There are always difficulties arising that tempt you to believe your critics are right. To map out a course of action and follow it to an end requires some of the same courage that a soldier needs. Peace has its victories, but it takes brave men and women to win them.
2811.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

2812.quote:
Can you be a girl for a few seconds?"
"I'm always a girl" I frown.
"You know what I mean. Like a silly, annoying girl"
I twirl my hair around my finger. "Kay.
2812.author: Veronica Roth,

2813.quote: One must dare to be happy.
2813.author: Gertrude Stein

2814.quote: You think the dead we loved ever truly leave us? You think that we don't recall them more clearly in times of great trouble?
2814.author: J.K. Rowling,

2815.quote: One of the deep secrets of life is that all that is really worth the doing is what we do for others.
2815.author: Lewis Carroll

2816.quote: A question that sometimes drives me hazy: am I or are the others crazy?
2816.author: Albert Einstein

2817.quote: I feel free and strong. If I were not a reader of books I could not feel this way.
2817.author: Walter Tevis

2818.quote: I just want to be wonderful.
2818.author: Marilyn Monroe

2819.quote: I find out a lot about myself by sleeping. Dreams, they are who I am when I'm too tired to be me.
2819.author: Jarod Kintz,

2820.quote: I like it when a flower or a little tuft of grass grows through a crack in the concrete. It's so fuckin' heroic.
2820.author: George Carlin

2821.quote: Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.
2821.author: Robert Frost

2823.quote: You make me want to live, Rowan. Not survive; not exist. Live.
2823.author: Sarah J. Maas,

2824.quote: None of us knows what might happen even the next minute, yet still we go forward. Because we trust. Because we have faith.
2824.author: Paulo Coelho

2825.quote: It crosses my mind that Cinna's calm and normal demeanor masks a complete madman.
2825.author: Suzanne Collins,

2826.quote: That's what fiction is for. It's for getting at the truth when the truth isn't sufficient for the truth.
2826.author: Tim O'Brien

2827.quote: If Peeta and I were both to die, or they thought we were....My fingers fumble with the pouch on my belt, freeing it. Peeta sees it and his hand clamps on my wrist. "No, I won't let you." "Trust me," I whisper. He holds my gaze for a long moment then lets go. I loosen the top of the pouch and pour a few spoonfuls of berries into his palm. Then I fill my own. "On the count of three?" Peeta leans down and kisses me once, very gently. "The count of three," he says. We stand, our backs pressed together, our empty hands locked tight. "Hold them out. I want everyone to see," he says. I spread out my fingers, and the dark berries glisten in the sun. I give Peeta's hand one last squeeze as a signal, as a good-bye, and we begin counting. "One." Maybe I'm wrong. "Two." Maybe they don't care if we both die. "Three!" It's too late to change my mind. I lift my hand to my mouth taking one last look at the world. The berries have just passed my lips when the trumpets begin to blare. The frantic voice of Claudius Templesmith shouts above them. "Stop! Stop! Ladies and gentlemen, I am pleased to present the victors of the 74th Hunger Games, Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark! I give you - the tributes of District 12!
2827.author: Suzanne Collins,

2828.quote: Each night, when I go to sleep, I die. And the next morning, when I wake up, I am reborn.
2828.author: Mahatma Gandhi

2829.quote:
Demons run when a good man goes to war
Night will fall and drown the sun
When a good man goes to war

Friendship dies and true love lies
Night will fall and the dark will rise
When a good man goes to war

Demons run, but count the cost
The battle's won, but the child is lost
2829.author: Steven Moffat

2830.quote: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
2830.author: Mother Teresa

2831.quote: If you don't go after what you want, you'll never have it. If you don't ask, the answer is always no. If you don't step forward, you're always in the same place.
2831.author: Nora Roberts

2832.quote: Not everything that is faced can be changed, but nothing can be changed until it is faced.
2832.author: James Baldwin

2833.quote: This is how it works. I love the people in my life, and I do for my friends whatever they need me to do for them, again and again, as many times as is necessary. For example, in your case you always forgot who you are and how much you're loved. So what I do for you as your friend is remind you who you are and tell you how much I love you. And this isn't any kind of burden for me, because I love who you are very much. Every time I remind you, I get to remember with you, which is my pleasure.
2833.author: James Lecesne

2834.quote: Ignorance killed the cat; curiosity was framed!
2834.author: C. J. Cherryh

2835.quote: I've begun to realize that you can listen to silence and learn from it. It has a quality and a dimension all its own.
2835.author: Chaim Potok,

2836.quote: We are all born mad. Some remain so.
2836.author: Samuel Beckett

2837.quote:
I will take the sun in my mouth
and leap into the ripe air 
Alive 
with closed eyes
to dash against darkness
2837.author: E.E. Cummings,

2838.quote: A man should hear a little music, read a little poetry, and see a fine picture every day of his life, in order that worldly cares may not obliterate the sense of the beautiful which God has implanted in the human soul.
2838.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

2839.quote: The past beats inside me like a second heart.
2839.author: John Banville,

2840.quote: It may help to understand human affairs to be clear that most of the great triumphs and tragedies of history are caused, not by people being fundamentally good or fundamentally bad, but by people being fundamentally people.
2840.author: Neil Gaiman,

2841.quote: We are travelers on a cosmic journey,stardust,swirling and dancing in the eddies and whirlpools of infinity. Life is eternal. We have stopped for a moment to encounter each other, to meet, to love, to share.This is a precious moment. It is a little parenthesis in eternity.
2841.author: Paulo Coelho,

2842.quote: If the person you are talking to doesn't appear to be listening, be patient. It may simply be that he has a small piece of fluff in his ear.
2842.author: A.A. Milne,

2843.quote: All humans make mistakes. What determines a person's character aren't the mistakes we make. It's how we take those mistakes and turn them into lessons rather than excuses.
2843.author: Colleen Hoover,
